loans.name: Cleofe Eufemia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "LOS DIAMANTES"; El banco esta situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cleofe; ella es casada y tiene 43 años de edad; la socia esta alternando su trabajo con la actividad por campaña navideña la socia invertira el prestamo en la compra de juguetes al por mayor, la socia comprara todos los juguetes que estan de moda y los vendera de manera ambulatoria desde una semana antes de navidad en la feria de San Pedro. La socia desea invertir en esta campaña para generar ingresos propios y hacer un capital de trabajo para poner un negocio el año que viene. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de juguetes al por mayor.

La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Diamonds” Community Bank. This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.
This member’s name is Mrs. Cleofe. She is married and 43 years old. She does two different jobs. In the Christmas season she uses this loan to buy toys wholesale. She buys popular toys and sells them by walking around the San Pedro fair the week before Christmas. She would like to use the income from this activity to start a business next year. She would spend the loan money to buy toys wholesale. 
She promises to pay her loan payments consistently.

loans.use: to buy toys wholesale and sell them at Christmas fairs.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Sabina;  La socia tiene 34 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion y venta de quesos,ella reparte a las diferentes tiendas que venden quesos,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de quesos . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leche y otros insumos para hacer los quesos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Sabina is 34 years old, married and has four children. She is still in the cheese-making and selling business, and delivers to different stores that sell her cheeses. With the income from this job, she is managing to help her children get ahead. She now wishes to expand and improve the business so she is seeking a loan to buy milk and other ingredients to make the cheese.

Sabina is grateful for this much-needed loan and promises to make the repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy milk and other ingredients to make cheese

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco, de 50 años, es una hombre amable y muy trabajador, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene una hija de 4 años y un hijo politico de 11 años a quien cría y quiere como un hijo. Él vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y sus hijos, quienes dependen de él para poder tener una buena educación y alimentación.
El trabajo de Marco consiste en la fabricación de joya en oro y plata, tiene dos taller uno en la ciudad de Lima y uno en su casa, desde su casa le hacen el pedidos, en Lima los confeccionan. Tiene cinco personas trabajando para él en su taller. Nos comenta que se inicio siendo trabajador de una empresa que se dedicaba  los mismo, por ello es que decidió hacerse independiente y hoy en día le esta yendo muy bien.
De todo lo que invierte gana un porcentaje de 30 a 40 %, es por eso que es muy rentable, además de tener otros ingresos trabajando a lado de su conviviente. Espera mas adelante poner un taller en la ciudad y así evitarse de estar teniendo que esperar mucho tiempo a que le envíen sus pedidos de la ciudad de Lima. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro ladose siente muy comprometido una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. 
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará oro en bruto y de ahí se encargará de darles acabado y venderlos.
texts.en:
Marco is 50 years old. He is a kind and hardworking man. He lives with his spouse, with whom he has a 4 year old daughter and an 11 year old son whom he raises as his own. He lives in his own house with his wife and children, who depend on him for their education and food. 

Marco's work is making gold and silver jewelry. He has two workshops. One in the city of Lima and one at his house. The orders are made at his house and they are filled in Lima. He has five people working for him in his workshop. He tells us that he started by working in a company doing the same thing. He decided to go off on his own and today it is going very well for him. 

From what he invests, he makes a 30 to 40 % profit, so it is very profitable. He also has other income working with his spouse. In the future, he hopes to open a workshop in the city and avoid having to wait for the orders to be sent from Lima. This will be his second loan with MFP and he hopes to have your cooperation to be able to continue with his goals.  He is also committed once again to making his payments on time, as with the previous loans he had. With the amount of 2000 soles that he has asked for, he will buy unformed gold and he will finish it and sell it.

loans.use: to buy gold to make jewelry.

loans.name: Heroes Del Chaco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HEROES DEL CHACO” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Esperanza es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, trenzado de mantas, ayudante de albañilería, costura de chamarras, venta de tostados, venta de coca y fruta.
La señora Esperanza,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela) que adquiere de la 16 de julio y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Heroes del Chaco" will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer through the Panamericana regional center. The group is composed of eight members and is directed by an executive board where Señora Esperanza is the secretary. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied; among them, we have neighborhood shops, weaving shawls, brickwork assistant, sewing sheepskin jackets, selling tostados, selling coca and fruit.

Señora Esperanza indicates that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution through a promotional invitation. At the present time she has a sewing business that she has been working in for years. The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her capital (buy fabric), which she buys from the 16 de Julio market. She makes her products on order and sells them. This form of work allows her to generate income to help her family, since she is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa propia, ella por muchos años se dedica a vender productos de perfumería de revistas de la Avon, y lo reparte entre sus clientes  trabaja de esa forma no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar dos pedidos de mercadería debido a esta época navideña y mejorara  sus ingresos y de esa forma podrá obtener lo necesario para ayudarle a su familia.
El objetivo de Cristina es mantener siempre su negocio y con el tiempo tener más productos de mayor venta y variedad  para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cristina lives with her husband and children in her own house. For many years, she has made a living selling perfume products from Avon magazines. She distributes them to her customers. This kind of job does not have a fixed schedule. 

She needs the loan to buy two orders of merchandise for the holiday season and to improve her income. In this way, she can get what she needs to help her family.

Cristina's goal is to always keep her business going and, with time, to have more varied, wholesale products for her customers.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cologne.

loans.name: Khanum

texts.en: Khanum is 37 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He is a responsible mother of four children.her husband owns a butcher shop in the market. He has been running his butcher shop for the last eleven years. He buys calves, cows and goats and sells meat from his shop to the customers.His number of clients increases due to his good attitude towards his customers. Moreover, her husband is the sole earner of the family. So he wants to increase his income. In this way he would be able to meet his family requirements. He is a very honest shop keeper. He behaves politely to people. He wants to offer chicken also to his customers. Therefore he wants to buy broilers to sell over butcher shop to improve his standard of living. For the development of his business, his wife khanum applied for the loan. So he contacted BRAC Pakistan who issued him a loan for his butcher shop. Khanum is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: investing  in her husband's butcher shop.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ms. Ama A. was born in 1958 in Lomé as the fifth of eight children in a poor family. This abundance of children prevented her parents from sending her to school, requiring her to work small jobs from a young age. She is a married mother of four children. Her husband also has no education and is without steady employment. It is thus his wife who has opened a small restaurant and who is responsible for all of the family's expenses. This restaurant featuring local dishes was opened thanks to $200 in financial support that was obtained and promptly repaid.

As her customers are increasing in number and becoming more demanding, Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $900 to remodel her restaurant, buy a freezer and build a stock of foodstuffs. It is clear that the successful completion of this project will increase Ama's income and will contribute to an improvement in her family's economic and social conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ama est née en 1958 à Lomé d’une famille pauvre de huit (08) enfants dont elle est la cinquième. Ce pléthore d’enfants n’a pas permis à ses parents de l’envoyer à l’école, l’obligeant de s’adonner très tôt aux petits commerces. Mariée, elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari, également n’a aucun niveau d’instruction et est sans emploi fixe. C’est donc la femme qui a ouvert un petit restaurant qui fait face à toutes les dépenses de la famille. Ce restaurant de mets locaux a été ouvert grâce à l’appui financier de $200 obtenus et promptement remboursés.

Sa clientèle devenant de plus en plus importante et exigeante, Madame A. sollicite un crédit de $900 pour réaménager son restaurant, acquérir un congélateur et constituer un stock de vivres. Il est tout à fait évident que la parfaite réalisation de ce projet augmentera les revenus de Ama et contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille sur le plan économique et social.

loans.use: To remodel her restaurant, buy a freezer and build a stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.en:
Nikolay K. is a member of the gypsy, or Roma, minority in Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma are a highly marginalized group concentrated on the Balkan Peninsula of southeastern Europe.

Nikolay has a small café where he and his wife serve a simple lunch menu in the Roma neighborhood. In addition, Nikolay is a musician and plays a variety of instruments in local bands. Recently, Nikolay was hired onto a Mediterranean cruise ship as part of their entertainment for employment during the summer of 2007. Although auditions were a $10 bus ride away in Sofia, Nikolay needs to pay his own fare to the port of departure in Italy. Proceeds from this loan will do two things:

- Provide working capital for the café, including a cushion to hire help when Nikolay leaves.

- Enable Nikolay to join the cruise ship, where he will be able to make an income approx. 17x greater than the average Bulgarian wage.

Lenders who are interested in learning more about the Roma culture should check out "Bury Me Standing", by Isabel Fonseca.

loans.use: Working capital; transport to employment.

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en: Sobirjon has been trading sweets for seven years. His wife helps him, and he sells his goods at Khujand's central market. Sobir started his business from a small table, and has recently expanded his place to two big tables. He requested his last loan to sell a greater assortment of candies. Now his plans are to install some shelves in his work place so that he can add washing goods to his business. Previously, Sobir worked as a barman in a restaurant.  Sobir has three children and one grandson. His eldest son is in Russia, and he would like to save for his son's wedding.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his second-hand clothing business.

loans.name: Rezent

texts.en:
Rezent U. is 48 years old and married with ten children. He’s one of the very active old farmers in his community. His farm is the main source of income for his family. Rezent started his business in the year 2000. He is from Ubiaja village of Edo State, Nigeria.

Rezent is requesting a loan of $800 for the expansion of his farm.

loans.use: To buy more seeds for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy gifts to sell during the christmas season

loans.name: Manuela Giovanni

texts.es:
Manuela Giovanni, 31, has 3 children who still depend on her. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. This hard-working and determined woman has a shop in her house that sells everything: groceries, medicines, beer, gas, etc. From 6:00 in the evening, she sets out with her food cart to sell all kinds of prepared food: hamburgers, salchipollos and fried chicken.

Manuela only finished three years of secondary school because there was no money for her to continue but she's forged ahead anyway, setting up her business and buying land to build a house. She's very pleased with what she's accomplished and to be a member of the Jerusalen ("Jerusalem") Grupo Mientras Tanto (a "Grupo Mientras Tanto" is an interim group of borrowers not large enough to form a community bank) from which she received her first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100), money that she used to buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar and other inventory. The recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.400 (about US$134), to be repaid in 4 months, will be used to buy a food cart.

Manuela dreams of finishing her house and, above all, having her own minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Manuela Giovanni a sus 31 años de edad tiene 3 hijos los cuales aún dependen de ella; vive en el Sector Nuevo Jerusalén del Distrito de La Esperanza de la Provincia de Trujillo Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Manuela es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa tiene una tienda en su casa en la que vende de todo: abarrotes, medicina, cerveza, gas, etc. a partir de la 6:00 de la tarde saca su carrito sanguchero para vender todo tipo de hamburguesas, salchipollo y pollo frito (comida rápida).

Estudió sólo hasta el tercer año de secundaria porque no contó con mas apoyo para seguir estudiando, pero aún así ha salido adelante ha implementar su negocio y ha comprado un terreno para construir su casa. Está muy contenta con lo que ha logrado y también de ser socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Jerusalén”, en este grupo obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100) que le sirvió para comprar un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar y otros abarrotes. El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.400.00 (aproximadamente $134) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo utilizará para comprar un carrito sanguchero (activo).

La señora Manuela sueña con terminar de construir su casa y sobretodo anhela mucho tener un minimarket.

loans.use: Buy a food cart.

loans.name: Emefa

texts.fr:
Emefa D., age 30, is married and the mother of three. She has been in this business for almost two years. She would like to improve her shop through this loan in order to help support her family with the profits from her sales.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Emefa D. est âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle détient ce commerce bientôt 02 ans. Elle souhaite améliorer sa boutique en accédant à ce crédit afin de participer aux charges de sa famille par les bénéfices qu’elle réalisera sur ses ventes.

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of rice, 10 cartons of canned goods, 5 cartons of sugar, and 5 cartons of milk

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Ever since he was a young boy Juan has been very hard-working, agile and happy. He inherited these traits from his parents, who were humble people with a strong work ethic that was always dedicated to making bricks. Now Juan has a young son, age 2, himself and is married. He shares the family business with his loving wife and brothers and together they work with the sole objective of doing their best and making headway with the business. The hope of Juan and his wife is to save enough to purchase their own home, and above all be able to provide for their son's education and well-being, as well as take care of their parents. Juan has been planning on buying supplies to make his bricks, and with that end he turns to you in request of a loan. Your kind heart will help Juan and his family carry out their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Juan desde niño siempre fue un muchacho muy trabajador, alegre, y ágil, esos dones los heredó de sus padres, quienes fueron personas humildes pero muy laboriosas que estuvieron dedicados desde siempre a la fabricación de ladrillos. Actualmente Juan tiene un niño de dos años y está casado, comparte el trabajo de familia con su amada esposa y hermanos y todos juntos laboran con un solo objetivo y tratan de dar lo mejor de sí para sacar adelante este negocio que están llevando a cabo en una sociedad familiar.El deseo de Don Juan y su esposa es ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar su propia casita, y sobre todo ofrecerle educación, bienestar, y atención a su hijo y ancianos padres.Él tiene pensado comprar insumos para la fabricación de sus ladrillos, con este fin recurre a ti y hace la solicitud de un préstamo.Vuestro buen corazón permitirá cumplir el proyecto de Juan.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of supplies to make bricks / Compra de mayor cantidad de insumos.

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Dorice A.. She has 2 dependents, who are her younger sisters.

In 2002 Dorice established a telecommunications business, where people pay to make phone calls, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional phone credit vouchers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of phone credit vouchers in bulk

loans.name: Michael E

texts.en: Michael E Usiaghan is married with 3 children. He is 48 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. Mr. Usiaghan has been publishing and selling books since 2004. He is requesting a loan of $450 so he can buy a printer for his business. He thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy a printer for my shop

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola makes women’s aprons that she sells in Oruro and Potosí; her husband is a taxi driver in La Paz. These two activities are the principle sources of income that support their two children. The family lives in the Puente Topater area of La Paz City.

The loan she needs is to buy another vehicle, the source of her husband’s income, as the current vehicle does not always work and is no longer suitable.

This is the fourth loan from Impro, and the evaluation qualifies her for the loan. They have been Impro clients since 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Fabiola, es confeccionista de mandiles para cholitas, que comercializa en el departamento de Oruro y Potosí; el esposo es transportista de servicio publico trabaja de Taxi en la ciudad La Paz. Estas dos actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con las que cubren la manutención de sus dos hijos. La familia vive en la Ciudad de La Paz, Zona Puente Topater.

El crédito requiere para comprar otra movilidad, fuente de trabajo del esposo ya que la movilidad con la que cuenta actualmente se encuentra muy deficiente y no trabaja continuamente.

Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Fabiola. Ellos son clientes de IMPRO desde al año 2004.

loans.use: Purchase another vehicle so her husband can continue working as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana lives in the neighborhood Anexo of Villa Venezuela, is married, is 46 years old and has three children , two that are independent and one that she still takes care of. Her husband is a painter and takes care of the home expenses.

The business of Mrs. Juana is selling clothing, shoes and cosmetics; she has eleven years of experience. She started her business with her own money. She needs a loan to invest in working capital in the form of inventory of clothing and shoes that she can then offer to her customers.

She wishes to be able to provide an education for her son and help him become a well-off man. She also wants to increase her sales and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Juana habita en el barrio Anexo de Villa Venezuela es casada y tiene 46 años de edad, con tres hijos, dos independientes y uno que está a su cargo, su esposo es pintor y aporta a los gastos de la familia.

El negocio de la Sra. Juana es la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos; tiene once años de experiencia. Su negocio lo inició con fondos propios, el préstamo lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de ropa y zapatos para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Desea poder darle educación a su hijo hasta convertirlo en un hombre de bien. y también desea poder incrementar las ventas para hacer su negocio más grande.

loans.use: Acquire a variety of clothing and shoes for sale in her business.

loans.name: Alcira De

texts.es:
Alcira is 38 years old. She owns her own house which is located in the west part of Warnes, close to the new market. She and her 39 year-old husband have two children aged 18 and 14. Alcira receives a daily rental income from two motorbike taxis and an Orient Association vehicle which services an interprovincial route. Her husband is a permanent and long-time employee at a food company where he works in the yeast plant. There is moderate amount of competition in the transportation business for this service. Her husband, on the other hand, is on a fixed contract, receives a monthly salary, and does not need to worry about competition. With the current loan Alcira bought chickens to sell in the new market near her house—she used all the loan for this purpose. She has a very good credit rating.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Alcira tiene 38 años de edad y vive en su casa que es propia y se encuentra ubicada en la zona oeste de Warnes cerca del mercado nuevo junto a su esposo Isaac que tiene 39 años de edad y sus dos hijos de 18 y 14 años de edad respectivamente. Alcira recibe una renta diaria de dos moto taxis y de un vehículo con línes en la asociación del Oriente con ruta inter provincial, por otra parte su esposo es trabajador fijo y antiguo de una empresa de ALIMENTOS donde trabaja como obrero en la planta de levaduras. La competencia es mediana en las actividades del transporte por la demanda de este servicio, por otra parte su esposo no tiene competencia por que tiene contrato fijo y percibe sueldo mensual. Con el presente crédito Marina colocó una venta de pollos en el mercado nuevo de la ciudad y que esta cerca de su casa, para este efecto invirtió todo el préstamo. Tiene muy buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell for meat.

loans.name: Zoraida De Los Angel

texts.es:
Zoraida is 52 years old and for 20 years has had a grocery store in her home. She lives in the Ticuantepe municipality. With her own efforts she was able to establish this business in which she has been successful and hopes to continue to be successful. Her husband is a farmer and Zoraida sells some of his harvests in her store. All of their children are married. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase various articles for her grocery store in order to have it well stocked so that she can maintain the clients who currently shop daily at her store. She hopes for an increase in her business to obtain better profits and to be able to grow in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Zoraida tiene 52 años de edad y 20 años de tener una pulpería en su vivienda. Habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe y con esfuerzos propios pudo poner este pequeño negocio, en el cual cuenta que le ha ido bien y que espera que vaya bien como hasta ahora. Su esposo es agricultor y parte de los productos que cosecha Doña Zoraida los vende en su pulpería. Todos sus hijos ya son casados. El préstamo será usado para la compra de artículos varios para su pulpería y así no dejar de tenerla surtida para poder mantener a sus clientes que diariamente asisten a comprar a su negocio. Espera aumenta el negocio para obtener mejores resultados, y llegar a poner una miscelánea y crecer como comerciante.

loans.use: Purchase of articles to invest in her grocery store.

loans.name: Helène

texts.fr: Helène A. est tient une boutique de boissons depuis plus de 3 ans à Kpalimé, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Hélène souhaite avec ce crédit alimenter sa boutique en achetant des boissons tels que les rhums, les vins, gin pour satisfaire la demande de la clientèle. Ce faisant, elle gagnera plus pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
Hélène A. has had a beverages shop for over three years in Kpalimé, a city located about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children, who are all in school. Hélène would like to use this loan to supply her shop through the purchase of beverages, such as rum, wine, and gin to meet customer demand. By doing this, she will earn more to provide for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages, such as rum, wine, gin

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru: Шомахмадова Мархамат жительница города Курган-Тюбе.Возраст 35 лет,замужем,имеет 3 детей.Образование средне-техническое.По специальности  учительница. Клиентка имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке. На котором торгует  женской обувью.Этот вид деятельности позволяет ей содержать свою семью.Так как муж клиентки временно не работает. Мархамат на полученный кредит планирует закупить товар.Погасит кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Marhamat S. is a resident of Qurgan-Tube. She is 35 years old, is married and has 3 children. She has a high school – technical education and is a teacher by profession. Marhamat has a small sales location at the local market where she sells women’s shoes. This business allows her to support her family as her husband is temporarily not working. Marhamat will use her loan to purchase products for sale. She will pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Aun Preab Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people in the Trapeang Chaeng village in the Takeo province in Cambodia, make up the village bank group loan and all the members plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. P. AU. is the village bank president. She is 29 years old and the mother of six children; three children are employed in a garment factory, two attend the local school, and the youngest is 4 years old.

Mrs. P. AU. has 1.5 hectares on which she grows rice and earns a living. She is also a pig breeder. This business is going well, and she is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Keo Vorn, is a construction worker, and earns a small income that helps support his family.

loans.use: Buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Betty Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Betty S., tiene un anaquel D. golosinas, en el centro D. la ciudad, desD. muy tempranas horas D. la mañana, se instala en su puesto D. venta y trabaja allí hasta finalizado el día, su anaquel esta muy bien surtido y el préstamo que solicita servira para adquirir mercadería relacionada con las fiestas D. fin D. año.
La señora tiene tres niños, dos D. los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, su esposo también colabora económicamente al presupuesto familiar y ambos se apoyan para llegar a realizar sus metas familiares.
La cliente se encuentra en su tercer crédito con la institución, demostrando bastante responsabilidad con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Betty S. has a booth selling sweets in the city center. From the early morning hours, she sets up in her booth and works all day. Her booth is well stocked and the loan that she is requesting will be used to acquire merchandise associated with the year-end celebrations. She has three children, two of whom are school aged. Her husband also provides economic support for the family budget and both help each other to realize the family's goals. This is her third loan with the institution and has demonstrated quite a bit of responsibility in repaying her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mireya Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mireya del Socorro O. tiene la edad de 33 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña Mireya tiene 2 hijas de las cuales su edades son las siguientes su hija de 14 años edad cursa el 6 grado de primaria y su hija de 4 años que cursa el 3 nivel de preescolar, su compañero de vida labora como chofer de carga pesada, sus propósitos son de darle una mejor educación a sus hijas ya que estas tienen  problemas de aprendizaje, en sus deseos esta seguir adelante con su negocio por lo que tiene que mantenerlo activo ya que este le ha generado ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijas, en sus sueños proporcionar estabilidad y seguridad a sus hijas para un futuro.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos en la que vende productos como: perfumes, cremas, lociones y otros, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 6 años, su negocio inicia por una consejera de la empresa avon que le hablo de las diferentes formas de vender los productos  por lo que decide ingresar a este tipo de negocio por lo que le gusto y se propuso que este pasaría a formar parte de su trabajo y así obtiene este medio generador de ingresos para su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar la compras de sus productos en las diferentes casas comerciales como lo es: perfumes, talco, brillos y cremas.
texts.en:
Señora Mireya del Socorro O. is 33 years old and lives with her partner. She has two daughters, who are 14 and 4 years old. Her older daughter is in 6th grade, and her younger daughter is in Level III of preschool. Her life partner is a truck driver who moves heavy loads. Her goal for the future is to give her daughters a better education, since they both have learning disabilities. She wants to continue moving forward with her business. She needs to keep the business active, since it has provided her with the income she needs to help her daughters get ahead in life. One of her dreams is to give her daughters more stability and security for the future.

Señora Mireya sells cosmetics like perfumes, creams, lotions and other products. She is an ambulatory vendor, and has had her business for the past six years. She started it thanks to a representative of the Avon company, who told her about the different ways to sell Avon products. So she decided to give it a try, found that she enjoyed the work and decided to make it a part of her job. Her work now generates income for her family. She will use her loan as working capital to buy her products (perfume, talc, polishes and creams) from different stores.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy creams, polishes, talc and perfumes

loans.name: Dani

texts.en: Dani is a 25-year-old single man, living in Haret Hreik-Beirut. Five years ago, he started working with a friend on home electrical projects. As an enthusiastic electrician, today Dani wants to undertake a new freelance project. He is asking for a loan of $1200 to help him undertake the project.

loans.use: Freelance electrical project

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La sra. Adela reside ene. Barrió Isaías Gómez, en la ciudad de Managua
Y tiene 33 años de edad, con cinco hijos de3, 9, 10,12 y 18 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante ambulante de ropa, y otros productos. Doña Adela tiene una abarrotaría en el mercado, y por las noches vende fritanga para tener otros ingresos y poder subsistir ya que su familia es numerosa, con este crédito va  comprar granos básicos, y cereales, leche en pote entre otros para surtir su negocio. Sus planes es poner una pulpería en su casa y poder remodelar su infraestructura para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. a si como dar estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adela lives in the neighborhood of Isaías Gómez in Managua. She is 33 years old and has five children aged 3, 9, 10, 12 and 18. Her husband is a salesman who sells clothing and other products. Mrs. Adela runs a stand in the market and sells fried snacks, "fritanga", in the evenings as a second source of income which helps her feed her large family. With this loan she plans to buy simple grains, cereals and bottled milk, among other things, to help stock her stand. Her plan is to remodel her home so that she can install a small store and provide better service to her customers and thus, provide an education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Grains and Cereals

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: S. is 36 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province. She has three children, all of whom are single and live with her. Her older daughter is employed as a garment worker, which adds to the family's income. S. is married to Nginh, 32, who is a local construction foreman with a net income of $3 a day. S. grows vegetables behind her house and has sold her gourds in bulk since 2003. She also sells fish at the market that she gathers in bulk from a fisherman. Her sales have increased her family’s income. However, S. now faces difficulties with transportation and with the condition of her garden soil. She is looking for a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike and fertilizer, which will help her out with her business, and will help the family reach a better standard of living.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike and fertilizer.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo A. is 39 years old and married with 6 children. She sells eggs and palm oil. She hopes to expand this business. She needs the loan amount of N30,000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Tinuke

texts.en: Tinuke G. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She sells sarongs at retail to her customers. She hawks her goods with a tray on her head from street to street within her community. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte A. is a 39 year old widow.  She has 9 children and lives in Tuburan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur.  Charlotte has applied to Pagalaum Coop for a loan amounting to PHP 3,000 (USD 75), payable in 6 months, so that she can purchase 2 piglets.  She plans that the income generated from the pigs after 4 months will help to cover the educational expenses of her children. She has also engaged in a snacks business which helps in providing for their daily needs. For other source of resources, she receives a monthly pension.

loans.use: To purchase 2 piglets.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace earns her living by selling bottled water and other beverages. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to be granted a loan in the amount of N150,000 in order to purchase more bottled water and drinks to sell.

She is 63 years old and is married with three children.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bottled water and beverages to sell

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 32 años, es soltero y vive en una casa alquilada, es muy atento y preocupado, y tiene muchas ganas forjarse un buen futuro. Todos los días, acompañado de su camioneta (combi), sale muy temprano de su casa, dadas las 5 de la mañana, ya tiene que estar formado en espera a que su línea de transportes le de la orden para salir. Su ruta es la número 19 y es una de las más difíciles para cubrir, ya que la gran cantidad de pasajeros, junto al mal estado de las carreteras, hacen que tenga que hacer un mayor esfuerzo. Lo que más le gusta a Víctor es conducir, es por eso que a la edad de 25 años decidió, con la ayuda de sus padres, comprar una combi, la cual hasta ahora lo acompaña. Él considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que lidiar con algunas personas que no quieren pagarle o le pagan menos de la tarifa regular, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que realizarlo, poniéndole todo su empeño. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy contento por la oportunidad de obtenerlo, ya que piensa invertirlo bien, en su banco comunal es un socio muy respetado, debido a que siempre pone orden en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará nuevas llantas para su combi y así podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Víctor is a 32-year-old single man who lives in a rented home. He is very attentive and concerned, and he has a great desire to shape a good future for himself. Everyday, he leaves his house with his van (VW bus) at around 5 in the morning because he has to wait for his transportation line to give him the orders to leave. His route is number 19, which is one of the most difficult ones to cover because of the large amount of passengers and the bad road conditions, so he has to make a big effort. What Victor most likes is driving, which is why he decided to buy a VW bus (which he is still using) at age 25 with the help of his parents. He thinks that the most difficult part of his job is dealing with people who do not want to pay, or who pay a less than the normal fare. Even so, he knows that this is his job and he has to give it his all. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is very happy for this opportunity to receive one because he is planning to invest it well. He is a very well-respected member of his microfinance institute because he always establishes order in the group. With the 1,000.00 PEN loan that he is requesting, he will purchase new tires for his vehicle so that he can offer better services to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for his van

loans.name: Kafayat

texts.en: Kafayat sells drinks and sachet water, and she also produces cellophane. Kafayat is 27 years old and married with one child. Kafayat lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell. She is grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support in these turbulent times.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 43 years old, married and a mother with seven children. All her children are currently in the primary and the junior high school, respectively, in the community where they live. Cecilia is very humble and committed to her work. She sells smoked cow meat in bulk at the community market where she lives. She takes stock of cow meat from the northern region of Ghana.

Sometimes she spends weeks at the northern region so that she can buy more to supply to her customers. This, she said, prevents her from frequent traveling. She requests a loan to buy more smoked meat to upgrade her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of smoked meat.

loans.name: Gladis Alvarenga De

texts.en:
Señora Gladis Alvarenga is a 46-year-old mother of 2 adult daughters who lives with her family in the city of Carapeguá.  She started her business in 1992 with a small shop in the local city market together with her husband, using their own capital. Because of growing demand, she later worked with the Kiva field partner lender Fundación Paraguaya which was recommended by her brother who was also a client of the institution.

It is worth pointing out that thanks to her effort, she was able to achieve goals such as building her own house, giving her daughters the opportunity to become college graduates, and also expanding her business since she has already built a great number of market shops to sell at.

She is requesting a loan to purchase shirts, pants, jerseys, and coats.

loans.use: The purchase of shirts, pants, jerseys, and coats.

loans.name: Leonarda Santusa

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda es socia del Banco Comunal “Diana D. Gales”, en el distrito D. Puno, provincia D. Puno, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 68 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda y es madre D. 07 hijos (dos a su cargo), ella es iletrada.  Vive en el Barrio Miraflores.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 6 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocio D. compra-venta D. coca (planta medicinal).

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar coca, mixtura, vinos, incienso, etc. La señora Leonarda surte su mercadería D. acuerdo a la época.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando así D. esta manera pueD. ayudar a su familia.

A ella le gustan las facilidades D. los pagos.
texts.en:
Señora Leonarda is a member of the Diana D. Gales (Diana, Princess of Wales) Communal Bank in the District, Province and Department of Puno. She is 68 years of age, a widow and mother of seven children, two of whom are under her care. She is not literate and lives in Barrio Miraflores. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years. Her first loan was for 300 New Sols which she used as working capital for her business buying and selling coca (the medicinal plant). Currently, she needs an additional loan of 1,000 New Sols with which to be able to buy coca, concoctions, wines, incense, etc. Señora Leonarda's selection of merchandise varies with the season. Her desire is to continue working in this fashion so she can proviD. for her family. She appreciates the easy payment plan on her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coca, concoctions, wines, incense, etc.

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.en: Diomedes is 47 years old and he is managing a repair shop, he is skillful in repairing some damage appliances such as electric fan, washing machine, iron and other appliances. He wants to double his income in order to provide the needs of his family. He is hoping that he could avail the loan that he is requesting which is amounting to PHP5, 000.00. The said amount will serve as a big help to have additional business capital to be able to increase his income. He works hard to be able to provide the needs of his family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Yanetd

texts.es:
Yanetd tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en su casa propia y su más ansiado deseo es tener una buena posición económica para educar a su hija. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, lo cual realiza a domicilio y en las calles, por lo que en ocasiones aprovecha las ferias de su ciudad para ofrecer los productos que tiene en stock. Pero generalmente, Yanetd vende a través de los catálogos, siendo sus vecinas y familiares los clientes que con más frecuencia la visitan, ya que por su gran sentido del humor sabe ganarse el cariño de las personas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la amistad que hace con sus clientas, pues en sus horas de visita siempre tiene un tiempo para dialogar con ellas. En estos cuatro años como promotora de ventas considera que lo más difícil es salir a las calles y realizar las cobranzas, debido a que algunas clientas se retrasan en sus pagos perjudicando su capital de trabajo. Para el futuro desea abrir una tienda de cosméticos en su casa, la cual ya es conocida por sus clientes, solo requiere de un espacio adecuado y de exhibidores para sus productos.
Este es su tercer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y el tiempo que lleva siendo parte de un banco comunal la ha ayudado a mejorar sus relaciones interpersonales. Con los mil soles de crédito que solicita comprará los productos que están de oferta en los catálogos con el fin de contar con productos en stock.
texts.en:
Yanetd is 36 years old, and a very happy woman. She lives in her own home and her greatest wish is to be in a financial position to educate her daughter. Her business is the sale of cosmetics out of her home and as a street vendor. She offers her stock on hand for sale at town fairs; however, in general Yanetd deals in catalog sales. The customers that visit her most frequently are her neighbors and family members, because her great sense of humor has earned her their love. What she likes best about her job is the friendship that she has with her clients, and she always takes time to visit when they come calling. In the four years she has been in sales what has been most difficult is taking to the streets to collect payments, because some customers are behind on their payments and that is impacting her working capital. In the future she would like to open a cosmetics shop in her home because it is a location that is already familiar to her customers. She is just in need of adequate space and display cases for her products. This is Yanetd's third loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and membership in a community bank has helped her to improve her interpersonal relationships. With the 1000 Peruvian soles that she is requesting, Yanetd will buy products for sale in the catalogs in order to have more stock on hand.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 41 years old  and married to Andres. They are thankful for they were blessed with four children, one of whom is is already married.  They live in the village of Sta. Rosa, Santiago City. 

Rosana manages a store while also selling fish and baked breads in their village twice a week.  She would like to take a loan of PHP5,000 for use as additional capital in her vending business. This amount will really help her to make her business grow by having more goods to sell.

Rosana budgets her income for her childrens school allowance, projects and tuition fees. She hopes that she will be able to continue sending her children to school until college.

loans.use: Additional capital for the growth of her business

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Alejandrina; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 47 años de edad, ella es natural de la ciudad de Puno, la socia es madre soltera, ella tiene 6 hijos, los cuales a la actualidad son independientes; ella alterna sus diversas actividades con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia vende productos secos, como granos de maíz, habas secas, frijoles secos, lentejas, porotos, pallares, entre mas variedades andinas.  

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas e el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Las Triunfadoras (Victorious Women) communal bank located in the district of Andahuaylillas, 5 minutes from the city of Cusco. Our member is 47 years old. She is a native of the city of Puno. The member is a single mother. She has six children who are currently independent.

Her diverse activities include a retail business. She sells dried products such as grains of corn, dried beans, lentils, string beans, and a variety of Andean beans including porotos and pallares, among others.

Our member is thankful for and values the loan and promises to make payments on her debt through the established installments.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dried grains and beans

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity sells food at the market in Asaba, Delta State. She has been in this business for a long time, and is a focused, hard worker. This is the high season for her sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Charity is 32 years old and married with 5 children. Charity's four eldest children are all in school. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more food to sell, and thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años, es madre de 4 hijos y vive junto a su esposo, quien es mecánico de motores pesados y también se dedica a la venta de madera.
Desde hace 5 años Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa, los cuales lleva de casa en casa por los distintos lugares su localidad, dejándolos al crédito o al contado.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto con las personas, con quienes comparte momentos muy amenos, además le es rentable porque trabaja para una marca cosmética muy reconocida y es por ello que sus clientes no dudan en requerir de sus productos. A pesar que esta labor es muy cansada porque tiene que caminar constantemente, Rosa se esfuerza porque quiere mejorar la economía de su hogar.

Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal llamado “Futuro mejor” y le gusta mucho porque entre todos los integrantes se conocen y son responsables con sus trabajos y pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos de belleza y ropa para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old, the mother of 4 children, and lives together with her husband, who is a motor mechanic and also sells wood. For the last 5 years Rosa has made a living by selling beauty products and clothing, which she takes from house to house in various places in her town, accepting credit or cash as payment. The thing she likes about her job is being in contact with people, with whom she shares very enjoyable moments. Furthermore, it is profitable for her, because she works for a very well-known brand of cosmetics. For this reason, her clients don't hesitate to buy her products. Even though this job is very tiring, since she has to walk constantly, Rosa puts forth a lot of effort because she wants to improve the financial situation in her home. This is her second loan with MFP. She is part of a communal bank called "Futuro mejor", and she likes it a lot, because all of the members know each other and are responsible with their jobs and payments. With the money that she is now requesting, she will purchase more beauty products and clothing to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
El señor Rene A. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Chapuma, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
El señor Rene trabaja como albañil en la ciudad de Cochabamba y su esposa es cocinera, con un puesto ambulante, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una loza de hormigón armado para poder construir posteriormente una habitación en planta alta.
Esta es la octava vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Rene A. lives in his own home, in the zone of Chapuma, the peripheral area of the city of La Paz, with his wife and three children. Rene works as a bricklayer in the city of Cochabamba and his wife is a cook with a moving cart, income which maintains their family. The requested loan is for the construction of a reinforced concrete slab to be able to later construct a room upstairs. This is the eighth time that he has solicited a loan and the completed socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies him and he can access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of constructing of a reinforced concrete slab to later construct a room.

loans.name: Christine Nduku

texts.en: Christine is married and has two children.  She runs the Dema Chemist and Cosmetics Shop, where she sells cosmetics, pain killers and antibiotics to walk-ins and frequent customers.  Her business has been located at Ninth Street in Eastleigh town for the last two years.  Her business challenges are competition from similar businesses and price inflation of products.  Christine will use her loan of KES 20,000 to increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: We Too Can Do Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'We Too Can Do' group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the city of Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. These women want a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to boost their businesses. With such a loan, they can add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make better sales, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is 27-year-old Rosaline M. Z., in the middle of the photo. This mother of 3 is single and was born in Pujenjun, in southern Sierra Leone. Two of her children are attending primary school and one is a baby. Rosaline has been selling shoes and rich cakes for 6 months now. With her share of this loan, she can expand her business. She will use the loan to buy several dozens of shoes. She will also use the remainder of the money to invest in her rich cake business by buying working materials – rice, plantains, bananas, oil, and so on.

loans.use: To buy dozens of shoes and invest in her rich cake business

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled, a 36-year-old married man with one child, has owned a jewelry shop in his town since 1989. He is well-known in the whole region after this long experience. Specializing in selling and repairing jewelry, to satisfy market demand Khaled is requesting a loan of $700 to buy a laptop to prepare jewelry designs.

loans.use: To buy a laptop

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Mrs. Leap O. is a villager in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province and she is 38 years old. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a shoe factory while the others are attending the local public school.

Mrs. Leap O. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family living. Moreover, she also owns a general store.

However hard this family tries to work with their careers, they are not able to earn enough income. Thus, in order to improve the family’s living conditions, Mrs. Leap O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to re-sell to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Enrique Camilo

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce el señor Enrique Camilo R. se desempeña como un pequeño agricultor donde comercializa leche de sus propios animales de su finca ubicada en el caserío Esquipulas del municipio de El Sauce donde tiene alrededor de 50 años de experiencia en esta labor.
Ha tomado la decisión de hacer una cerca en su finca y es por esta razón que está solicitando el crédito el cuál será invertido en la compra de alambres para utilizarla en la cerca y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su finca que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Enrique Camilo R. is a small farmer in El Sauce. He sells milk from his own animals on his farm that is in the Esquipulas settlement of El Sauce. He has about 50 years experience in this work. He has decided to build a fence on his farm and needs funds to do so; the money will be used to buy wire fencing so that his farm's, which so needs his attention, conditions will be improved

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wire fencing for his farm.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia O. is married, has 6 children, and is also a grandmother. Her husband is a retired forest guard, while Felicia herself works as a trader, selling traditional beads and jewellery at retail prices to customers in Benin city. Nigerians love traditional beads, and they are part of all traditional clothing items. The traditional beads in Nigeria are also a mark of honour and respect. 
Felicia currently hopes to expand her business; however, she faces the challenge of insufficient capital. She is therefore requesting a loan of a NGN 150,000 to purchase additional beads and jewellery items for sale. Felicia is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of traditional beads and jewellery for sale

loans.name: Sriyani

texts.en:
Sriyani is a 27-year-old married woman living with her husband and one child. She is living in the town of Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka.

Sriyani has a business that consists of making and selling dresses. Her mother is living with the family, and she provides support for Sriyani’s business.

After attending school, Sriyani got started doing this business. She is educated and is a young lady. She can demonstrate strong leadership for any group and is a good team worker. She does her job on time and is a very honest lady. 

Sriyani is seeking a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to expand her business. Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more cloth for dressmaking

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Many people in Busuyi, Jinja are increasingly adopting an inclination towards M. Sheriff’s fried fish delicacy. The fact that he operates in a fishing neighborhood in Busuyi landing site means he has steady fresh fish supplies any time he wants them. He has sustained his business for a haul of three years. Because of these graces he is enjoying, he foresees a bright future for himself and his family of five children.

Sheriff is a 45-year-old happily-married man. In a month, he says he makes profits to the tune of 100,000 shillings (approximately 50 USD) and he is upbeat that, with this loan, his prospects of further success will rise. With the auspices of this loan he wants to buy fishing nets and a boat.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and a boat

loans.name: Iyunge Group

texts.fr:
Pascasie N. est une commerçante âgée de 33 ans qui habite la Commune de Rugombo dans la Province de Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle  achète des haricots  pour les revendre au  marché central de Rugombo. C’est un métier qu’elle a  commencé à pratiquer avec  le crédit de Turame qui arrive maintenant au 4e cycle ayant reçu respectivement pour les trois premiers cycles : 60,000fbu ; 200,000fbu et 270,000fbu.

Elle est mère de 3 garçons respectivement de 10 ans, 6 ans et 4ans dont les deux premiers étudient. Elle lutte pour que ses enfants puissent étudier et terminer avec succès pour devenir responsables et mener une vie heureuse. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour acheter de plus grandes quantités de  haricots mais aussi de nouveaux produits alimentaires à revendre aux clients. Elle a l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice avec cette augmentation de son capital. 

Elle est une des membres du groupe «IYUNGE.»
texts.en:
Pascasie N., 33, is a businesswoman who lives in the township of Rugombo in the province of Cibitoke in the west of Burundi. She buys beans to resell at the central market of Rugombo. She started up her business with a loan from Turame and she is presently on her fourth loan, having received the amounts of 60,000 fbu ; 200,000 fbu et 270,000 fbu for her first three loans. She is the mother of three sons, 10, 6, and 4 years old. The two older boys are enrolled in school. She makes a big effort to see that her children will be able to stay in school and graduate successfully, so that they can become responsible adults and have a happy life. Pascasie is requesting this Kiva loan to buy bigger quantities of beans, as well as other, different foodstuffs to sell to her customers. She hopes to make a lot of profit due to this increase in her working capital. She is a member of a group called « IYUNGE ».

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing bigger quantities of beans but also new products to sell her customers

loans.name: Mi Flor Group

texts.es:
Prudencia F. de 54 años, es casada y vive en la ciudad de El Alto en la zona Cosmos 79, desde hace más de 15 años. Ella   tiene el negocio de elaboración de  prendas de vestir hace mucho tiempo, ha logrado instalar un pequeño taller en su domicilio y necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima.
Las demás integrantes de esta asociación comunal Mi Flor, que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani, tienen diversos negocios como:  tienda de barrio, venta de zapatillas, venta de alimento seco, venta de comida (salchipapa) y venta de medias. 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima.
texts.en:
Prudencia is 54 years old. She is married and has lived in El Alto, in the Cosmos 79 zone for more than 15 years. She has been in business, making articles of clothing for a long time and has managed to set up a small shop in her home. She needs this loan in order to buy supplies. The other members of this communal group, “Mi Flor’” (My Flower) which is part of the lager Collpani group, have various other businesses, such as neighborhood stores, shoe sales, sales of dry goods, food sales (sausage and potato), and hosiery sales. They all need this loan in order to buy inventory, or supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadores 3 Group

texts.en:
Felicia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Triunfadores (Triumphant Women). Her story is representative of her group and generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the North Coast with an economy dominated by tourism, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children.

Felicia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling shoes and clothing by purchasing a dozen pairs of shoes and a half dozen blouses to sell in her neighborhood. She will use the profits to invest in her home by changing the walls from wood to cement block, an important improvement in the termite-infested and hurricane-prone Dominican Republic. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase blouses and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying boards for making and selling furniture

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es comerciante, y vende productos de belleza, de la marca  Avon, como ser: cosméticos Perfumes, y otros productos de belleza.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de bajo Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Compra de cosméticos, perfumes y todo producto de belleza)
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde junio del 2008, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Sara is a merchant who sells beauty products from the Avon line such as cosmetics, perfumes, and other items. Her home is located in the lower area of Irpavi in the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used as operating capital to buy cosmetics, perfumes, and other types of beauty products. Sara has been a long-time client of Impro since June 2008. Her credit history qualifies her as a Level 1 client, which means she has an excellent payment record and is eligible to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, perfumes, and other types of beauty products

loans.name: Ol

texts.en: Mrs. Ol H. is a 27 year old married woman and she is a villager who lives in Tuol Kandal Tonle village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Pen Keo, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice and they are also farmers who work very hard to support their family living. With the farm, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Ol H. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, rice see, and to pay for hire laborers to plow the farm and to pay for hirer farming laborers to cultivate rice. Aside from farmer, Mr. Pen Keo is also construction worker who is able to receive a little salary to hold up his family.  This couple has two children, one in a student and another one is 5 years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, rice see, and to pay for hire laborers to plow the farm and to pay for hirer farming laborers to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Evelyn Anyango

texts.en:
Evelyn Anyango is a 30 year old lady from Kisumu City who is married to Norbert Oduor. They have two daughters, Sylivia, nine years old and Grace, three years old. They live at Brilliant estate in the heart of Kisumu city.

Evelyn runs a water business, whereby she sells water to residents within her estate. Selling water in Kisumu city is big business due to a scarcity of the commodity in the area. Due to this fact, Evelyn has a ready market for her business. She makes a monthly income of KES 12,000 ($152). She is taking her first loan from Kadet Limited and she plans to use this money to buy better water pipes for her business. Evelyn will also use part of the money to expand her other business, second hand clothing.

Evelyn describes herself as an ambitious lady and her great ambition in the future is to buy water tanks for water storage during dry season. She also wants her two daughters to have access to better education.

loans.use: To buy better water pipes for the business.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob J., age 51, is a farmer. He sells his farm produce in order to earn a living. He is applying for a loan from Kadet Ltd. in order to buy a "My Sunshine Box," an electrical product that will help him to light his home more efficiently. At present, Jacob’s family uses lantern lamps for lighting, and this is highly cumbersome for them. The children struggle considerably when doing their homework at night. He is eager for the day when electricity will be installed in his rural home. 

Jacob has serviced a loan before with Kadet Ltd., and he paid it off promptly and without any difficulties.

Jacob is married to Margaret Odongo and they have four children, all of whom are under 18 years of age and all of whom attend school. The family lives in a rural area called Ngiya.

loans.use: To buy a "My Sunshine Box" for home lighting purposes

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
Madame ROSE G. est une femme de 82 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants majeurs. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGASCOP depuis son inauguration il y a de cela 14 ans. Elle a 28 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. 

Elle est éleveuse de porcs. A cause de son âge avancé, elle est aidée par ses enfants pour bien mener cette activité qu'elle pratique depuis plus de 20 ans

Avec son crédit elle va acheter 30 pourceaux à raison de 15.000 francs cfa, et de la nourriture pour leurs alimentation.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels, renforcer son épargne et participer à la prise en charge financière de la famille.
texts.en:
Rose G. is an 82 year old woman. She is married and she is the mother of 6 grown children. She has been a member of the Community Bank NGASCOP (Kiva field Partner) since its inception 14 years ago. She has attained 28 past loans and she always repaid the funds without any trouble. She is a pig farmer. Because she is an elderly person she gets help from her children in running the business, one that she has had for more than 20 years. With the help of this loan she will purchase 30 piglets at 15 francs and she will also purchase feed for them. Her goal is to be able to provide for her own needs, to save money, and contribute to the family's finances.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 30 piglets.

loans.name: Cheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheang S., age 36, has established a small family home located in Kompong Tom province where she lives with other family members. Her family has four kids, two of whom are employed and the other two attend school.

To share responsibility for her family, Cheang S. owns a cart that she uses to sell bean juice in and around her community. She is able to make $4 of profit a day to be used to control the financial problems of her family. She always gets help from her husband in producing the bean juice.

Cheang S. wants to own a motorbike to connect with her existing cart so that she can sell to people farther away. As she doesn’t have the money to buy one, she needs a loan in the amount of $900 to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for her business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor es soltero, vive en el barrio Obrero de la ciudad de Pilar.
Vive en casa de sus padres, donde se refleja que poseen con todas las comodidades para una familia trabajadora.
El mismo es comerciante, cuenta con una  empresa de ventas de todos tipos de mercaderías en general, ropas, accesorios , juegos de azar en  general, su rubro es comprar las mercaderias y los comercializa en la ciudad de pilar y ciudades vecinas, dicho trabajo lo realiza en su motocicleta recorriendo la zona, a cada unas de sus clientes.
Solicita el crédito para compras de mercaderías para su negocio como: ropas, calzados,  juguetes y otros.
Cuenta con una antigüedad en el ramo más de 15 años, brindando sus buenos servicios a sus clientelas.
Cliente manifiesta que con la ayuda del crédito se ha fortalecido  mas su microempresa y  agradece por los buenos servicios que les brinda la fundación paraguaya y kiva.
texts.en:
He is single and lives in the Obrero neighborhood in the city of Pilar in his parents’ house where they have all the comforts typical of a hard working family.

He is a merchant.  He has a company where he sells all kinds of general merchandise:  clothing, accessories, games of chance in general.  He operates buying merchandise and then reselling it in the city of Pilar and adjoining cities.  He does this work moving from place to place on his motorcycle to visit his customers.

He is requesting funds to buy merchandise like: clothes, footwear, toys and others.

He has 15 years experience in this line of work providing his customers with good service.

He states that with help from the loan he has strengthened his micro business and he is grateful for the services that Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva provide.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: clothes, footwear and toys.

loans.name: Digna Isabel

texts.es:
Digna de 52 años, tiene una pequeña papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Ella comenzó como comerciante informal hace dos años atrás con poco capital y mercadería con los ingresos que tenia construyo un local en la parte delantera de su casa para un mejor venta de su mercadería. Compro vitrinas, papelería, bebidas para vender a sus vecinos. En la actualidad por la buena acogida que tubo su negocio trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa para impletar vender en su local y papeleria. En el futuro quiere tener su negocio mas grande para tener mas ingresos y que su hija de 17 años pueda ingresar a la Universidad con éxito.
texts.en:
Digna is 52 years old.  She owns a small stationery shop on the outer part of her house.  She lives in a canton called Playas, one of the tourist stops in Ecuador with a diverse variety of seafood.  

She started as an informal business woman two years ago with a small amount of capital and merchandise. With her earnings, she placed her shop at the front of her house in order to increase her sales.  She bought display cabinets, stationery, and drinks to sell to her neighbors.  Nowadays, due to her well-known reputation in the area, she works every day from 8am until 8pm.  

With this loan, she wants to purchase clothes to sell at her shop.  In the future, she hopes to successfully expand her business in order to increase her earnings and be able to pay for her 17 year-old daughter to attend university.

loans.use: Clothes & Stationery items.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en la provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 63 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene 02 hijos independientes, la señora estudió solo hasta primero de educación primaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos  desde hace 03 años, su  primer   préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar arroz, azúcar y fideos para su tienda.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar su tienda y sobre todo sus ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana por sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Adriana is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” community bank which is located in Azángaro province, in the department of Puno.  She is 63 years old, married and has 2 grown-up children.  She only studied up to the first year of her primary education.

Adriana has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Rosa for 3 years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which she used to increase her working capital for her business selling groceries.

She is requesting a new loan for 2,000 nuevos soles.  She will use the money to buy rice, sugar and noodles for her store.

Her dream for the future is to improve her store and, above all, her income.

What she most likes about her community bank is the ease with which she can obtain loans and what she earns in her savings.

loans.use: To buy sugar, noodles and other groceries

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es la Sr. Rosendo; el tiene 58 años de edad, soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de cereales como lentejas, maíz, entre otros. El socio viaja hasta la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado a distribuir su mercadería a sus clientes, el permanece por allá de dos a tres días. 

El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio y asi poder distribuir a todos sus clientes.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosendo is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” [Let’s Go Together] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

Rosendo is 58 years old and single. His daily activities alternate between the buying and selling of lentils, corn, and other cereal grains. He travels to the city of Puerto Maldonado to distribute to his clients and may stay there for two to three days.

Rosendo is seeking a loan to purchase more grains to sell to his clients. He is grateful to all those who make this dream possible and promises to make his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: Purchase cereal grains to sell.

loans.name: Lorena Jesenia

texts.es:
Lorena de 32 años, vende formulario del SRI (servicios de rentas internas del Ecuador). Vive en una casa de caña con sus dos hijos en una zona periurbana caracterizada por caminos de tierra y lomas llamada Fortín.   

Por la falta de empleo y la desesperante idea de mantener a sus dos hijos ella comenzó a recorrer las calles de Guayaquil buscando trabajo. Un día paso por el SRI y vio que muchas personas no sabían llenar formularios de impuesto, ella tuvo la idea de aprender todos los detalles de los formularios y comenzar a enseñarle a las personas llenándolos y vendiendo los formularios que compraba a un barato costo. Poco a poco fue conocida por las personas. En la actualidad ella vende y llena los formularios desde las 09h00am. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar formularios de declaración de impuestos. En el futuro quiere tener un local establecido ya que ahora solo lo hace ambulantemente.
texts.en:
Lorena, 32, sells SRI (Ecuadorean Internal Revenue Service) forms.  She lives in a house made from sugar cane stalks with her two children in a hilly periurban area known for its unpaved streets called Fortín.   

Due to lack of employment and the desperate need to support her children she started to traverse Guayaquil’s streets looking for work.  One day she passed in front of the SRI office and saw that many people did not know how to fill out their tax forms.  She got the idea to learn all the details about the forms and to start teaching people how to fill them out and selling the forms that she bought at low cost.  Gradually she became known by the people.  She currently sells and fills out the forms starting at 9am.

She will use the loan to buy tax declaration forms.  In the future she’d like to have an established locale because she currently has no fixed place to work.

loans.use: For forms.

loans.name: Sayda Silvia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.
