He is asking for the loan to buy more cattle as well as feed for them to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cattle.

loans.name: La Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del grupo LA BUENA AMISTAD  y como tal esta agradecida a los préstamos que ha recibido, estos le han servido D. mucho para progresar tanto en su negocio como su vida personal, antes D. obtener los prestamos trabajaba vendiendo comida en un mercado D. la zona, pero debido a su estado D. salud  dejo el trabajo, después D. algún tiempo ya recuperada vio una oportunidad D. negocio cerca a su casa donD. se inicio un paradero D. 3 líneas D. transporte aprovecho esa oportunidad para poner su kiosco D. golosinas y no se equivoco porque le va muy bien  allí venD.  toda clase D. bebidas y golosinas, sus mayores clientes son chóferes y cobradores, con ello ha podido mejorar su casa y ayudar a su esposo en los ingresos familiares, el dinero D. su préstamo le sirve  para la compra D. mas golosinas, bebidas , galletas etc. D. esta manera siempre tiene surtido su negocio.


   *Bertha es la 6ta D. las paradas esta con un bolso cruzado.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the group "La Buena Amistad" and as such she is very thankful for the loans that she have received, which have helped her to progress a lot in her business and her personal life. Before getting the loans she worked selling food in a local market, but due to her health she left the work. Some time later she was better and saw a business opportunity close to her home where there is a bus stop for 3 bus lines. She took advantage of this opportunity to put in a snack stand, and it worked out and is going very well. She sells all kinds of drinks and sodas. Her best clients are the drivers and bus attendants. 

Through this business she has been able to make improvements to her house and to help her husband with the family's expenses. The money from this loan will be used to buy more snacks, drinks, cookies, etc so that she can stock her store. 

*Bertha is standing 6th from the left with a bag across her shoulder.

loans.use: to buy snacks and drinks.

loans.name: Siguitemasson Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe SIGUITEMASSON II sont des femmes mariées avec en moyenne 37 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MINATA la deuxième assise à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage  pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMASSON II comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  60 000FCFA environs par campagne
texts.en:
The 10 members of the SIGUITEMASSON II group are married women with an average age of 37 and an average of 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Koula, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the 2nd administrative region of Mali.
They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to be able to better organize their activities in the beginning of the wintering. The crops grown are rice and peanuts. This is their first loan with the institution.
With this loan, Minata, the second seated from the left, plans on buying agricultural inputs and small farming equipment, and paying for labor and weeding to maintain approximately half a hectare of peanuts. 
The harvested crops are sold at markets in Baou, Koula, Banco, and N'Golobougou to a customer base made up of both men and women. The women plan on making an average profit of 60,000 FCFA per cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 51 years old and married. She lives with her family in the village of Ketilari, Abasha. Dali is a farmer and works with her husband Oleg and her 18-year-old daughter. The family's farm has five milk cows and 2.5 hectares of land in cultivation with haricot, maize, and soybeans. Dali produces and sells an average of 95 kilograms of traditional Georgian cheese at the local open market along with most of the vegetables harvested by the family. The family’s total average income is 900 GEL.

Dali is requesting a loan to renovate her family’s house as it is old and in bad condition. Although Dali and Oleg work hard, they have not been able to save money to repair their house. After the renovation, the family will have better living conditions and can rest properly after their hard work during daytime.

loans.use: to purchase materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo de 60 años es un hombre casado que tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 23 a 35 años, y vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, donde inició su negocio de tienda, aprovechando su experiencia de 35 años como comerciante y 31 de haber emprendido su aventura de negocios, hoy convertida en una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres, licores, enlatados, abarrotes, refrescos y todos los artículos de la canasta familiar. Sus principales clientes son las amas de casa de sus alrededores, a quienes les otorga créditos de rotación  semanal, quincenal y mensualmente, aunque también vende de contado. Con su negocio ha sacado adelante a su familia, pero cada día tiene un gran desafío y es el de tenerlo surtido con todo lo que solicita su creciente clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancía a un mayor volumen para disminuir los costos de transporte y obtener buenos descuentos. Su meta mas adelante mejorar la infraestructura física de su tienda, y a corto plazo, mantenerla surtida con productos comprados de contado y con descuentos para hacerle frente a la competencia fuerte con la que interactúa.
texts.en:
Rodrigo, age 60, is a married man with five children between the ages of 23 and 35. He lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias, where he opened his store. Rodrigo has taken advantage of his 35 years of experience as a merchant. He started this business venture when he was 31 and has now converted it into a store where he sells snacks, food, liquor, canned goods, groceries, soft drinks, and all types of everyday consumer products. His main customers are housewives from the surrounding areas. He extends credit to them and offers repayment plans on a weekly, biweekly, or monthly schedule. Rodrigo also conducts cash sales. Through his business, he is able to help his family move forward. However, his greatest challenge each day is having to restock with everything that his customers request. For this reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Rodrigo will use the money to buy merchandise in greater volume so that he can lower his transportation costs and obtain good discounts. His goal later on is to improve the physical infrastructure of his store and, in the short-term, maintain an inventory of products through cash purchases and discounts. This will help him confront the strong competition that he must deal with every day.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Bakitnur

texts.ru: Бакинтур  - 52-летний фермер из села Тюп. Женат и воспитывает 2 сыновей. До распада Советского Союза Бакитнур работал ветеринаром в колхозе, а после развала  решил начать свой бизнес в животноводстве.   Начав с суммы  в  20,000 сом (KGS), Бакитнур сумел развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 28,000 сом (KGS).  В целях  дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бакитнур обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) для закупа бычков для откорма. Доходы от кредита он планирует использовать для ремонта дома и последующего увеличения поголовья.
texts.en: Bakitnur is a 52-year-old farmer from the Tuyp village.  He is married and is raising two sons.  Prior to the break-up of the Soviet Union, Bakitnur had worked as a veterinarian at a collective farm and then decided to start his own animal husbandry business after the break-up.  Starting with a sum of 20,000 som (KGS), Bakitnur was able to develop his business to yield a monthly income of about 28,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop his business, he requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy calves for fattening up.  He plans to use the income from this loan for repair his house and further increasing livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 51 years old and married. She has five children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines  She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconuts.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Elvira has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Elvira aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Affa

texts.en:
Affa is 25 years old.  She is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school.  Her husband is a carpenter.  Affa has a business selling ice cream in South Sudan.  She has been in this business for five years.

Affa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase ice cream to sell.  She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: buy ice cream

loans.name: Glenis Esther

texts.es: Glenis Compró productos para surtir su negocio de miscelánea e hizo adecuaciones a su local. En la actualidad está aplicando a su segundo credikiva con el cual comprará toda la gama de artículos navideños pues desde ya se prepara para responder a sus clientes en esta época, así es que comprará multiusos, adornos navideños etc. “Gracias al apoyo recibido pude mejorar mi vivienda y en el negocio se aumentaron los clientes, debido a la variedad de surtidos que ofrecí”
texts.en: Glenis bought merchandise to stock her variety store and make improvements to it.  Currently, she’s applying for her second Kiva loan to buy the entire range of Christmas-themed items because she’s getting ready to respond to customer demand for that season.  She will buy multi-use outfits, Christmas decorations, etc.  “Thanks to the support I received I was able to do some home improvements and the number of customers in my store increased thanks to the variety of stock I offered.”

loans.use: to buy a whole range of Christmas-themed merchandise.

loans.name: Luisa Esperanza

texts.es: Luisa Esperanza tiene 15 años en el negocio de la venta de muebles, ella ha sido una persona responsable y que ha disfrutado de obtener un medio de ingreso necesario para su hogar. Inicio este negocio con la venta de comida y con los ingresos de su esposo que trabaja como acarreador y empezó a vender unas cuantas sillas luego fue comprando variedad de muebles y fue así que decide establecer este negocio. El financiamiento es juegos de sillas, cunas, colchones, almohadas, camas, roperos entre otros.
texts.en: Luisa Esperanza has been selling furniture for 15 years.  She is a responsible person and has enjoyed obtaining a source of income that her household needs.  She started out in this business by selling food and with income from her husband who works as a transport provider.  She started selling a few chairs, bought a variety of furniture, and then decided to set up this business.  She will use her loan to buy sets of chairs, cribs, mattresses, pillows, beds, closets, etc.

loans.use: to buy sets of chairs, cribs, mattresses, pillows, beds, closets, etc.

loans.name: Licel

texts.en: Licel is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Licel has a shop that sells fruits like mangoes, apples, and pineapples. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fruits to sell. Licel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Licel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: La señora Tomasa de 41 años solicita  un préstamo para impermeabilizar el techo de su casa; porque en las temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina por consecuencia el techo se está deteriorando. Tomasa quiere prevenir que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto. Para poder cubrir los gastos ella y su esposo trabajan en maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes. Tomasa  es madre de tres niños, de los que quiere formar unos buenos ciudadanos y un mejor patrimonio. Para que ella pueda realizar su proyecto necesita comprar impermeabilizante para que su casa este mejor protegida en los cambios climáticos.
texts.en:
41-year-old Tomasa is applying for this loan to make the roof of her house waterproof as during the rainy season the water seeps through, causing the ceiling to deteriorate as a result. Tomasa wants to prevent the problem from getting worse and from having to spend more than expected. To make ends meet, both she and her husband work in an assembly plant from Monday to Friday. 

Tomasa is the mother of three children, whom she wants to bring up to be good citizens and to have a better inheritance. For her project to succeed, Tomasa needs to buy waterproofing materials to ensure her home is better protected during changes in the weather.

loans.use: to purchase waterproofing materials to place on her roof

loans.name: Duo Pan Abej Group

texts.es: Duo Pan Abej. este grupo esta integrado por dos señoras,una de las cuales es Ixkik,ella se dedica a la elavoracion de tejidos tipicos desde hace 3 años, tiene 22 años de edad ella nos dice que a sus corta edad a podido salir adelante en su negocio,y la misma necesidad de querer superarse aun mas en su negocio,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la comfeccion de tejidos,ya que es estos tiempos de fin de año es cuando mas pedidos abtiene en su negocio,al igual que la siguiente socia tambien se dedica a la misma actividad,y por esa misma razon esta solicitando este credito,agradesen a fape y kiva por la ayuda brindad y esperan que les puedan seguir apoyando en su negocio.
texts.en: The "Duo Pan Abej" group is comprised of two ladies, one of which is Ixkik, who has been in business for three years making typical woven fabrics.  She is 22 years old and, at her young age, says this activity has been what has helped her have the desire to get ahead.  She is requesting a loan to buy raw materials for weaving since during the holiday season more orders are received.  The other member also is involved in the same activity and is requesting a loan.  They are grateful to Fape and Kiva for the support, which they hope they can continue to receive in the future.

loans.use: To buy raw material for weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cold weather clothing such as pants, jackets, and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Mitzi Asuncion

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mitzi, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  18, 12 y 5 años de edad,  los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, además también vende productos de papelería y bazar, realiza recargas y ventas de tarjetas telefónicas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan cuando están desocupados,  tiene en su negocio ya por 15 años y  le ha ido bien. Con la ganancia que ha tenido lo ha ido utilizando en construir su casa la misma que aun no termina por completo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, ropa y útiles escolares. Lleva 10 más de años en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido poco a poco construir su casa.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y terminar su casa por completo.
texts.en:
Picoaza appears in books as one of the indigenous communities that belonged to the Manteña culture.  The urban parish of that name is located only ten minutes from the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province.  The community is full of stories.  It is also the place where the members of the María Asunción communal bank meet every fifteen days.

Mitzi is one of the group’s members.  She is 38 years old, married, and has three children, ages 18, 12, and 5.  Her two older children are in secondary school, while her youngest child is in elementary school.  Her husband works as a builder.

Mitzi operates a general store in her home, where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, and detergent, among other items.  She also sells stationery items and recharges and sells telephone cards.  Mitzi works every day from 6:00 AM until 8:00 PM, and sometimes even later.  Her children and her husband help her when they have time.  Mitzi has had her business for 15 years, and it has gone well.  She has used the profits from her business to construct the family’s home, which is not yet finished.
  
Mitzi is going to use this loan to restock her store.  She plans to purchase rice, sugar, oil, clothing, and school supplies.  She has been a member of her communal bank for more than 10 years, and likes it because of the loans.  She has been able to build her home gradually during that time.

Mitzi’s goals are to continue with her business and to finish building her home.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, clothing, and school supplies.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: El señor Faustino vive en la comunidad de espejitos perteneciente al municipio de Porongo,  desde hace mas de 50 años, el  vive solo. El señor Faustino se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería aproximadamente hace 25 años, el siembra maíz, yuca arroz, café y cítricos, así como también tiene ganado vacuno. El señor Faustino quiere el préstamo para la compra de semillas y siembra de maíz y para lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado de la zona directamente del productor al consumidor El esta agradecido con el préstamo que emprender le esta dando ya que esta es su única actividad para mantenerse y salir adelante.
texts.en: Mr. Faustino lives alone and has lived in the Espejitos neighborhood, part of the Porongo municipality for over 50 years. He has been in the agriculture and cattle raising fields for some 25 years, he grows corn, yucca, rice, coffee and citric fruits and takes care of his cattle. Mr. Faustino wants a loan to buy seeds, corn crops and all the items needed to prepare the soil, his products are sold in the market directly from producer to consumer. He is grateful with the loan that Emprender is giving him since this is his only source of income and way to get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy seeds for his corn crops.

loans.name: Maria Ivania

texts.es:
la sra. Maria tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Maria se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa americana clasificada, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad , en su negocio tiene un bonito surtido para ofrecerles a sus clientes con precios al alcance de sus bolsillos,  con las ganancias que le genera su negocio cubre los gastos del hogar. Maria a su vez también realiza sus ventas de forma domiciliar en los Barrio del casco urbano y aldeas aledañas al municipio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y asi tener mas variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en: Maria is 37 years old. She is a single mother of 2 children. Maria is a merchant. She sells sorted American clothes. She has been doing this activity for 2 years. Her business has a good variety to offer her customers at prices that they are good for their wallets. With her business' earnings, she covers her household expenses. Maria also does sales door to door in the downtown neighborhood and in the surrounding areas. She will use the loan to buy clothes and thus have more variety for her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Silvestre Cipriano

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Se ha dedicado a la pesca desde que era pequeño, junto a sus familiares.  Desde entonces le ha agradado mucho esta actividad y le ha resultado muy fructífera.  Trabaja todos los días de 3 pm a  7 am.  Es casado y su esposa se dedica principalmente a las labores domésticas.  Tiene hijos pero ya son mayores de edad.  Ahora necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pescado, camarón y langosta para su comercialización.

loans.use: Compra de mariscos

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 36 years old and is married with 3 children, all of whom are currently in school.

Maribeth earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Maribeth has been raising pigs for 3 years, and she also earns additional income from food vending.

Maribeth is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Dürdane

texts.en:
Dürdane is married and a mother of two.  She is knitting at home, selling them and making a contribution to the family budget.  With the help of the loans from Maya she is buying bulks of threads and increasing her profit.
 
Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Dürdane hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Evde örgü örerek ve bunların satışını yaparak ek gelir elde ediyor.  Mayadan aldığı krediler ile toptan yün alarak kar oranını artırıyor.

loans.use: to buy knitting yarn

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.en:
My name is Juana Francisca, I am a businessperson with a small grocery in my house for years. Thanks to this business I can contribute to my family\'s expenses and pay my suppliers. Now I need to stock my business so I can offer my customers a better variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Juana Francisca, soy comerciante cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación desde hace varios años, gracias aste negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos familiares y otros compromisos con los proveedores actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mi clientes mejor variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, lard, beans, soap, soft drinks, bread, vegetables and other foods.

loans.name: Gulebeste

texts.en:
Gulebeste has had 2 years of experience in this business. She plans to expand the dairy farming in order to increase the milk.
She wants to raise her income level to be able to meet the needs of her family.
With her first loan she borrowed $400 and bought a meaty bull-calf.
This has enabled her to cover most of her household expenses.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to a buy milk cow in order to increase the number of dairy cows, which will enable her to sell more milk.
Gulebeste is an Internally Displaced Person, (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan,Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village. She is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak lost her husband three years ago. They started their business together and used to work together. Muborak was a teacher of middle school and her husband was an architect. Their salaries were too small and they decided to turn to private activity. Now her children help her, and her eldest son is in Russia. Last time he came back he purchased a microbus and rented it.  His will use his profits towards a photo saloon. Muborak also has four grandchildren, and as she sells children's clothes, her grandchildren always have the best things.
Muborak now needs a loan to purchase the new season's goods .

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is a 38 year-old single mother of three. Lucila started her woodshop business in partnership with others who owned a circular saw for two years. She then moved on and began her own business with the help of her children. She currently produces and sells beds, chests, cabinets, chairs and other wooden products. She sells her products all throughout the Puno region including Ayaviri, Azangaro, Puno, and Ilave. She travels once a week to each region and often sells her products on credit. She often works from 7:00am untill12:00 midnight. She’s been working in the wood business for the past nine years. She hopes to be able to increase her raw materials, wood, in order to produce in greater quantities.

loans.use: Purchase more wood to increase number of furniture produced.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Mr. Emmanuel O. sells charcoal in Ubiaja, Edo State of Nigeria. He learnt the trade over 2 years after which he started his business in 1997. He is 36 years old and married with four children.

Emmanuel sells charcoal in an open-air market to people in the community. He hopes to get the loan of $400 to buy more trees for the production of charcoal in order to foster his business.

loans.use: To buy more trees for charcoal production

loans.name: Mohammad Shafi

texts.en:
Mohammad Shafi lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children. He lives with his own family.

For about 9 years he was in Iran and he worked in a furniture making company. When he came back last year he started this business in Kabul and opened a furniture making shop. His business is going well and now he wants to expand so he requested an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good income to support his family better.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi A. is the man dressed in the blue short sleeve shirt. He is 35 years old, married and father of 2 children. Since the end of his professional training, Mr Koffi has quickly opened a store of construction materials to satisfy the demans in his town. He sells things such as sheet metal, nails, iron, electrical wires etc. This business provides him with revenue. He has been a client with Fececav for 18 months and has already paid back one loan successfully. With this current loan, he wants to diversify his stock by buying other construction materials to satisfy his clients.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Koffi A. est l'homme habillé en bleu manche courte est agé de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Depuis la fin de sa formation professionnelle Mr Koffi a vite crée un magazin de matériel de construction(tôle, clous, fer , fils electrique etcc...) afin de satisfaire la demande dans sa localité. Cette activité lui a procuré des revenus . Il est client de Fececav depuis 18 mois et a bénéficié d'un crédit qui'il remboursé avec succès. Avec le présent emprunt il veut diversifier son stock par l'achat d'autres matériels de construction pour la satisfaction de la clientèle

loans.use: purchase of construction materials to expand his store

loans.name: Rehile

texts.en: Rehile I. (her employee is pictured) owns a clothing and fabric store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She has been working in this business for the last 10 years and is currently looking for funding so that she can increase and diversify her inventory stock.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.name: Dominica

texts.es:
Dominica has been selling ceviche — a popular local fish dish — for twelve years. Before moving to her current home she sold ceviche at another place located in the northern part of the city. She saw a better business opportunity in this current location, which is why she moved four years ago. She had to start over again with nothing, but she came anyway because she thought it would be better. And so it has.

Shortly after opening her small restaurant, people started to come, every time more than before. Although now she enjoys a good clientele, she is still not satisfied with what she has achieved. Her goal is to expand her restaurant, putting in place a better infrastructure so she can make more earnings.

In this way, with the help of her four children, she would begin to collect the necessary supplies to start construction of her dream — installing a textile shop to make clothes to sell at wholesale in the future.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de la venta de ceviches Dominica lo tiene desde doce años atrás. Antes de mudarse a su actual vivienda ella vendía ceviches en otro lugar ubicado más al norte de la ciudad.

Al ver una mejor oportunidad del negocio en el distrito donde vive ahora, se mudo hace cuatro años. Tendría que volver a empezar de cero. No obstante, ella pensó que le iría mejor. Y así fue.

Al poco tiempo de inaugurar su pequeño restaurante la gente empezó a llegar cada vez más. Aunque ella ahora goza de una buena clientela, aún no se siente satisfecha con lo logrado. Su objetivo es ampliar el local, construir una mejor infraestructura y obtener una ganacia mayor de ello.

De este modo, y con la ayuda de sus cuatro hijos, empezaria a recaudar lo necesario para empezar a construir su sueño de instalar un taller textil para producir ropa y venderla al por mayor en el futuro.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman B. is a fashion designer. He also owns a video rental store. He studied the business for 3 years and has been in business since 1990. He needs the loan of $600 to buy more videos for his rental store. He also will buy clothing and materials for his fashion design that he will then sell.

Usman is married with 2 children and he is 38 years old.

loans.use: To buy more videos and to purchase clothing materials for sale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is forty-six years old and the mother of two children. She bakes in the morning and cook yams in the afternoon. She is able to sustain her business, because the working capital needed for baking is very low.

Patience wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of flour and fresh tubers of yam. This will enable her expand her business

.

She is a member of the group called Maranatha. Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, bags of sugar and tubers of fresh yams.

loans.name: Jenny Flor

texts.es:
Jenny Flor belongs to the “Nuestra Senora de La Esperanza” (Our Lady of Hope) community bank, located at 224 Jr. Apurimac, in the district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 37 years old, has 2 children, she is separated. Jenny invested her first S/. 300 loan from Manuela Ramos in a small store.

Her store has grown, she started with very few items but managed the loans received very well. She works the store with the help of her children, and during night she talks to them a lot because she likes knowing how their studies are going.

With this loan of S/.1,100, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy items such as rice, sugar, milk, soap, canned food, pop, etc.

Jenny feels happy, since he received her first loan her income has grown and she has grown as a business woman as well.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jenny Flor pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuestra Señora de La Esperanza, ubicado en el Jr. Apurimac 224, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años es madre de 2 hijos, es separada. Jenny con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido, empezó con muy pocos productos, y con los prestamos recibidos supo administrarlos muy bien, con la ayuda de sus hijos atienen la bodega, y por las noches conversa muchos con ellos para saber como le esta yendo en sus estudios.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,100, el cual será pagado en 4 meses ,comprará abarrotes: como arroz, azúcar, leche, jabón, conservas, gaseosas, etc.

Jenny se siente muy contenta, desde que recibió su primer préstamo hasta ahora esta aumentando sus ganancias y creciendo como mujer empresaria

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for store

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angele

texts.es:
Raquel R. is un a 30 year old woman, who works a sales promoter in a private company in Managua, where she has worked for a year and seven months. She lives in Memorial Sandino with her husband and two little children. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

Both have work tirelessly to improver their family life and have a house in good living conditions. They have built their house little by little, because their income is not enough, they need a loan, and they have requested a loan to AFODENIC, to buy construction materials to build a room in their house. They dream on being able to acquire a car to make it work as a taxi in order to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Raquel R. es una mujer de 30 años, que se desempeña como promotora de ventas en una empresa privada de managua, lugar en el cual ha estado trabajando durante un año y siete meses. Habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino junto a su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una unidad de taxi. Ambos han luchado arduamente para salir adelante junto a su familia y dentro de esta lucha está el poder tener una vivienda digna para habitar, la han ido cosntruyendo poco a poco, debido a que sus ingresos no son suficientes, necesitan de créditos para poder contruir, por lo cual solicitan el crédito en AFODENIC, para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto en su vivienda. Los sueños de esta familia es poder adquirir un vehículo taxi para así poder mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: To build a room in her house / Construir habitación en su vivienda

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi U., 54 years old, has joined TYM since 2005. Before joining TYM, her family worked as fishermen in the nearby river. After joining, she took some loans to buy better equipment. Her family monthly income is around 3 million VND. Currently, her fishing boat is broken so she would like to borrow 7 million VND to buy a new one.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. NgU., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Uyên năm nay 54 tuổi. Chị bắt đầu tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã có nghề đánh bắt cá ven sông. Do điều kiện gia đình chị sống ở vùng ven sông nên công việc cũng rất thuận lợi.Tham gia vào Quỹ chị vay vốn để đầu tư mua sắm dụng cụ đánh bắt cá. Hàng tháng công việc đánh bắt cá của gia đình cho thu nhập 2.500.000. Gia đình chị có 2 con đều đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay thuyền đánh bắt cá của gia đình chị đã hư hỏng vì thế chị mong muốn được vay 7 triệu để thêm vốn mua thuyền đánh cá mới phục vụ cho công việc làm ăn tăng thu nhập của gia đình Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy new board

loans.name: Zakar Allah

texts.en:
Zakar Allah is married. He is uneducated but he works in agriculture. He started this business when he was 8 years old, and still he is working. He learned this business from his father and his big brother, and now he is the one responsible for furthering agriculture in his family. He would like to make his business grow but he is unable. He has tried many times; he wanted to enlarge his business but he could not. After finding AFSG in Kabul, he completed his documents and would now like to take out a loan.

Now he has requested an individual loan of US$ 1075 with a term of 18 months to complete his stock and buy some seeds to be able to plant all his land. Some of his land is still fallow, so he will make his land ready for cultivation to get good benefit from it and help his family.

Zakar is very happy about this loan. He wants to say that without AFSG in Afghanistan, it was impossible for him to plant all his land. He would like to thank the people of the world who are helping poor people around Afghanistan. Through this sort of loan, every worker can expand their business. He would like to thank Kiva.

loans.use: To complete his stock and buy seeds

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es: El profesor Q. de 36 años de edad, está casado desde hace 10 años con la profesora Karina Castro González quien trabaja en el MINED como supervisora, con 5 años de servicio. El profesor está solicitando su 7mo crédito, el que utilizará para reparar el piso de su casa, sus créditos anteriores los ha utilizado para la construcción de su casa, para él ha sido un reto la construcción de su vivienda pero con esfuerzo propio y la ayuda de los créditos que ha sido lo fundamental pudo lograr su sueño ya que con su salario no hubiera sido posible. Piensa seguir manteniendo su récord crediticio. Su propósito es continuar mejorando la casa en el futuro, hará otros créditos para la pintura y piensa que su vivienda estará lista para cuando lleguen los hijos.
texts.en:
Professor Q., 36 years old, has been married for 10 years to Professor Karina Castro González who has worked for 5 years as a supervisor in MINED. The professor is requesting his seventh loan, which he will use to finish the floor of his house. He has used previous loans to build his house. The construction of his home has been a challenge for him, but his own effort and the help of the loans have been fundamental in achieving his dream, since it would not have been possible on his salary. He intends to continue to maintain his credit history, planning to continue improving the house. He will take another loan for painting, and he expects that his home will be ready when children arrive.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement, to tile the living room floor of his house

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George A. is 65 years old, married and a father with five children. Currently all his children are working. George A. has owned and operated a hotel for the past three years. Because of the friendly attitudes his staff shows towards customers and its serene atmosphere of the hotel, a lot of people patronize the the facilities there. George says during weekends there are lot of people who booked the place but could not get in because of the limited rooms available and the damage to some of the facilities there. He said he wants to use the loan to buy additional air conditioners, furniture and other things to add to the existing ones. With the loan he also believes he can build more rooms to accommodate travelers and other people who want to have a perfect place to lodge. George says this will also help him maximize profit.

George belongs to the Trust group called "Biako Ye" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to for the loan and support one another to repay the loan. His picture was taken when he was visited at his meeting place.

loans.use: To purchase air conditioners, furniture and do other maintenance.

loans.name: Doeun

texts.en: Mr. Doeun H. is a villager in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province. He is 57 years old and the father of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other four attend the local school.  He and his wife, Mrs. Torn Nem, are farmers. They own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Even with the revenue, they do not make enough money to make a living. Thus, Mr. Doeun H. requests a loan to buy a buffalo for breeding.  Thewoman who presented on the right of the picture is his wife.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy buffalo for breeding.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
Su nombre es Juana Mercedes M. J. tiene la edad de 54 años, su estado civil es casado esta Señora Tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 1 de sus hijas dependen de ella, esta una adolescente de nombre Mercedes  quien tiene la edad de 20 años y esta cursando el 4 año de farmacia, su compañero de vida labora como agricultor, sus deseos son de darle a sus hijos casa donde ellos puedan vivir seguros y tranquilos, dentro de sus propósitos esta el realizar mejora a su establecimiento por lo que espera que pueda realizarlos.



La actividad económica de Doña Juana es la venta de calzado, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 30 años, Doña Juana inicia con la venta de granos básicos en lo que vendía los siguientes productos: arroz, aceite, azúcar y frijoles pero no pudo continuar este negocio por los motivos políticos y fracaso en este negocio mas tarde decide implementar la venta de ropa en la que vendía pantalones, camisas y faldas este negocio no le genero muchos ingresos por lo que en aquella época no había variedad en productos y finalmente se dedica a su negocio de la venta de calzado que es en lo que labora actualmente, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita viajar hasta Managua para realizar las compras de los zapatos deportivos ya que la compra de sandalias las realiza en Masaya.
texts.en:
Juana Mercedes M. J. is 54 years old, married, and has five children. Her youngest daughter, Mercedes, 20 years old and in her fourth year of pharmacy school, still depends on her financially. Her husband is a farmer. Her dream is to provide a safe and peaceful home for her children. To accomplish this, Juana wants to further develop her business. For thirty years, Juana has sold shoes. She began her business selling staple grains and proceeded to sell rice, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. Her first business failed due to political instability. Later, she decided to sell clothing and she sold pants, shirts, and skirts, but this was not very profitable because at that time there was not a variety of products available. Finally, she began selling shoes and that is what she does today. This loan is for working capital that she needs to travel to Managua to buy sneakers, as she is able to buy sandals in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ruth Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Isabel tiene 34 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Azucenas de Villa Hermosa y vive en el distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando porque se dedicó al negocio, además en el tiempo que debería estudiar superior, las universidades no dejaban de estar en constante huelga. Se capacitó en primeros auxilios. 
Se casó a los 18 años y actualmente tiene un hijo de 12 años que es todavía un estudiante.
El negocio consiste en traer diversa mercadería y repartir entre conocidos y amigos.
Con este crédito de S/. 300 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en polos, ropa interior, etc.
Ruth sueña con ver a su hijo como un joven de éxito que logre sus metas.
texts.en:
Ruth Isabel is 34 years old, belongs to the “Azucenas de Villa Hermosa” Communal Bank, and lives in Huanchaco district, Trujillo province, La Libertad state, Peru. She completed secondary school but didn’t continue studying because she dedicated herself to her business. In addition to the time she would have needed for post-secondary studies, the universities were constantly on strike. She trained in first aid. She married at 18 years old and today has a 12 year old child who is a student. Her business consists of selling diverse merchandise and delivering it to acquaintances and friends. With this loan for S/.300, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she invested in shirts, underwear, etc. Ruth dreams of seeing her son become a successful young man who achieves his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in shirts for the summer season

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr: Abravi A. est une jeune femme âgée de 27 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Elle exerce le commerce de céréales et des tubercules d’ignames à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son commerce en achetant des sacs de maïs, de mil de haricots et des ignames afin d’éviter des ruptures de stocks. Cette opportunité lui permettra de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients.
texts.en:
Abravi A. is a young woman, 27 years of age, unmarried, and without children. She does commerce in grains and yam tubers in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She would like to use this loan to grow the capacity of her commerce by buying sacks of corn, millet, beans, and some yams to avoid running out of inventory. This opportunity will enable her to meet the needs of her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, millet, beans, and some yams

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Durante ocho años Isabel se dedico a vender productos de belleza. No le iba nada mal pero cuando se animo a vender por temporada navideña  el año pasado, decidió cambiar de negocio. Es así que desde inicios de este año vende como ambulante diversos productos según la temporada. Ella tiene planes de crecer en el comercio, es por ello que actualmente se encuentra averiguando el costo de un local para abrir su tienda. 

Por otro lado, también dedica gran parte de su tiempo a la administración del comedor popular de su localidad. Desde hace veinte años que, junto con unas compañeras, mantiene el comedor en funcionamiento, siendo ella la fundadora de este

Su esposo trabajaba en el banco industrial pero el cambio de gobierno hizo cerrar estos bancos y ahora él trabaja como albañil.

Entre ambos ayudan a mantener el hogar y la crianza de sus dos menores hijos.
texts.en:
For eight years, Isabel was dedicated to selling beauty products. The business never went poorly for her, but when she began to sell for Christmas time last year, she decided to change businesses. This is how, since the start of this year, she began to sell in ambulatory manner various products according to the season. She has plans to grow in her business, which is why she is presently acquiring the funds for a site to open her business.

On the other side, she also dedicates a great part of her time to managing the popular canteen in her area. For twenty years, along with some friends, she has maintained the canteen in functioning order, and she was also the founder of it.

Her husband works in the industrial bank but the change in government caused these banks to close and now he works as a mason.

Between the two of them they work to maintain their home and raise their two young children.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Downpayment for a site to open up a store

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim S., 55, is a true entrepreneur who has a business selling a chicken and rice dish from her home. On average, she makes around US$6 per day. Her husband is a farmer who grows rubber plant. He makes US$5 per day. This couple has six children, three of whom are in school and the rest helps their mother sell the chicken and rice dish. Mrs. Kim S. is asking for a loan to reinvest into her business and also to be used to create another business to help raise her family.

loans.use: To reinvest in the food business and start a new business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 52 years old and married with six children. She sells sarongs at Ogida Market, in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.

She needs a loan of N60,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: Purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Arlen Patricia

texts.es: La Joven Arlen tiene 28 años de edad, reside en el barrio Isaías Gomez, con un hijo de dos años, su esposo trabaja como albañil, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y perfúmenes, sus venta la inicio debido a la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo ya que todo esta caro y hay que trabajar para cubrir las necesidades, lleva dos años de vender con la productos de Avon donde se afilio. Con este crédito quiere comprar mercadería variada para ofertar a sus clientes y poder tener mejores ingresos. Ya que sus planes  es poder comprar un terreno y hacer su casa propia ya que en este momento viven donde su mama.
texts.en:
Arlen is 28 years old and lives in the Isaías Gomez area with her 2-year old son. Her husband is a builder and she sells cosmetics and fragrances. She began selling out of the need to support her husband as everything is expensive and both must work to cover their basic needs. She is affiliated with Avon and has been selling their products for two years now. She intends to use this loan to buy a variety of merchandise to offer her customers and generate more income as a result. Her future plans involve buying a piece of land on which to build her own house, as they currently live with her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and fragrances

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila G. is a rice farmer. She is 50 years old and has two children. She wants to grow her business to be able to support the needs of her children. She has previous work experience in a factory. She was not happy about her job because her employer paid her less. She decided to quit her job and went home to manage a farm instead.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will really help her whole family to have a better harvest.

CEVI is helping her sustain her livelihood. She is provided not only loans but also training and insurance coverage to help her grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Maporta Group

texts.en:
This is Sallay K., Ya Yeabu S., Ibrahim C. T. and Joseph T.. Sallay (on the left) is the leader of this group. Sallay was born in Maporta, one of several villages surrounding Magburaka town. She is now 40, her husband is already retired, and they have six children. Her children are all in secondary school. Sallay has been a businesswoman for many years and she sells groundnuts (peanuts). She will use this loan to buy about four bags of groundnuts. The price for a bag of groundnut varies from season to season and from one location to another. Currently, a bag of groundnuts costs her Le 200,000 SLL in Luma villages, which rotate as business centers.

This group is named Maporta, after the group leader’s home village. They have been receiving loans from Kiva lenders through SMT. Previous loans have had a huge impact on the lives of these entrepreneurs. Their businesses grew and they can feed, clothe and send their children to school. Having repaid their previous loan successfully, they feel the need to request a new loan in order to keep strengthening their businesses.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts

loans.name: Quyên

texts.en:
Quyên Thị P. sells cake in her village every morning. She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 VND (or $110 US). She wants to earn more money. She needs 4.142.000 VND (or $250 US) to buy wheat flour to make dumplings. Quyên Thị P. was born in 1974. She lives with her husband and two sons in Hội Phụ village, Đông Anh district, Hà Nội city. She is a cluster leader.

No: 010105030048.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour to make dumplings

loans.name: Koamivi

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et a 02 enfants, l’activité génératrice de revenu qu’ elle exerce est le commerce de produits congelés, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2006. La majorité de ses clients exercent dans la restauration. Ce commerce lui est très rentable. Le stock de marchandise  dont elle dispose actuellement ne  lui permet pas de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle. Pour rehausser son stock elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 cartons de divers produits congelés.
texts.en:
This woman is married and has 2 children. To generate revenue she sells frozen foods. She began this business in 2006. The majority of her customers are in food service. This business is very profitable for her. The stock of merchandise that she has currently does not allow her to satisfy the needs of her clientele. In order to build up her stock, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 20 boxes of assorted frozen foods.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase frozen foods

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: At the young age of 32, Jenny L. is already a widow. Her husband died due to hypertension. With her three children, she still lives with her parents in their village of Barangay Manano Mallig, Isabela. She is patiently maintaining a humble general store business to support the education of her children. Her dream is to make her business grow so that she is able to increase her daily income. Due to insufficient capital, Jenny is requesting the amount of PHP17,000 from Kiva. She will use the funds for her store to grow and become more profitable in order to provide her three children with a better future. She believes that giving her children their needs will also benefit her someday when she is no longer able to work for herself.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy K. is 27 years old, married and devoted to four children who are students in the local public school. She stays at home to manage the family housework as well as selling some fruit to her villagers for income. She is married to 29-year-old Soun Chen, who helps support the family by running a motor taxi.

Soy K. thinks that it is time to sustain her investment's growth and look for extra revenue, which she proposes to do by selling fruit at the market. She wants to buy a larger quantity of fruit to sell to retailers in the market, but she complains that she doesn’t have a big sized vehicle to transport more fruit.

To achieve her goal, Soy K. has decided to seek a loan in order to purchase a trailer to connect to her existing motorbike so that she can use it to pick up more fruit. She and her husband are pictured at their house.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to connect to their existing motorbike

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn T. is from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Analyn is married and has 3 infant children. Analyn operates a business buying & selling of fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Analyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Logovaita

texts.en:
Logovaita F. is a 31-year-old married woman with three small children. The family lives in Faala where she owns and runs a business providing services to the local community. Logovaita has been engaged in this business for over five years, from which she earns approximately 1000 WST a month.

In 2008, Logovaita joined SPBD to gain access to its financial services. Logovaita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand her services. Logovaita is now requesting a second loan of 1000 WST, which will be used for the same purpose. Logovaita plans to use all profits to expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's lending philosophy is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide her services

loans.name: Phien's Group

texts.en:
Phiên Thị Nguyễn was born in 1969. (id: 010117050026). She lives in Dan Mo, Uy No, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. Her husband is a builder. She has two children. She sells fruit and noodL. in the morning. Her family has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She is a group leader of 5 – member group loan offered by SEDA. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to invest in her business.
 About the other borrower in her group:
Nhạn Thị Vương was born in 1976. (id: 010117050027). She has two children. She sells groceries. She needs 6.322.000 VND to buy more good to sell.
 Lệ Thị Nguyễn was born in 1968. (id: 010117050025). She has three children. She sells chicken in the market. She needs 5.450.000 VND to buy chicken.
 Hồng Thị Bùi was born in 1977. (id: 010117050030).  She has two children. She sells fish, noodL. in the market. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to invest in small buseness.
 Thơm Thị Lê was born in 1971. (id: 010117050029 ). She has two children. She needs 4.578.000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es una mujer muy responsable, tiene 33 años, es casada y madre de 4 hijos con los que vive en su casa propia. Junto a su esposo, se dedica a la siembra de plátanos, café y paltas, pero de todos sus cultivos, lo que prefiere sembrar es el café, por ser más rentable. Llegada la temporada de cosecha de este producto, muy ansiosa inicia la recolección del grano, que posteriormente lava y hace secar al sol. En este tiempo logra obtener muy buena cantidad de dinero, por lo que en cada viaje hacia la acopiadora que le compra su producto lleva de 3 a 4 quintales en 2 horas de camino en carro. De los 4 quintales su venta es un aproximado de 900 soles, mientras que con los plátanos obtiene una menor cantidad, pero le es muy útil porque cosecha con mayor frecuencia y le permite cubrir las necesidades de alimentación diaria de su familia. Ahora, la meta de Consuelo es de incrementar su producción para solventar la educación de sus hijos.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y durante todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable y más aun en su cargo de tesorera de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para pagar a los peones que realizarán la limpieza de sus campos de cultivo de café.

loans.use: Pago por la limpieza de sus tierras de cultivo

loans.name: Santos Yonorbi

texts.es:
La señora SANTOS YONORBI C. C., tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II. Ella   presenta estudios hasta 3ero de secundaria, refiere que dejo de estudiar porque empezó a trabajar como empleada en casas.
SANTOS  es casada, tiene 2  hijos pequeños quienes  depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la fabricación y venta ambulatoria de calzado en compañía de su esposo.
Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere 300 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para comprar materiales como: hilos, cuero, plantillas, pegamento, etc. para la fabricación del calzado que posteriormente venderá. Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y así obtener dinero para criar y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos Yonorbi C. C. is 35 years old, lives in the Trujillo district of the Trujillo province, La Libertad department in Peru. The associate belongs to the Community Bank "Esfuerzo de Mujeres II"( Effort of Women). She has completed through the 3rd year of secondary school, she discontinued her studies because she went to work as domestic worker. Santos is married and has two small children who depend on her for their support. The member together with her husband makes a living making shoes and selling them as street vendor. This is the first loan request. She is requesting 300 New Soles for the purchase of materials such as thread, leather. soles. adhesives, etc. for the production of shoes that will later be sold. She dreams of increasing her sales and this way earning money to be able to raise and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of material for making shoes, such as thread, leather, soles, glue, etc.

loans.name: Tettey

texts.en: Tettey is forty-three. He is married and has four children, all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. He works hard to be able to provide for the family. Tettey is a trader. He deals in mobile phones and accessories. He sells in a shop by the roadside in his community. He tells us that he buys the phones from the big cities at affordable prices. Tettey has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure all kinds of phones in larger quantities in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy phones and accessories.

loans.name: Odias

texts.es:
Odias tiene 30 años, vive con su esposa, no tienen hijos, pero tiene a su cargo a su madre y a su hermana.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, gracias a que con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar su propio motocarro, ahora tiene dos, y el otro lo maneja chofer particular.
La encargada de recibir las ganancias de ambos motocarros y administrarlas es su esposa, quien es su mano derecha en este negocio.
Sin embargo, es tan grande su anhelo de progreso de Odias que en algunos momentos libres también se dedica a la venta de ropa en compañía de su esposa, estas prendas las llevan a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona y las dejan al crédito o la contado.
A Odias le gusta su trabajo, porque lo mantiene activo durante todo el día y obtiene ingresos diarios.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, es parte de un banco comunal y aunque es un grupo nuevo, ha notado que son personas responsables y trabajadoras. Con el dinero que solicita comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar sus motocarros, para que sigan laborando bien ninguna dificultad.
texts.en:
Odias is 30 years old, and lives with his wife. He does not have children, but he is responsible for his mother and sister. For 4 years he has been in the business of transporting passengers. Thanks to a lot of hard work, he managed to buy his own motocar (light, 3-wheeled vehicle.) Now he has two, one of which is driven by a private driver. His wife, who is his right hand in the business, is in charge of receiving and handling the earnings from both of the motocars. Odias' desire to advance is very strong; in his few free moments he also sells clothing along with his wife. They take these garments to sell in various places in the area, and they sell on a cash and credit basis. Odias likes his work, because it keeps him busy all day and he gets daily earnings. This is his first loan with MFP. He is part of a communal bank, and although it is a new group, he has noted that they are hardworking and responsible people. With the money that he requests, he will buy spare parts to repair his motocars, so that he can continue to work well without any difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his motocars

loans.name: Delicia Pilar

texts.es: Delicia Pilar es una mujer emprendedora que lucha por alcanza sus ideales, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 36 años de edad,  ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, que funciona en su casa, esta actividad lo realiza diariamente para ello se levanta muy temprano para tender en su tienda, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él se dedica al comercio. Pilar forma parte del Banco Comunal “De la Amistad” desde hace once años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado para comprar gaseosas. Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 700 soles, que será utilizado para comprar productos comestibles como fideos, azúcar, gaseosas, detergente, aciete, etc. para ser vendidos a sus clientes. La meta de Pilar es implementar su tienda con diferentes artículos de ferretería, escritorio y del hogar.
texts.en:
Delicia Pilar, 36, is an enterprising woman who struggles to reach her ideals. She lives in Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She runs a grocery store from her home. She tends to it daily so she rises very early to open her store. Her husband, who is a merchant, supports her efforts. Pilar has been a member of the "De la Amistad" communal bank for 11 years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy soft-drinks. She now needs a 700 sol loan to buy stock items like pasta, sugar, soft-drinks, detergent, oil, etc. to sell to her customers. Pilar's goal is to stock her store with different types of articles like hardware, office and household supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items like pasta, sugar, soft-drinks, detergent, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Loan to strengthen their businesses.

loans.name: La Camacha Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama LA CAMACHA   porque asi  se llama  la población donde viven.  Está ubicado en el municipio de Tlalixcoyan en el estado de Veracruz.  El grupo está conformado por   5  integrantes que se conocen desde hace tiempo pues viven en la misma comunidad.  Éste es su primer  préstamo con Fundación Realidad.

La representante del grupo se llama  Reynalda L. L.,  es soltera, tiene 50 años, estudió  la universidad, y tiene en total 5 hijos 3 mujeres y 2 varones.  Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdas para la cría y alimento para mantenerlos. Ella tiene sus cerdos en el patio de su solar.  Reynalda L. L.   desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para así obtener una ganancia mayor y volver a invertir en mas cerdos.

Rusbelly L. L. también está en el grupo LA CAMACHA  Ella tiene 39 , estudió hasta la universidad , y tiene en total 2  hijos 1mujer y 1 varon.  Ella  se dedica a la cría de cerdos y necesita el préstamo para comprar alimento para  mantener sus cerdos .  Rusbelly mantiene sus cerdos en el patio del solar de su mama  con quien vive.
Rusbelly desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio,  para que con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar  un terreno para construir su casa ya que actualmente ella vive con su mama.

Los otros 3 integrantes se llaman Fabian H. L. , Hector  M. E. y Alejandrina E. Raygoza, y quieren préstamos para invertir en sus negocios como son, venta de abarrotes , y la cria y engorda de cerdos.
texts.en:
This group is called "La Camacha" because this is the name of the town where they live. It is located in the municipality of Tlalixcoyan in the state of Veracruz. This group is formed by 5 members who know each other since they have lived in the same community for a long time. This is their first loan with the Realidad Foundation. The representative of the group is named Reynalda L. L.. She is single, 50 years old, and studied at the university. She has a total of 5 children: 3 daughters and 2 sons. She raises pigs and needs the loan to buy pigs to raise and food to maintain them. She keeps her pigs in a yard on her property. Reynalda L. L. wants this loan to increase her business, in order to obtain higher earnings and be able to reinvest in more pigs. Rusbelly L. L. is also in the group La Camacha. She is 39, and studied until the university. She has 2 children: a son and a daughter. She raises pigs and needs a loan to buy food for her pigs. Rusbelly keeps her pigs in a yard on her mother's property where she lives. Rusbelly wants the loan to increase her business, so that with the earnings she can buy a plot of land where she can build her house, since she currently lives with her mother. The other 3 members of the group are named Fabian H. L. , Hector M. E. and Alejandrina E. Raygoza. They want loans to invest in their businesses: they sell groceries and breed and raise pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Ana  Celina

texts.es: Doña Ana Celina es una mujer muy esforzada y trabajadora, tiene 32 años de edad, procreo tres hijos, los tres estudiantes que junto con su esposo esperan poder apoyarlos para que logren terminar sus estudios. Su negocio es el Alquiler de cuartos que junto con su esposo administran, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida en un mercado, su casa ha mejorado grandemente gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic a dado pues para personas de poco recursos económico es el mejor medio de poder prosperar, muy agradecida con  Dios por que ha logrado tener su casa en mejores condiciones, y mejor seguridad para sus pequeños hijos así como mejor higiene. Con este préstamo seguirá invirtiendo en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para hacer un porche,  ya tiene un bajarete, y quiere cerrarlo y repellar las paredes para que se le mire bonita su casa. Sus planes es ponerle piso después ya que es de tierra el cual espera lograrlo a corto plazo con el apoyo de su esposo como el de la institución.
texts.en:
Ana Celina, 32, is a hard-working woman. She has three children, all of whom are in school. Together with her husband, she hopes to help them finish their studies. She and her husband rent out rooms. She used to sell prepared meals in a market. Her house has improved considerably thanks to the financing that Afodenic gives to low-income persons; it is the best way that one can prosper. She is very grateful to God because she has managed to improve her home providing both better security and hygiene for her little ones. This funding will be used to buy building materials like: sand, stone, cement and iron, to build a porch because it's just a mud wall. She wants to enclose it and plaster the walls so that her house will have a pleasant appearance. Later on, she plans to install flooring because it's currently a dirt floor; she hopes to do this in the short run with help from her husband and the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement and iron to build a porch.

loans.name: Johnson Street Business Center Group

texts.en:
Augustine S. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Johnson Street Business Center. In the photo, Augustine is the one holding the sign. He is 56 years old, married, and is a high school graduate. He has seven children who range in age from 13 to 35.

For eight years, Augustine has had a building-materials business on Johnson Street. He says that he provides high quality service in a friendly manner, which attracts customers.

Augustine plans to use his 14,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 56,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more building materials such as planks, nails and cement. His goal is to grow his business, to help his children go to school, and to build a house.


About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Felicia Aquilina

texts.es:
La señora Felicia Aquilina es una mujer luchadora, tiene 40 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos en edad académica la menor que está en la fotografía junto con ella tiene 1 año y 5 meses de edad, conoce a EDAPROSPO desde hace 4 años, se dedica a brindar servicios de costura y confección de prendas de vestir desde hace 3 años además día a día se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 2 años, nos cuenta que se inicio ayudando a su cuñada y logro aprender y decidió independizarse, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado comprarse una máquina de coser, materiales para su negocio, una refrigeradora y un ropero, sus ingresos cubren la educación de sus hijos y la inversión en su negocio. Felicia nos cuenta que su gran sueño es tener su propio taller y administrarlo.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra de telas para la confección de camisas. Felicia está muy agradecida con los inversionistas por apoyar a todas las personas con bajos recursos y así  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felicia Aquilina, 40, is a go-getter and a married woman with 3 children. The youngest, who is next to her in the photograph, is a 1 year and 5 months old; the others are school-aged. She became acquainted with EDAPROSPO 4 years ago. She has had a business providing seamstress services and making garments for 3 years. In addition, over the last 2 years she has been gradually developing a business selling beauty products. She tells us that she started out helping her sister-in-law and managed to learn and decided to work independently. With her daily efforts she has managed to buy herself a sewing machine, materials for her business, a refrigerator and a wardrobe. Her income pays for the education of her children and is used to invest in the business. Felicia tells us that her biggest dream is to own and manage her own workshop. The loan recently granted will be invested in the purchase of fabrics for the production of shirts. Felicia is very grateful to the lenders for supporting all of the people of limited means and in this way improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric to make shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice and beans

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: A. A. Fati est née le 05 Janvier 1974 et vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Wologuèdè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Fati est mariée à EGOUWOLLE Falilou et a des enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Wologuèdè et le couple assure les différentes charges. Fati a été à l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Après son mariage, Fati à commencé la vente de charbon de bois et mène cette activité à son domicile. A côté de cette activité, Fati vend également du maïs. Fati s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays. C'est la première fois que Fati sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Ainsi, Fati pourra également se faire plus de revenu et développer un peu plus son activité.
texts.en:
Fati A. A. was born on Jan 5th, 1974 and for the past decade has lived in the Wologuèdè neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capitol of Bénin. Fati is married to Falilou Egouwolle and has children that she sends to school. The family lives together in Wologuèdè and the pair takes care of the different responsibilities. Fati was in school up until high school. After her marriage, Fati started selling charcoal from her home. In addition, Fati also sells corn. Fati gets her supplies in the interior of her country. This is the first time that Fati is asking ALIDé for a loan, in the hopes of increasing the stocks of her products and to better meet the needs of her customers. Thus, Fati will be able to equally make more of an income and grow her business.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Daraay Xandiar Caapy Group

texts.fr:
Daraay Xandiar Caapy est une association regroupant des femmes d’une classe d’alphabétisation mise en place en 2008 par une ONG très populaire au Sénégal. Après  leur formation, elles ont reçu un soutien de 100 000 FCFA pour qu’elles les fructifient, en application de leur formation, en activité génératrice de revenus. Elles sont toutes dans  le commerce et vendent divers produits. 
Ainsi, le groupe est  composé de Madame Nogaye N. vendeuse de jus locaux (jus bissap et jus pain de singe) la présidente, Madame Adama F. la trésorière vendeuse également de jus locaux, Madame Fatou G. vendeuse de tissus du genre indigo (thioupe), Madame Soda G. qui vend de l’huile de palme et pâte d’arachide et de Madame Souado S. vendeuse de bois de chauffage et du charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Daraay Xandiar Caapy is an association bringing together women from a literacy class set up in 2008 by a very popular ONG in Senegal. Once finished with their training, the women received support worth 100,000 francs CFA, so that they may flourish when applying their training to income-generating businesses. They all work in commerce and sell a variety of goods. The group is composed of Ms. Nogaye N., the president and a vendor of local juices: bissap juice (made from hibiscus flowers) and pain de singe juice (made from the fruit of the baobab tree); Ms. Adama F., the treasurer and a vendor of local juices also; Ms. Fatou G., a vendor of indigo-type cloth (thioupe), Ms. Soda G., who sells palm oil and peanut butter; and Ms. Souado S., a vendor of firewood and charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing their respective businesses

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin A. is 44 years old. He sells toys for children in his store in Agsu city. He is married and has three children. Elchin likes selling. His wife helps him. Elchin started his business in 2006. He decided to start his own business when he found himself without an income. With his savings he was able to purchase the first merchandise for his store. For the last five years he has been building his business. Elchin applied for 1000 AZN to purchase more merchandise to sell in his store so he can increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Tekauita

texts.en:
Tekauaita  T. is 30 and married with five children (ages 6 - 19).  She is starting a business, selling local Samoan snacks such as palusami (coconut cream wrapped in taro leaves), cooked taro, yams, and soupo ese (hearty papaya soup).  Tekauaita  needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.
