She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tekauaita  joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tekauaita's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Mujeres Del Nuevo Renacer 3,4 Group

texts.en:
Balbina is the coordinator of her group Mujeres del Nuevo Renacer (Women of Rebirth). Her story is representative of her group and generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town where the economy is based on tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children.

Balbina is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a beauty salon, which also happens to be a sandwich shop. She will use the capital to purchase two different lines of hair products, as well as salami, ham, and cheese. She will use the profits to invest in a space to rent for her salon, as well as to construct a second floor to her home to rent out for extra money. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and sandwich ingredients

loans.name: Margarita Del Scorro

texts.es: Margarita del Socorro tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y que disfruta de su actividad como es la venta de mercadería en general. Sus inicios se dan hace mas de 8 años pues cuando inicio era solamente con pocos productos como pantalones y camisetas, con el paso del tiempo fue que adquirió más ganancias y decide aumentar su capital. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de faldas, vestidos, camisetas, perfumes y calzado. Desea establecerse en un lugar que sea propio.
texts.en:
Margarita del Socorro is 41 years old, and a very hard-working woman who also enjoys her avocation as it is the sale of merchandise in general. Her start was more than 8 years ago - when she started it was only with few products, like pants and t-shirts, over thime it was he she acquired more profits and decides to increase her capital. The loan that she requests is for the purchase of skirts, dresses, t-shirts, perfumes and footwear. She wishes to establish herself in a place all her own.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Luís Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luís Alberto B. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente.
El solicitando un préstamo porque le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su casa ya que vive con sus dos hijos y quiere la seguridad en la casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene como albañil de construcción, el señor Luís Alberto realizara la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Luis ALberto B. has already had a loan with FVP which he paid off on time. He is requesting a loan because he is building a perimeter wall around his home. He has two children and wants his home to be secure. He plans to pay back the loan with the income from his job as a construction worker. Luis will be improving his home in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a perimeter wall for his home

loans.name: Torn

texts.en: Mrs. Torn K., age 59, and she is a villager who lives in Tuol Svay village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chin Yim, are farmers who own 1.50-hectars of land to cultivate rice for a living. With the farm, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Torn K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for hire laborers to plow her farm to cultivate rice. Aside from farmer, Mrs. Torn K. is also grocery seller in the local village that is able to earn a small income to support her family. This couple has three children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is a grocery seller while the last one is a student.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for hire laborers to plow her farm to cultivate rice

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. K. is thirty years old, married, and has one child aged two. Her business is located at Kakamega. She has been selling such items as detergents, sugar, flour, rice, bread and others for the last two years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are spoilt for choice. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more general items to expand her business. Her husband is a teacher and supports her in the business and they hope to bring up their children in a good environment and provide  basic needs for them. She sees her business growing into a supermarket in future. She describes herself as patient and ambitious.

loans.use: sugar, flour, rice, bread, detergents and other items

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married man and father of two young children who attend school. He has been working as a furniture carpenter for the past 25 years and has run his own shop since 1998. He specializes in making wooden furniture designs. He works independently in his business, but collaborates with some galleries in his town and on customer request. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy more wood in order to increase his business productivity.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen s.a.l
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a microcredit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance.
At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.
Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for its micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Believe In God" Group. They are microentrepreneurs based in Makeni city, in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 1,400,000 leones each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mariatu K., who is pictured on the left. Mariatu is age 35 and was born in a place called Sanda. She is married with four children. Her husband is a teacher and her children are attending schools:  two in primary school, one in secondary school and the other is still not of school-going age. For ten years now, Mariatu has been selling clothes for babies. She will use her share of this loan to buy more clothes to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more baby clothes

loans.name: Dashjargal

texts.en: Dashjargal B. is a 33 year old married woman with one daughter. She lives with her husband and daughter in Zavhan province of western Mongolia. Her daughter, 12, attends a local secondary school while her husband works as a carpenter. Her husband, Ochirdari, has owned his carpentry business for one year but he has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and service. He operates his business with his friend, therefore they divide earnings equally. Dashjargal herself operates a fruit and raw material trading businesses, both of which depend on season, in her town to supplement her family's income. Over the short period operation, her husband has quickly found success with his new business. He used his earnings to expand his business by purchasing necessary tools and equipments. Currently, they received a order of making two ger's furniture from neighbor sub province. For the future, he would like to have his own workplace. Dashjargal is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more timber for her husband's growing business.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Aracelly Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Aracely vive en casa alquiler,  es casada tiene tres hijos jóvenes,   la cliente es una persona muy trabajadora, dedica mucho tiempo a su negocio, donde tiene colaboración de su esposo, también sus hijos. Su actividad económica es la elaboración y venta  de comida: almuerzos familiares y en la noche cena, tiene bastantes clientes que le compran de la zona, también  tiene contratos de atenciones para acontecimientos sociales, donde se encarga de toda la gastronomía. Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos por mayor, debido a la inflación de los productos como la papa, arroz azúcar y otros. No esta teniendo mucho margen de ganancia, por lo que solicita a la institución un crédito para poder comprar  sus productos.
texts.en: Aracelly rents her home. She is married and she has three young children. She is a very hard working person who dedicates a great deal of time on her business. She runs the business together with her husband and her childre. She makes and sells prepared foods: family style lunches and in the evenings she serves dinner items. She has a significant client base that buy her products in the region, but she also has contracts with social groups and organizations where she manages the catering. She requests a loan to purchase ingredients in wholesale, such as potatoes, rice, sugar etc. Her profit margin is not very large which is why she requests a loan, to purchase more products.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta C. is from the village of Bog-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old and single. To make a living, Modesta owns and operates a a sari-sari (variety) retail store, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, beverages, and snack foods in the local community. Modesta has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Modesta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Modesta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Modesta is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Modesta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida Q. is a married woman who lives in Purok Maligaya, Barangay New Cuyo, Roxas, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: buying and selling livestock and a farming and gardening business. Her husband, Edgardo Q., who is 52 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 17 to 30 years old, four of whom have their own families, and the other two have work to help the family. 

Aida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Aida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $118, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing 18,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for her businesses so that she can continue to save up for their future expansion. Aida Q. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es: Delicia, de 52 años, vive en una casa alquilada, en compañía de sus 4 hijas. Recorriendo las calles de su ciudad, Delicia vende cosméticos, es una buena vendedora y muy convincente, por lo que termina de vender muy rápido sus productos. Por tal motivo, siempre procura abastecerse de varios cosméticos para así poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues le es muy rentable, sobre todo en cuando ofrece por catálogos, es ahí donde aprovecha por las ofertas e incentivos que la empresa le da. En este negocio ya lleva muchos años, por lo que tiene como meta, comprarse un puesto en el mercado, para que pueda desarrollar su trabajo con tranquilidad. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP y seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, puesto que desea tener nuevos créditos. En su grupo comunal, es un socia responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de belleza, para continuar trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en: Delicia, 52 years old, lives in a rented home with her 4 daughters.  Crisscrossing the streets of her city, Delicia sells cosmetics.  She is a good saleswoman and very convincing, so she sells her products very quickly. She therefore always tries to stock various cosmetics to be able to full her customers' orders.  She likes her work a lot because it is very profitable, especially when she sells via catalogs, where she can take advantage of the sales and incentives that the company provides.  She has had this business for many years, so she has the goal of purchasing a stand in the market, so that she can work more calmly.  This is her 11th loan with MFP and she will continue to make her payments punctually, in order to have future loans.  In her communal bank, she is a responsible member and concerned for the well being of the group.  With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase beauty products for her business.

loans.use: Purchase stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Desarrollo”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años, está casada y tiene 04 hijos (2 independientes), realizó estudios de educación superior (Instituto Sencico y Cetpro).

Hace 08 años que trabaja  con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio , ella se dedica a la confección y venta de estuches.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá para comprar estuches de lentes y bayetas para sus bordados.

Su visión en el negocio es tener el taller bien equipado.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres al Desarrollo," located in the province and department of Puno.  She is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children, 2 of whom are independent.  She has a degree from the Instituto Sencico y Cetpro.

She started working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization 8 years ago; her first loan was for 200 Peruvian soles, which she used for working capital in her business.  She has a business making and selling embroidered cases.  

She requests a new loan in the amount of 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to purchase cases for glasses and cloth for her embroidery.

Her vision for her business is to have a well-equipped workshop.

What she likes about her communal bank is that she can access loans with reasonable payment terms.

loans.use: to buy cases for glasses and fabric to embroider

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TERESA DE JESUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Valerio; el tiene 42 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de trabajo del ministerio de cultura, el socio trabaja desde el 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, el socio quiere seguir adelante. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el uso personal y mantenimiento de su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the "TERESA DE JESUS" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Valerio is 42 years old and single. As well as his daily activities he works in the ministry of culture from 8am to 5pm. He wants to progress and is requesting a loan for personal use and for the upkeep of his home. 

He is happy to receive a loan and is committed to repaying it.

loans.use: The partner is requesting a loan for personal use and the upkeep of his home.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy O. (in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Theun Sam, live in a small village along National Road Number 5 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter, all of whom are in school. Vuthy is an English teacher. His wife is a tailor.

Vuthy wants a computer to make it easier for him to prepare documents and lessons to teach his students.  He also wants to change his motorbike to a newer model. Hence he is requesting a loan of $1,000 for both projects.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and replace motorbike

loans.name: Aura Nohemy

texts.es:
Doña Aura S. O., es trabajadora de la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua (UNAN), desempeñando el cargo de Aseadora en la unidad de intendencia, desde hace 4 años.
Es soltera de 31 años de edad, con 2 personas a su cargo. Este es el quinto crédito que trabaja en CEPRODEL, y lo necesita para mejora de vivienda.
Agradece a CEPRODEL por haberle otorgado estos créditos ya que le ayudan a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura S. O. has been an employee of the "Nacional Autonoma (UNAM)" university in Nicaragua for the past 4 years, working as a janitor in the maintenance unit. 

She is single and she has 2 individuals in her care. This is her fifth loan she has accessed through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner), and she needs it to carry out some home improvements.

She is grateful to Ceprodel for having granted her these loans; they have improved her quality of life.

loans.use: To make home improvements.

loans.name: Anita Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Anita Del Socorro tiene 28 años. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es su vivienda ya que es la única manera de mostrar su mercadería. Por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital,  y con fondos propios pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por lo que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además buscar el alimento diario. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, hasta que se le presento la oportunidad de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. El financiamiento que solicita es para granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes. Su mayor sueño es seguir con vida para mantener esta actividad.
texts.en:
Anita Del Socorro is 28 years old.  She has a small grocery store, and she has had this business for over five years.  Her business is located in her home because it is the only way she can display her merchandise.

She started with very little capital, her own funds, and a great desire to get ahead.  She started her business because she had to pay her household bills and provide for her daily bread.

Little by little, she increased her inventory with the small profits her business generated, until the opportunity arose to work with the León 2000 Foundation. The loan she is requesting is to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, and detergent.  Her greatest dream is to live a long life so she can continue running her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal, 36, is married to a mototaxi driver and has 4 children between the ages of 4 and 10 years old. Two of her children go to school. Marie has been operating a business selling foodstuffs such as green bananas, beans, rice and sugar for 7 years . She is requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs which will enable her to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Douglas Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor C. se dedica a la venta de bienes de consumo así como de verduras este negocio lo inicio hace 3 años el cual está ubicado en su casa 
El negocio lo inicia con fondos propios ya que anteriormente se desempeñaba como profesor para una ONG y al cerrar esta con su liquidación comienza en el negocio
Actualmente está casado y con dos hijos a su cargo en la venta tiene el apoyo de su esposa 
Es el cuarto crédito que trabaja con ceprodel este nuevo crédito será utilizado para la compra de mas productos para la pulpería 
Los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado mucho para su negocio ya que ha podido aumentar sus ventas y los productos a vender
texts.en:
Mr. C. sells consumer goods such as vegetables.  He began this business, which is located in his home, 3 years ago.  He started it with his own money, since he had previously been employed as a teacher by an NGO and when the NGO closed he began his business with the severance.  

Currently he is married and has two children in his care.  His wife helps him with sales.

This is his fourth loan with Ceprodel.  The new loan will be used to buy more products for the store.  The loans from Ceprodel have been of great benefit to his business, since he has been able to increase his sales and the products that he offers.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, toilet paper, soap

loans.name: Creciendo En Fe 1 Group

texts.en:
Johanna is one of the members of the "Creciendo en Fe" 1 (Growing with Faith) Group, which is formed by five micro-business people. All members sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. Johanna's family is formed by herself and four children, only one of whom lives with her. She lives in the north of Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity you can't count on. The town also has a large Dominican and Haitian immigrant population who live with very limited resources. They love to listen and dance to music in their free time.

Johanna is very excited to receive her first loan with Esperanza Internacional. She plans to invest her new loan in her business. She sells silver jewelry. She will use her income to renovate her home and to purchase some needed items. She lives together with her husband and their only child.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun is married to Mrs. Sao Vanny and both of them are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice, and they are chicken breeders. Although they try to work hard, they can earn little income. 

To improve this condition, Saroeun is asking for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. With the rest of the loan he is going to buy some materials to make rice wine, which is also a new business for him. He is the father of three children, one of whom is a laborer, another one does housework, and the last is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy some piglets

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es: Julia Mercedes tiene 33 años, es madre 3 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a brindar los servicios de costura, que está ubicado en su vivienda, Julia es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar ya que todas dificultades que ha tenido que atravesar le han enseñado a mejorar la administración de su negocio. Ella ofrece una gran variedad en la elaboración de sus prendas como son vestidos, trajes, pantalones, faldas, uniformes, trajes para niños, bordados entre otros. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para telas, hilos, tijeras, agujas y para comprar una maquina nueva. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Julia Mercedes, age 33, is a mother with three children to care for. She dedicates her time to offering a dressmaking service, which she does from home. Julia is a very determined woman who enjoys working. Every difficulty she has hard to overcome has taught her to improve how her business runs. She offers great variety in the garments she can make, which include dresses, suits, trousers, skirts, uniforms, children's outfits and embroidery, among other things. The loan she is seeking will provide working capital, destined to buy cloth, thread, scissors and needles, and to buy a new sewing machine. Her dream is to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, scissors, needles adn a seing machine

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5  hijos en casa D. sus familiares.

DesD. hace 15 años se dedica a vender frutas en compañía D. su esposo D. manera ambulante en el triciclo que tiene y les ayuda a transportar su mercadería, siempre se abastecen D. mercadería ya que compran al por mayor y trabaja todos los días en sus ventas recorriendo las calles mas comerciables y las ferias comerciales D. su ciudad y gracias a su parlante pueD. comunicar  sobre las frutas D. temporada que ofrece para los consumidores y que le permite tener mejores ventas, este negocio le permite tener buenas ganancias ya que es muy rentable y es muy demandado en su ciudad porque siempre trata D. vender las frutas a precios cómodos y con este tiempo D. experiencia han aprendido las mejores técnicas para sus ventas por lo que desean para mas adelante mejorar su movilidad D. transporte que es su triciclo en uno motorizado.

Es su crédito numero 5 que tiene con MFP,  esta agradecida por esta oportunidad ya que  siempre ha trabajado con la idea D. mejorar en su negocio y considera que este préstamo le ayudará a lograr sus objetivos propuesto por lo que esta muy agradecida y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos.

El dinero lo invertirá en la compra D. frutas al por mayor que están D. temporada.
texts.en:
Flora is 46 years old and lives with her husband and five children in her relatives' house.

For the last 15 years, Flora and her husband have sold fruit as street vendors on their tricycle, which helps them to transport their goods. They always have a lot of fruit to sell as they buy it in bulk and work every day, covering the busiest streets and street markets of the city. With their loudspeaker, they can announce the seasonal fruits they have to offer to their customers, which results in more sales. This business generates a good income for them as it is very profitable and in demand in their city, since they always sell their fruit at good prices and with their years of experience they have learnt the best sales techniques. In the future, they would like to improve their moD. of transport and make their tricycle motorised.

This is their fifth loan with MFP. They are grateful for this opportunity as they have always worked with the idea of improving their business and this loan will help them to achieve their goals. They are very thankful and promise to be punctual with their repayments.

This money will be used to purchase fruit in bulk that is currently in season.

loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Mario Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Mario labora en la ciudad de Managua dedicándose con mucho ahínco para mantener su humilde hogar. Es casado y con tres hijos a quienes debe proporcionar las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen y así lleguen a ser grandes profesionales. El motivo de sus esfuerzos son sus hijos debido a que el orgullo y alegría de todo padre es llegar a tener hijos profesionales.

Comprometido con el bienestar de sus hijos, está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones de su casa y así beneficiar a sus amados hijos. Con dicho crédito comprará arena, bloques, cemento, hierro y estribos. Espera que el crédito le sea otorgado para iniciar con la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mario works in the city of Managua and is dedicated to the task of maintaining his humble home. He is married with three children and wants to offer them the necessary conditions to develop and be working professionals. He is motivated by his children, as it is the pride and joy of all parents that their children grow to be professionals.

Dedicated to the well being of his children, Mario is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials to improve his home. With the loan he will buy sand, concrete blocks, iron and posts. He hopes that the loan is offered so as to begin the home improvements.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en: Ronaldo, 37 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. He has operated a retail store in their village for almost three years. His monthly net income is PHP 7,000. He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase canned goods, instant noodles, coffee, sugar and bread to sell. He hopes to expand his business further to generate higher profits and sustain his family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, instant noodles, coffee, sugar and bread to sell

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is 28 years old, married, and has one child. He works as a mechanic in auto repair, which he has been doing for six years.The business earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES. This is Geoffrey's second loan with KADET LTD and has successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use the loan to purchase a tool box for auto repair. Geoffrey hopes to own a garage in future.

loans.use: To purchase a tool box for auto repair

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 24-year old man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail shop business for three years. Before that, Emmanuel was a cotton farmer from which he got the capital to start the retail shop. His hardships are thieves and high trading license rates. His vision is to have a big shop ,which sells a variety of products and buy land to construct a family house. Emmanuel needs the loan facility to start the product diversification at his shop by buying clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell in his shop

loans.name: Katerina

texts.ru:
Катерина не замужем. Она живет вместе со своей младшей сестрой в двухкомнатной квартире. Катерина занимается продажей мужской одежды. Этот бизнес  является основным и главным доходом  для нее.

Катерина имеет свою точку в торговом центре на первом этаже.  У нее большой ассортимент и хорошие цены. Катерина трудолюбивая и целеустремленная. Ее бизнес цель - открытие второй торговой точки
.
Катерина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 9,000 гривен на приобретение мужской сезонной одежды: футболки и шорты. Полученную прибыль она планирует инвестировать обратно в бизнес для его расширения.
texts.en:
Katerina is not married. She lives together with her younger sister in a two bedroom apartment. Katerina sells men's clothing. This business is the main and important source of income for her.

Katerina has her own vendor location in the first floor of a trade center. She has a large selection and good prices. Katerina is a hard worker and purposeful. Her business goal is to open a second location.

Katerina is asking to give her a loan in the amount of 9,000 hrivnas to buy men's seasonal clothing: t-shirts and shorts. She plans to invest the earned profit back into her business for it's growth.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise - t-shirts and shorts

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
La señora  Alberta  tiene  cincuenta y dos años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras  es una señora muy trabajadora desde hace siete años se ha dedicado  a vender  frutas y verduras , también vende agua por pipas .
Esta  muy contenta  por  tener su propio negocio  y ver el fruto de su esfuerzo ya que le ha ido muy bien ha obtenido  muy buenas ganancias.
Ella estudio hasta la primaria terminada, tiene cuatro hijos todos son varones y ellos le ayudan a atender la tienda e ir a comprar la mercancía.  .
Esta muy agradecida con Fundación por el apoyo que le dio, ya que anteriormente ella vendia ropa de casa en casa y Fundación Realidad le dio un préstamo para surtirse de mercancia,, con las ganancias que iba obteniendo y con gran esfuerzo construyo un local y es ahí donde ahora vende frutas y verduras.
La señora Alberta  estudio hasta  segundo  grado de la secundaria le gustaría que sus hijos terminen sus estudios para que puedan encontrar un mejor trabajo y hacerse de un negocio.
texts.en:
Alberta is 52 years old. She is a hardworking woman who has been selling fruits and vegetables for seven years. She also sells bottled water.

Alberta is very pleased to have her own business and see the fruit of her efforts. She has already done very well and has generated a very good income. Alberta finished her elementary school education. She has four children, all sons, who help her with managing her business and buying merchandise.

Alberta is extremely grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support it has provided. She previously sold clothes by going house to house. Fundación Realidad gave her a loan so that she could stock up on more merchandise. With the earnings she obtained, she put forth the effort to build a stand where she now sells fruits and vegetables. Sra. Alberta studied through the second year of high school. She would like for her children to finish their studies so that they can find a good job or establish a business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old and married to David. They are blessed with two children, aged 25 and 18 years. She has been selling spare parts for the past five years with a monthly income of 11,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD. She  will use the loan to add stock of spare parts to her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her business. Her hopes are to open many branches in different sites, which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To add stock of spare parts to her business.

loans.name: Bahromkhuja

texts.en:
Bahromkhuja is married, with two children. He sells men’s clothing in the the market. Bahromkhuja’s discipline and orderliness have helped his business grow steadily over the past 2 years. He is very good with people. He has a unique gift of understanding people and building relationships with them. These characteristics have helped him be successful in the competitive clothing market. Bahromkhuja’s biggest dream is to have financial independence and a decent livelihood for his family. He hopes the current loan will promote further growth in his business and help him see his dream come true.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Nanny Soledad

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Montecristi se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nanny, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  24 años de edad el mismo que estudia en universidad y  aun vive en su casa. Su esposo trabaja con maquinaria pesada.

Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, además de ciertos artículos de bazar, papelería y algunas medicinas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando está desocupado. Tiene dos años con su negocio el cual a crecido poco a poco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, cuadernos, tarjetas y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.   

En la foto está la Señora Nanny con su sobrina.
texts.en: The Montecristi Community Bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-Columbian culture and for its craft-work that is recognized at a national and international level. The village is famous for its straw hats. It is here we find Nanny. She is 43 years old, married and has a 24-year-old son who attends a university and still lives at home. Her husband works with heavy machinery. Nelly runs a general store out of her home selling all kinds of products, such as rice, sugar and oils as well as bazaar items, stationery items and some medicines. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. and sometimes later. Her son helps her with the work when he is free. She has had the business for two years and it has grown little by little. She plans to use the loan to better stock her store, purchasing rice, sugar, oils, detergents, notebooks, cards and other primary-need products. She has had four loan cycles with the community bank and enjoys it because the group is very close. Her goals are to make headway with the business and for her store to grow every day. Nelly is with her niece in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oils, detergents, notebooks, cards and other primary-need products.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлане 53 года, вдова и имеет взрослую дочь. Светлана закончила Кыргызский Государственный университет по специальности преподаватель истории обществоведения и долгое время проработала в местной школе – интернате. К сожалению, зарплата не позволяла покрыть все расходы ее семьи и Светлана решила заняться собственным бизнесом в торговле. Светлана занимается реализацией детской одежды, так как традиционно на нее существует высокий спрос. Для дальнейшего расширения ассортимента за счет детской обуви, Светлана обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Часть доходов от кредита она планирует направить на проведение ремонта дома. В будущем, Светлана мечтает объездить весь Кыргызстан и увидеть все достопримечательности своей страны.
texts.en: Svetlana is 53 years old, a widow and has a adult daughter.  Svetlana graduated from the Kyrgyz State University with a social sciences teaching major and spent a long time working at the local boarding school.  Unfortunately, her salary did not cover all of her family's expenses, and Svetlana decided to start her own retail business.  She is involved in selling children's clothing because it is traditionally in high demand.  In order to further expand her merchandise selection by adding children's shoes, Svetlana requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to use some of the income from the loan to make repairs to her home.  In the future, Svetlana dreams of traveling the entire Kyrgyzstan and see all of the attractions of her country.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 years old and married with one child. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for six years. While she is busy raising piglets, her husband is responsible for their rice fields. 

Marilyn would like to raise all of her 20 piglets until they reach their optimum growth but her income is not enough due to the high cost of basic commodities, so she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P30,000 to buy feed for her growing piglets. She is hoping that she could raise them and offer them at a higher price so that she could save some money to ensure her financial security and provide for her family needs.

loans.use: to buy feed for her growing piglets

loans.name: Gukoranikare Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe Gukoranikare. Le nom du groupe signifie “travailler tôt “. Il a 61 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 10 à 21 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de primaire. 

Jean est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser une semence sélectionnée de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jean voudrait être fournisseur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner des enfants.
texts.en:
Jean is a member of Gukoranikare Group, which means "working early". He is 61 years old, married and the father of six children, aged 10 to 21, all attending school. He attended elementary school until fourth grade.

Jean is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with the microfinance institution ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

His growth strategy for his business consists in using specially selected rice seeds. In the years to come Jean would like to become a known rice supplier in his region. He will use his profit to provide his children with education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy produce for her market stall.

loans.name: Sohir

texts.en:
Sohir is a 36-year-old mother of three with extensive tailoring and seamstress experience. Sohir has gained an excellent reputation in her village and surrounding area. She and two partners are opening a shop where she will provide tailoring and dressmaking services.

Sohir needs this loan to purchase a sewing machine, paint for the shop, sewing materials, cloth and supplies.

In the future Sohir wants to see her business expand, become a leader in the field, and get involved in designing.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, paint for the shop, sewing materials, cloth and supplies.

loans.name: Charité Plus Group

texts.en:
Charité Plus is a group of 19 owners of small businesses chaired by Batinga.  Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE DRC.

Batinga’s main business is selling caterpillars in the mid eastern part of the capital city of Kinshasa. He became a micro entrepreneur in 2001.  

He had already received one loan from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid it. 

Batinga intends to use this loan to expand his inventory.  He will buy more caterpillars and miscellaneous items for resale and hopes to increase his profits.  He seeks to make more profit by selling more goods that his customers want to buy.  

Batinga is 32 years old, married and the father of four sons, ages three to 13.  Three attend school.

loans.use: to expand his inventory.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 36 years of age, married, and has four children. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.

Naseem's husband sells vegetables in the vegetable market and also sells milk. He has a dairy cow at home. He takes its milk every day in the morning and sells to his community clients at low prices. The quality of milk he provides to his customers is very good, and that is why he has a good number of customers.

Naseem is a seamstress, as well as an embroidery expert. She loves her profession and learned the art of embroidery and sewing from her mother before she was married. She now earns a good income by using these skills, which helps her pay for her children's school fees. She also provides full support to her husband in his milk selling business and takes care of the business in his absence.

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her family business of selling cow milk. With the loan, she will buy another dairy cow, which will allow her to get a larger quantity of milk for selling and to increase her profits. Naseem has been operating this milk selling business along with her husband for many years and is very confident about its continued success after the loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is divorced and has one adult son. 

She sells women's underwear at one of the markets in Nova Kahovka city. Galina has been in this business for 11 years. Even though she has many competitors, Galina just likes her business and her clients feel this. Galina has many repeat clients who buy merchandise from her for themselves as well as for gifts. 

Galina would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase her inventory for the coming Christmas season. She hopes to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and married.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items, such as shampoo and groceries, to sell in her sari-sari store.

Gloria has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns extra income from raising pigs.

Gloria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as shampoo and groceries, for resale.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe cuenta 30 años de edad, es casada tiene tres hijos los cuales esta estudiando Lendy 6estudia la primaria, Laory  5° primaria y cristina esta en 2° preescolar, su esposo se llama Ramiro es campesino.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende una bebida llamada chilate e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza como son: cacao, arroz, canela, etc.  Doña Guadalupe espera que le vaya muy bien ya que es una gran ayuda para ella ya que le ayuda con los gastos de sus hijos esta muy agradecida con el préstamo y la fundación.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 30 years old, married and has three children attending school: Lendy, 6, is in elementary school, Laory is in 5th grade and Cristina is in 2nd year of Preschool.  Her husband’s name is Ramiro and he’s a farmer.

She is a merchant selling a beverage called “chilate” and will use the loan to buy the ingredients she uses for it like: cocoa, rice, cinnamon, etc.  Guadalupe hopes to do very well since it’s a big help to her in that it helps her meet her children’s expenses.  She is very grateful for the loan and for the Fundación.

loans.use: to buy ingredients she uses.

loans.name: Tagisia

texts.en:
Tagisia, 50 years old, is married and has three children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business.  Tagisia needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 WST or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tagisia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Tagisia's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn es una mujer de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, en el distrito de Aguaytia con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Evelyn no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho y dedicación, Evelyn trabaja en su pequeño taller de costura y confección de prendas de vestir, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Evelyn se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de telas, moldes, alfileres y otros materiales para realizar sus trabajos, de esta manera Evelyn podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para tener su casa propia y lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus pequeños convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a 22-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two young children in the city of Pucallpa, in the district of Aguaytia. She loves her family very much and they are her biggest motivation in life. Evelyn is a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person. Together with her husband, she dedicates herself entirely to helping her family get ahead. Unfortunately, due to scarce financial resources, Evelyn had to begin working at a young age and was not able to study Medicine like she had wanted to. In her free time, Evelyn likes to cook. On special occasions she makes a delicious Ceviche to share with her family. 

By her own initiative and with much dedication, Evelyn works in a small sewing shop repairing and making garments. She works 8-hour days each day and believes that she has been successful so far because of the kind way she treats her customers. 

Evelyn is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the help being offered to her. With this loan she will be able to buy fabrics, sewing patterns, pins, and other necessary supplies for her work. In this way, Evelyn will be able to take on more customers. She plans to continue working hard in order to one day own a house and to fulfill her dream of seeing her children get good jobs as professionals.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in the village of Brnakot in the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and two adult children. Together with her husband, Susanna has been involved in agriculture for many years. Specifically, they cultivate different types of crops and sell their harvest in local open markets. Susanna and her husband do their best to assist their children and give them normal living conditions. 

The only source of family income is agriculture and, as their current financial condition doesn't allow for investment in the farm, Susanna has applied for this loan. With the loan of $3,000 USD, Susanna will be able to purchase seeds and fuel for cultivation and also hire workers for gathering the harvest. This loan will be a huge support for Susanna who is a very attentive and hard-working woman with a good credit history behind her.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fuel for cultivation and pay for the workforce gathering the harvest.

loans.name: Roeurn's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Battambang province, Roeurn is 33 years old and a mother of two children; one is under-aged for schooling and one is in school. For her family, rice cropping and a paid-working job have returned her about 25,000 KHR per day as the main source of income. This is the second loan for Roeurn with a successful repayment of the past loan, and the first loan for his co-borrower in a group of two with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for plowing fee. She hopes to make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for plowing fee.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Here is Ashot who has successfully repaid his educational loan, after using for its intended purpose. Ashot is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who have helped him to obtain previous financing.
After graduation, Ashot started to work at Vanadzor town's song theater as a soloist. Thanks to his talent and hard work, Ashot also receives song arrangement orders, as well as sings at the private parties. 
Here he asks support from Kiva lenders to purchase equipment needed for musical arrangement works. Ashot still lives with his mother and sister and greatly hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for equipment needed for musical arrangement works

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
My name is Jacinto, I own a small corn granary, loacted in my house. I have several years experience in this trade and it creates income enough to cover family expenses and other obligations. Thanks to the income of the granary, I have been able to give an education to my children and to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Jacinto, cuento con un molino de moler maiz en mi casa de habitacioin, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y demas compromisos, gracias a los ingresos de este molino he podido darle educación a mis hijos y mejorar mi vivienda.

loans.use: To buy a band, a chute, a bar and a collection bin.

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor S. is married with two daughters. He has a small business selling children’s clothing in the local market. The business, which he has had for nine years, has been the only source of income for his family. Presently, he has about $4,000 of working capital and his monthly net profit amounts to $1,200. Ivan has proven himself to be a responsible, determined, hard-working business owner. Previous loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped Igor expand his business, open a second vending facility and improve his family’s living standards. Eventually, he hopes to have a third vending facility in a different location. Igor has requested a loan for $1,200 to increase his inventory. He is planning to purchase a supply of jeans, skirts, and light dresses. A good assortment of clothing items will help him serve more clients, handle tough competition and further expand his business. Profits generated will promote the continued growth of Igor’s business and provide a good income for his family.

Ігор Слабий – одружений, в нього двоє донечок. Він займається бізнесом з продажу дитячого одягу на одному з ринків міста. Ігор став підприємцем ще 9 років тому. Його бізнес є єдиним джерелом доходів для його родини. Зараз в Ігоря приблизно 4000 доларів робочого капіталу, його щомісячний прибуток складає 1200 доларів. Ігор – дуже відповідальний, наполегливий та працьовитий. Завдяки позикам від „Надії України” Ігор зміг розширити торгівлю, відкрити другу торгову точку та покращити рівень життя власної родини. В майбутньому він сподівається відкрити третю торгову точку. Ігор просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити свій асортимент. Він планує купити джинси, спідниці та легкі сукні за оптовими цінами. Широкий асортимент товарів допоможе йому обслужити більше клієнтів, подолати велику конкуренцію й розвивати власний бізнес і надалі. Отримані прибутки сприятимуть розширенню торгівлі та забезпечать стабільний прибуток для родини Ігоря.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Paullina

texts.en: Mrs. Paullina D. is 40 years old, and is married, with four children.  She hails from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells local drinks to people in her community.  She is requesting a loan of $550 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of local gin to expand her business

loans.name: Not

texts.en: Mrs. Not S. is 31 years old, mother of 3 children, and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a simple store at home selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her area, and she can make about $4 each day. Her husband works as a recycler and a farmer; his income is a potential help in financing his household's needs. Mrs. Not S. has recently requested a loan to purchase more recyclable products for her husband’s inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more recyclable products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her maize stock

loans.name: Chu Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Chu Thị Trọng is 48 years old. She's a bird breeder for the last 10 years. 6 months a year, she sells birds at the market, the rest of time she raises poultry and sells breakfast. She joined TYM fund in 2003. She was qualified for a loan to buy birds. She also invested in her breakfast service, stocking up more products. Her children are all grown up., one is married and the other 2 are attending school away from home. She's requesting a loan of 375 USD to buy more breeding birds.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Chu Thị Trọng, 48 tuổi, làm nghề buôn chim cách đây đã được 10 năm. Mỗi năm 6 tháng chị đưa chim đi chợ bán, thời gian còn lại chị ở nhà chăn nuôi và bán đồ ăn sáng. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vào năm 2003, chị có điều kiện vay thêm vốn cho việc đi mua chim. Có thêm tiền để đầu tư mua thức ăn giúp chị có thể giữ hàng đợi đến khi được giá. Các con chị hiện đều đã lớn, một cháu đã đi làm, 2 cháu học cao đẳng và trung cấp trên thành phố. Vòng vốn này chi đề nghị vay 375 USD để mua thêm chim cảnh.

loans.use: Buy birds

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Since 1998, Debora N. has established and operated a range of diverse businesses, including raising livestock, growing vegetables and running a shop that sells basic groceries such as rice. A business analyst would probably say that she has shrewdly spread her risk, which is beneficial to both her and lenders. Debora has already repaid one loan from SELFINA and now has requested another, which she plans to use to buy additional livestock. She is married and has four children with her husband Moses: Furahini, 16, Reuben, 15, Furaha, 14 and Sayuni, 3.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not credit-worthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock.

loans.name: Salma's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Salma, age 30, is married with 2 children (ages 10 and 4). She owns a charcoal business, which she began in 2005. She works from 8am to 6pm daily selling charcoal, and now makes a monthly profit of about $75 from her sales.

Salma hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal stock to sell. She will share this loan with Farida, a member of her loan group. Farida also sells charcoal and sells chapatis (flat bread) as well.

loans.use: To buy charcoal inventory

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Ms. Amina has a very low income. She is 55, married, with five children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region.

Amina owns a herd of milk cows. Every day she sells milk to the local milk-processing shop. Her children help her breed cows in the nearby grazing field. The income from her four cows is too low to support the family or to increase her number of cows. That’s why Amina has applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for $600 loan, to buy one more pure-bred cow to make her monthly income higher. The price of a milk calf is $300, and the cost of breeding is $100. The other $100 she plans to save for unexpected expenditures.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen O. is married with 6 children. She is 47 years old. She is from the Delta State and resides in Edo State, Nigeria.

Helen sells foodstuffs and drinks in her store. She has been in business since 2007. She needs a loan of $350 to buy more drinks to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy drinks for sale

loans.name: Deysi's Group

texts.es:
Nancy, Deysi and Olinda have been members of the Trigales Communal Bank for one year.

Nancy is 25 years old and single. She has had a dry goods store for the past four years. Nancy also studied nursing. With the loan, she plans to buy a public telephone.

Deysi is 24 years old and lives with her partner and son. Deysi sells underwear for cash and on credit.

Olinda is 25 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. Olinda sells cosmetics on credit through catalogs.

Nancy, Deysi and Olinda need loans of 1250 soles, 450 soles, and 1000 soles, respectively, to invest in buying rice, oil, pasta, underwear, perfume, creams, deodorant and a public telephone.

The three women's dreams are to have a career, specialize, expand their business, own a clothing store and send their children to school.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer.

Nancy, Deysi y Olinda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Trigales hace 1 año.

Nancy es soltera y tiene 25 años, Nancy tiene una tienda de abarrotes, actividad que realiza hace 4 años. Además Nancy estudió enfermería. Con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar un teléfono público.

Por otro lado Deysi es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Deysi vende ropas interiores al crédito y cobra diariamente.

Mientras que Olinda es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Olinda vende cosméticos por catálogos, sus ventas son al crédito.

Nancy, Deysi y Olinda necesitan préstamos de 1250 soles, 450 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, ropas interiores, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y un teléfono público.

Los sueños de Nancy, Deysi y Olinda son ejercer su carrera, especializarse, agrandar su negocio, tener una tienda de ropa y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Nancy, Deysi  y Olinda necesitan préstamos de 1250  soles, 450 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, ropas interiores, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y un teléfono público.

loans.name: Luz Jovita

texts.es:
Mrs Luz Jovita belongs to the community bank Nuestra Señora de La Esperanza, located in Asentamiento Humano Pedro Portillo Mz. I Lt. 25, in the district of Calleria, county of Ucayali.

She is 28 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is a motorbike mechanic. Luz Jovita invested the first loan of 300 S. that she had received from Manuela Ramos in buying a motorbike. With the profit she earned from the first motorbike, she bought another one in order to increase her income. She gets up very early in the morning to take care of her children and the household.

In that way, she contributes to a more stable life for her family. Together with her husband, who always helps her, she works to improve their standard of living.

With this loan of 1,200 S., which will be reimbursed in 4 months, she will invest in the maintenance, the purchase of spare parts and in food for the family. Luz Jovita feels like part of a family at Manuela Ramos. She shares her ideas with the other members of the community bank and always participates in all the events. She feels very good about it.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz Jovita pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuestra Señora de La Esperanza, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Pedro Portillo Mz. I Lt. 25, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali.

Tiene 28 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Luz Jovita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la inicial de un motocarro. En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas de su motocarro compro otro para poder aumentar las ganancias, y así poder tener una vida mas estable y seguir creciendo con la ayuda de su esposo que siempre la apoya, se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus hijos y realizar sus que haceres domésticos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento y en la compra de piezas, y víveres para su hogar. Luz Jovita se siente en familia trabajando con Manuela Ramos, con las socias de su banquito comunal comparte sus ideas y siempre esta participe de todos los acontecimientos y es muy bonito sentirse así.

loans.use: To invest in the maintenance and the purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Lautasi Galo Fuauli's Group

texts.en:
This new group from Vaimaga includes four women, most of whom run sewing businesses. Because most of them are older, they are no longer suited to hard labor and sewing is the best business for them allowing them to exercise their hands and fingers. These old ladies are very supportive not only of other members of their group but also of the loan officers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of material, thread, needles, and new sewing machines.

loans.name: Jina

texts.en:
Jina S. is a resident of Kulashwor and lives with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Anil S., works in a private office, and her son is in pre-primary school. 
Mrs. S. opened her small restaurant three years ago to help her husband to upgrade the living standard of her family. She sells typical Nepali food in her shop such as dal-bhat. She also serves tea and coffee to the customers. Her husband also helps her in her work.  
Now she is requesting a Rs 15,000 (US$225) loan to buy food material for her business, because in that area the demand for Nepali food is increasing constantly.

loans.use: To buy food material for her work

loans.name: Tural

texts.en: Tural was born in 1986, is not married, and has settled in the town of Khirdalan. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Jabrail region in Azerbaijan. Tural has 2 years of experience with his billiard room business.  Now he needs a loan of $625 to buy the necessary things for improving his billiard room.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving his billiard room

loans.name: Thi Lieu

texts.vi: Chị Liễu tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2007. Gia đình chị hiện có một con 6 tuổi. Hiện nay  ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có 1 cửa hàng tạp hoá chuyên kinh doanh các mặt hàng thực phẩm, đồ gia dụng phục vụ cho bà con địa phương. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có  thêm nguồn thu nhập từ lương đi làm thuê của chồng. Với mức thu nhập bình quân  3.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm các mặt hàng  phục vụ bà con địa phương ngày càng tốt hơn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lieu has joined the TYM Fund since 2007. She has a 6-year-old child. Beside raising livestock, she also has a general store selling food stuffs and household appliances to the villagers. This is also the main source of income for her family. There is also an additional income from her husband's job as a hired worker. Her family's financial situation is improving with the average monthly income of 3,000,000VND (about 187USD). This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to purchase more general goods to meet the villagers' demands.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase general goods

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Hawa B., 53 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants et 03 neveux en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Yamatogne depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter des tissus, faire la teinture et confectionner des ensembles et des draps et vendre. Elle vend aussi de l’encens, des jus et crèmes qu’elle prépare elle-même. Hawa veut renforcer son commerce pour mieux assurer la prise en charge de sa famille. Son mari retraité est malade et se fait soigner à Dakar. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Hawa B., age 53, is married and has three children plus three nephews in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Yamatogne for four and a half years. She wants a loan to buy fabrics, dye them, and make outfits and sheets to sell. She also sells incense, juices, and ice cream that she makes herself. Hawa wants to bolster her business to ensure she can care for her family better. Her retired husband is ill and is seeing to his own care in Dakar. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making and selling dyed cloth and selling incense, ice cream, and juices

loans.name: Chron

texts.en:
Mrs. Chron M., born in 1981 and residing in Rolos Village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a small plot of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Since her field is currently infertile, Chron is requesting a loan to hire a laborer with oxen to plow the land and to buy fertilizer and pesticide to make it more productive.

She is the mother of three children, two attending the local school while the third is yet too young to be a student. Her husband, Mr. Hoo Dang, a construction worker, is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with oxen to plow her field and to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Juana Vilma es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega y se dedica con mucho ahinco a atender su pequeña tienda en el mercado Central donde comercializa  productos caseros, productos varios y productos comestibles.

La señora Juana ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos ya que requiere comercializarlos para continuar con su negocio en el mercado Central de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Vilma is from the city of Chinandega and works very eagerly to take care of her small store in the Central Market, where she sells homemade products, variety products, and groceries.

Juana has come to Ceprodel with the purpose of obtaining a loan, which will allow her to purchase products, as she needs to sell them to continue her business in the Central Market of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Khom R. is 20 years old and resides in an area of Ptasrong Commune in Pursat Province, where she has made a living growing rice or vegetable crops since 2007. She now has two children, both of whom are still young and are living in the family home. Her husband, Manh Bou, 26, sells wood carvings. He purchases wood from the forest to carve himself and sells his wares from village to village in his community, earning around $2 a day.

Farming is the main way for R. to earn an income by growing a crop twice per year. R. applied for a loan to buy a buffalo to help her plow her farmland for growing her crop. (R.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to help in plowing farmland

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La profesora Josefa es soltera, de 45 años de edad, 2 hijos de 5 y 15 años, la ultima con el 2do año de secundaria, trabaja en la zona rural como directora de un núcleo rural, trasladandose los domingos y regresando los viernes, con 15 años de servicio, sus hijos los deja con su mamá quien se las ha cuidado siempre, esta solicitando su 2do credito el que utlizara para realizar diferentes actividades si el dinero alcanza, como son: construccion de letrina, repello de casa, instalacion de agua y energia electrica; su primer credito tambien lo utilizo en mejora de su vivienda y lo cancelo en tiempo y forma, desea llegar a contar con una vivienda digna para sus hijos, su compañero se traslado a Costa Rica en busca de trabajo, le envia mensual entre 50 y 70 dólares para apoyar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Josefa is single, 45 years old, and has two children, 5 and 15 years old, the last one in his second year of high school. She works in the rural zone as director of a rural nucleus, leaving Sundays and returning Fridays, with 15 years of service. She leaves her children with her mother who has always taken care of them. She is asking for her second loan which she will use to realize different activities if the money is raised, which are: constructing a bathroom, repairing the house, installing water and electricity. Her first load was also used to improve her life and she paid in on time and in good form. She wants to arrive at a dignified living for her children, her partner left to Costa Rica in search of work, and he sends her between 50 and 70 dollars monthly to support the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a bathroom, repairing the house, adding electricity and water

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: el señor Jose H. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la colonia villanueva de la ciudad capital, el tiene un negocio de barberia en general, la cual tiene el nombre de Barberia RAZA, el tiene mas de 5 años de tener su negocio en esa ubicacion, anteriormente donde estaba  ubicado su negocio era en la colonia Kennedy siempre en la ciudad capital, el poco a poco y con mucho sacrificio a logrado nuevamenete adquirir clientela, cabe mensionar que esta actividad la aprendio ya que el trabajaba en una barberia desde niño, recogiendo y barriendo pelo cuando terminaban de cortar pelo a los clientes, el tambien estuvo en los Estados Unidos en donde aprendio mas cosas, el esta casado y tiene un hijo y con el esfuerzo que realiza con su trabajo diariamente logra mantener a su familia, el necesita un credito para ajustar el dinero para comprar un carro pick-up ya que lo necesita para comprar frutas y venderlas frente a su barberia.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose H. is 23 years old and lives in Colonia Villanueva in the capital city. He owns a a barber shop named Raza Barber Shop. Jose has operated the business in this location for the past 5 years, as it was previously located in Colonia Kennedy, also in the capital city. Jose, little by little, with great sacrifice has been able to atract new clients. Jose learned his trade of cutting hair when he was a young boy, as he used to sweep the floor of a babershop when he was younger. Jose also traveled to the United States, where he furthered his knowledge of the trade. Mr. H. is married with one son. From all his daily efforts in his work, Jose is able to support his family. Currently, he is requesting a loan to purchase a pick-up truck which he will use to transport fruits and vegetables that he sells outside of his barber shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a pick-up truck

loans.name: Ly
