texts.en: Ly C. L. is 24 years old and lives in the Siem Reap province with her husband. So far, she has no children. She sells fish with her husband in a busy market. On average, they make around USD $3 per day. This couple has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Podemos hablar de  la Sra Miguela E., tiene 40años , con 3 hijos , tiene una despensa , ella empezo vendiendo  golosinas y comestible y asi fue surguiendo con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio  y logro crecer economicamente a gran escala, y asi mantener y educar ella sola a sus hijos, ya que es madre soltera pero dice que eso no es inconveniente, es un ejemplo para las madres solteras de escasos recursos.

Nos comenta que gracias a los creditos que otorgo la fundacion ella esta alcanzando sus objetivos.

Los miembros de este grupo hacen ventas de todos tipos, y estan realizando esta prestamo para comprar mas mercederia para vender.  

Fany R.        	Venta de zapatos
Miguela E. 	Despensa
Nelly S.	        Kiosco
Celina Ledesma  	Vendedora Ambulante
Antonia C. 	        Venta de helados
Maria Alba C.	Venta de ropas 
Mirian Agüero    	Venta de verduras
Gladys Cañiza    	Venta de comidas
Idalina Z. 	Modista
Maria A.           Venta de merceria
Gabriela A.	Venta de tortas
Gloria G. 	Ventas de zapatos
Rosalia M.	        Venta de empanadas
Licia Barua V.   	Venta de ropas
Lidia N. 	        Venta de merceria 
Luisa O. 	        Venta de empanadas
texts.en:
Mrs. Miguela E. [one of the members of the group] is 40 years old and has 3 children. She has a general store—she began by selling candies and sweets and gasoline, and with her efforts and sacrifices she grew economically on a large scale. She alone supports and educates her children. Although she is a single mother, she says that it does not inconvenience her. She is an example for single mothers with limited resources. She is grateful for the loans the foundation [Fundacion Paraguaya] has given her to help her reach her goals. The members of this group sell all kinds of things and are asking for this loan to purchase more merchandise to sell. Fany R. sells shoes. Miguela E. has a general store. Nelly S. has a kiosk . Celina Ledesma is a street vendor. Antonia C. sells ice cream. Maria Alba C. sells clothing. Mirian Agüero sells vegetables. Gladys Cañiza sells food. Idalina Z. works in fashion. Maria A. sells general merchandise. Gabriela A. sells baked goods. Gloria G. sells shoes Rosalia M. sells empanadas (pastries). Licia Barua V. sells clothes. Lidia N. sells general merchandise. Luisa O. sells empanadas (pastires).

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora es casada, tiene 34 años de edad y es madre de 6 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches en un lugar que acondiciona fuera de su casa para recibir a sus comensales. Este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 3 años, y lo que gusta es preparar bien cada uno de los platos de comida, para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos por su buena sazón, además que también le agrada conversar con las personas mientras las atiende. Este negocio es muy rentable para Aurora, ya que para ella, cocinar no es complicado y prepara especialidades de rápida cocción y poca inversión, pero muy demandadas, es por ello que para el futuro se proyecta a tener un restaurante. Con MFP ya tiene 5 préstamos, y está contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos se apoyan y son bien coordinados. Aurora invertirá 1500 soles en la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio, y con lo restante comprará los ingredientes básicos de sus comidas (carnes, arroz, papas y otros).
texts.en:
Aurora is 32 years old and married with six children. She sells food in the evenings in a spot away from home where she also sets up tables and chairs for her guests to eat. She has been doing this for three years now and likes to take time preparing each dish properly so that her customers can fully enjoy their delicious taste. She also likes to talk to people whilst serving them. This is a highly lucrative business for Aurora since she finds cooking easy and is able to prepare special dishes both quickly and inexpensively, and which prove very popular. It is for this reason that she plans to own a restaurant in the future. She has previously obtained 5 loans from MFP and happily participates in her local communal bank, as everyone is well-coordinated and supportive of each other. Aurora intends to invest 1500 sols in buying tables and chairs for her business and will use the rest to buy basic ingredients (meat, rice, potatoes etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture and cooking supplies for business purposes

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene C., a 32-year-old housewife is married to a pedicab driver. The couple has two children. The family resides in Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Arlene decided to buy a second-hand pump boat as an additional source of income. Whatever fish the pump boat catches she delivers to her customers, reserving some of for the family's food for the day as her husband's pedicab driving will not suffice. Soon she hopes to buy another pump boat to meet her family's daily needs as well as the cost of educating of their children.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand pump boat

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 53 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en casa D. sus padres. DesD. hace 8 años se dedica a la venta D. llantas, trabaja durante todo el día en un local comercial que arrendó. Sus hijos la ayudan en atender su establecimiento en sus horarios libres y D. esa manera comparten juntos esta actividad, y D. esa manera se esfuerza por mejorar su negocio, que hasta el momento está yendo muy bien por la buena atención que ofrece y siempre está al tanto D. brindar ofertas a sus clientes. Para más adelante, Elsa no sólo sueña con vender llantas, sino también diversos repuestos para todos los modelos D. los carros. Es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y está con todas las ganas D. seguir esforzándose en el trabajo con su banco comunal. El dinero que requiere lo invertirá en la compra D. más mercadería en llantas.
texts.en:
Elsa is 53-years old and lives with her four children in her parents' house. For 8 years she has worked selling tires; she works all day in a commercial space that she rents. Her children help her attend the store in their free time and in this way the family works together to improve the business, which at the moment is doing well due to good customer service and the good product choices they always proviD. to their customers. In the future, Elsa not only dreams of selling tires but also various spare parts for different car models. This is her third loan with MFP and wants very much to keep working hard with the members of her community bank. The money she needs will be invested in the purchase of tires.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Liên Thị Bích Hoàng was born in 1965. ( no: 010110040037 ). Her family has a bazaar at home. She works in a livestock farm and, in addition, she breed pigs and poultry at home. She lives with her husband, who is a soldier, and their two children. She has a monthly income of about 4.500.000 VND. She wants to borrow 2.436.000 VND (~ $145 USD) to buy goods to sell.

There are four other borrowers in her loan group.

  • Hiệp Thị Đồng was born in 1965. (no: 010110040038). She is raising 200 chickens, 150 wild geese. She wants to borrow 2.436.000 VND (~ $145 USD) to buy poultry feed.
  • Hằng Thị Nguyễn was born in 1969.(no: 010110040040). She has a hairdresser’s shop. She wants to borow 2.436.000 VND(~ $145 USD) to expand her shop.
  • Oanh K. Thị Nguyễn was born in 1978. (no: 010110040039). She sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 2.436.000 VND (~ $145 USD) to buy more vegetables to sell.
  • Cầm Thị Ngô was born in 1969. (no: 010110040041 ). She is a tailor. She wants to borrow 2.436.000 VND (~ $145 USD) to buy cloth to make clothes.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells foodstuffs and rechargeable phone cards, and she also offers phone calls. Felicia is 32 years old and married with 3 children. Felicia hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Chhen's Group

texts.en:
These are three low-income people who are jointly taking this group loan and they all set a plan to use their loan for different purposes. One of these people, Mrs. Chhen T., 46, has been selected to be a leader by the other members.

Chhen T. is a married mother blessed with four children, three of whom are single and the other one is married. Two of her kids are employed in a garment factory.

Chhen T. currently sells various vegetables in the market to earn a living, while her husband is a rice farmer. Chhen T. will use her loan to help reduce their transportation costs by buying an old motorbike for her family’s traveling needs.

The other two borrowers are:

Mr. Saly S., a rice farmer, who is asking for a loan to buy a piglet to raise.

Mrs. Chhim T. will be using her loan for capital to begin raising pigs.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Hing S., 48, and her husband, Keut Om, 47, are both shown in the photo above. This couple uses their house to run their own business by getting cloth from garment industry to sew into other products in order to charge fees. They typically make a daily revenue of US$ 3 per day to contribute to their family’s daily expenses. They were married years ago and blessed with five children; three of them are working as sewing workers in a garment factory.

Hing S. finds it hard traveling anywhere and she needs to pay a lot of money for it, because she doesn’t have her own vehicle for her and her family’s traveling needs. She has therefore decided to seek a loan to buy a used motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia makes a living running a general store in the rural village of San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. She aspires to have her business grow and be competitive with other stores in their village. She has four children with Monato C., her husband, who works as an Overseas Filipino Worker in Saudi. Their four children are all studying. They need to help each other to give them a good education so that some day all of them will have a good future. Their eldest is now 13 years old, studying in high school with their second child. The two younger children are both in elementary school.

Alicia is asking for a loan to be used as additional business capital to purchase commodities for her general store. She hopes to access a loan of 10,000 PHP that will surely be very useful in the improvement of her store. Alicia believes that time is gold; thus, they work very hard and help each other in the progress of their daily lives, doing their best not to waste time for nothing.

loans.use: Additional capital for a general store

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Felipa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 42 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 4 hijos, Felipa no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ella  vive en la comunidad de segundo Camicachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra ganado menor ovino, además parte del dinero será utilizado en su negocio de venta de comida.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos menores.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los pagos.
texts.en:
Felipa is a member of the Manuela de Hoy II Community bank, which is located in the Camicachi community, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 42, married, and she has four children. Felipa did not have the opportunity to get an education. She lives in the community of Segundo Camicachi. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for years. She used her initial loan for 300 PEN to buy small livestock. She now needs a loan for 2,500 PEN to buy sheep. Also, part of the money will be used in her food selling business. Her wish is to keep working and to help her younger children. She likes the savings and the ease of the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is aged 32 years. She is a widow and is the mother of two school-going children. She lives in Gitare Runyenjes.

Mary owns a retail shop which she started in 2000. She sells essentials items mostly used in the community such as sugar, flour, rice, and kerosene.  She has applied for Kshs 30,000 to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice and beans

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Alberto G. le está haciendo falta un portón al frente de su casa, ya que van tres veces que se han metido a su vivienda a robarle por falta de seguridad ya que trabaja todo el día.
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar el portón y colocarlo.
Don José Alberto es empleado de una compañía en el departamento de atención a los clientes, este es el ingreso que el obtiene y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
José Alberto's dwelling lacks a front gate and thieves have broken into it three times already thanks to the lack of security and the fact that he is away at work all day. For this reason he is asking for financing to pay the person who will make and install the gate. José Alberto is employed by a company in the customer service department. He intends to use his salary from this job to repay his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a front gate on his home.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en: Proscovia is a 40-year-old divorced mother of five children ages 16-22. None of her children attend school because they lack the school fees. Proscovia owns a two-room house where she lives with seven people because she takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. She has a stall at her home where she sells charcoal to all types of customers, both retail and wholesale. She has been in this business for five years. Proscovia works seven days a week, and receives an average of 25 customers a day.  She incurs additional transport to and from shopping from Kalerwe Market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala, where she buys sacks of charcoal. Her major business challenges include thieves and the rainy season.  Her monthly expense is feeding the family. She has been with MCDT for four years and is on her eighth loan, still working with the same group mates. Proscovia joined MCDT because it was near her home and it offers loans to women as a group. Proscovia will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.  She wishes to grow her business enough so she can start selling only on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Silvia

texts.es:
La señora María Silvia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Alondras II”, Distrito de Bagua, Provincia de Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

María Silvia, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, razón por la cual decidió implementar su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, ubicada en un ambiente, muy bien acondicionado. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 400.00 y empezó comprando 03 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus bebidas gasificadas, donde con el tiempo, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son los mismos trabajadores y personas que van a ser algún tramite en la Municipalidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará mas bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
María Silvia, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
María Silvia, 33, is a member of the "Las Alondras II" (The Larks) communal bank which is in the Bagua district, Utcubamba province, Amazonas department. She lives with her life partner and their two sons, both of whom still are dependent on her. María Silvia is a hard-working, tenacious woman who decided to set up her own business selling carbonated beverages in a well-equipped environment. She herself administers her business, without a boss or a set schedule. She tells us that she started out with 400 soles and bought three cases of soft-drinks. She noted that she did very well but didn't have enough stock. In time, bit by bit, she invested more. Currently, she continues with the same business and she is well-known by her customers who are the same workers and persons who come to take care of paperwork at city hall. With this 1,000 sol loan she will buy more soft-drinks in various flavors, sizes and brands as well as mineral water, both sparkling and still. María Silvia has many goals before her and she feels motivated to see them come to fruition. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help. She is responsible with her repayments and she intends to stay that way.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy packages of soft-drinks.

loans.name: Alma Ruth

texts.es:
la señora Alma Ruth C. tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, uno de 4 y una de 8 años, trabaja desde hace 8 años en la venta de golosinas, refrescos, jugos y todo tipo de alajas enchapadas en oro, las golosinas y demas alimentos los comercializa en su domicilio, con la ayuda de su mama doña Ofelia F. de 65 años de edad, es su madre quien le ayuda y le cuida el negocio cuando
su hija va a la ciudad de pespire a vender las joyas, juntas trabajan con el objetivo de sacar adelante la familia, Alma  esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio y poder aprovechar la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Alma Ruth C. is 33 years old and the single mother of 2 children, 4 and 8 years old. For the last 8 years she has worked selling sodas, sweet drinks, juices, and all kinds of local snacks. She prepares the sweet drinks and the snacks in her home with the help of her mother, Ofelia F., who is 65 years old. Ofelia helps Alma and takes care of the business when Alma needs to go to the city. They are working together to help improve the quality of life for their family. Alma is requesting a loan to stock up her business for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sodas, juices, chickens, meat and other things she needs to stock her store for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Bernadette Baï

texts.fr: A. Bernadette Baï est née le 20 Août 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Bernadette Baï vit à Cococodji, non loin de Cotonou, depuis environs 8 ans. Mariée à TCHIAKPE Zakari, un commerçant, Bernadette Baï est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Bernadette Baï vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Bernadette Baï a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Bernadette Baï exerce ce métier depuis 5 ans déjà. Bernadette Baï vend également des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Bernadette Baï s’approvisionne. Bernadette Baï a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, et a bien remboursé le prêt. Bernadette Baï voudrait élever le niveau de son activité et satisfaire davantage sa clientèle. C’est pourquoi Bernadette Baï sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Bernadette Baï was born on August 20, 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She has been living in Cococodji, not far from Cotonou, for about eight years.  Married to TCHIAKPE Zakari, a merchant, she is the mother of two children who are both in school.  She lives together with her children and husband.  The couple provides for the family jointly.  Bernadette Baï had dropped out of secondary school and then learned how to style hair.  She has been working at this trade for about five years already.  She also sells hair extensions and cosmetic products in her salon.  She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She once obtained a loan from ALIDé and has repaid it.  She would like to raise her level of business and to satisfy her customers more.  This is why she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 3 boxes of cosmetics and 5 dozen hair extensions

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: LA SRA. SOFIA SE DEDICA LA ARTESANIA EN MACRAME DE CARTERAS, MANTAS Y OTROS PRODUCTOS LOS MISMOS QUE REPARTE  Y VENDE POR TODA LA ZONA SUD, LA ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZA LA AYUDA A PODER SOSTENER SU HOGAR COMFORMADO POR 2 HIJOS UNO DE ELLOS ESTUDIA EN COLEGIO Y EL OTRO EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, TAMBIEN SE PUDO VERIFCAR QUE LA CLIENTE VIVE MODESTAMENTE YA QUE NO TIENE MUCHOS MUEBLES Y ENSERES EN EL CUARTO DONDE VIVEN, EL ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA CARPINTERIA Y HACE TRABAJOS EVENTUALES QUE NO LE PERMITE SER DE MUCHA AYUDA EN LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR PERO JUNTOS TRATAN DE SACAR A LA FAMILIA ADELANTE CON MUCHO ESFUERZO. ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON LA INSTITUCION POR EL FINANCIAMIENTO
texts.en:
Ms. Sofia works by crafting macramé handbags, blankets, and other related products, selling and distributing them throughout the southern district. Her work helps her to maintain her home life, consisting of two children: one in school and the other in college. It's also confirmed that this client lives modestly, since her place doesn't have much furniture or other home articles. Her husband works in carpentry and does temporary work. This doesn't necessarily allow him to provide much help with family expenses, but together they are working hard to get ahead as a family. They are very thankful for the financing provided by this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing raw materials

loans.name: Francisco Rene

texts.es: El señor Francisco René tiene 65 años de edad, el tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar de la manera más humilde, por lo que la realiza con el objetivo de generar ingresos necesarios para su familia. El es una persona muy sociable y que además sus vecinos asisten a su pulpería porque él es un hombre con mucha experiencia. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de golosinas, pan, leña, azúcar y refrescos naturales. El sueño de Francisco es mantener su actividad activa.
texts.en:
Francisco René, 65, has collaborated with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and the various loans have been of great benefit for his business. He has had a small grocery store for the last 6 years. He has always enjoyed working and does so in a very unassuming way to earn income for his family. He is a very sociable person and his neighbors come to his store because he has a lot of experience. He is asking for this funding to buy stock items like: sweets, bread, firewood, sugar, beverages. Francisco's dream is to stay active.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Ganyana Busabala Group, Kampala

texts.en: Ruth N. is 60 years old and is a very hard-working lady with a continuous drive to succeed. She is the mother of seven children, with several grandchildren to take care of. Ruth is from Busabala and has been a farmer for eight years, growing foodstuffs for sale as well as keeping animals and birds for milk and meat. She is quick to say that her past loans have enabled her to expand and excel in her business. She currently needs a loan to be able to buy fertilizers and more produce for resale since this season was not favorable for her.

loans.use: Buying fertilizers and more produce for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a widowed lady and mother of two children.  She has a photo studio which she has been running for eight years.  She gained her skills for photography because she was previously a camera lady.  Faulu Kenya is an MFI which offers training for her clients.  Therefore, Jane appreciates that she has learned how to keep her business records.  She intends to buy a photocopy machine hence she has requested for a loan of Kes.30,000.  She hopes to open other outlets of the same business.

loans.use: Buy a photocopy machine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a LAPO client. Elizabeth sells planks at retail prices to her customers; she has been in this business for 7 years. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 45 years old and married with 2 children. Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy. Elizabeth’s husband is a carpenter and he also works to support their home. She is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is 29 years old, and married with three children who go to school. For the past three years, she has been running a shop where she sells cereals and has plans to grow her business. Her husband works in a factory. Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, her business has grown because she can access loans. She aims to improve her business and establish a strong reputation in her neighborhood. Her dream is to someday grow her business into a wholesale enterprise. She has requested for a loan of kes. 60,000 to buy more cereals for sale.

loans.use: To add stock of cereals for sale

loans.name: Juan Leonard

texts.en: Juan Leonard is part of the Unidos para el Triunfo community bank, which translates to “United for Triumph”. He is 45 years old and lives in Cusco with his spouse. Together, they have two children, ages 19 and 17. Juan Leonard makes his living as an employee of the state, but also owns a small business outside of the city raising and selling cuy, or guinea pigs. In this region, guinea pigs are considered a delicacy and are usually roasted and served whole during lunchtime. Juan Leonard currently owns 300 guinea pigs that he plans on selling. Juan Leonard will use a Kiva loan to help grow his small business raising guinea pigs, and will use the loan to buy feed for the animals. He is appreciative of, and thankful for, the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pig feed

loans.name: Khazar

texts.en: Khazar Q. is a 28 year old man who sells construction materials in the Saatli region. He is married and has two daughters. Khazar started his business in 2005 when he needed money for a wedding. Khazar applies for 1000 AZN to increase the number of items he sells.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Emprendiendo Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. ANTONIA TIENE 45 AÑOS, ES CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "EMPRENDIENDO SIN FRONTERAS", JUNTO CON 7 PERSONAS MÁS, RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. COMAS, QUIENES LA ELIGIERON COMO TESORERA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
ELLA SE DEDICA HACE DOS AÑOS A ATENDER SU TIENDA D. ABARROTES D. NOMBRE "BODEGUITA TRINIDAD", INICIÓ EN UN LOCAL ALQUILADO UBICADO FRENTE A UN MERCADO, LUEGO D. SUFRIR UN ROBO SE MUDO A SU CASA DOND. LE VA MUY BIEN.
CON SU TRABAJO PUED. APOYAR A SU HIJA EN LOS GASTOS D. LA UNIVERSIDAD E IN CONSTRUYENDO D. A POQUITOS SU CASITA.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ PARA COMPRAR INSUMOS PARA INSTALAR UN NEGOCIO D. COMIDA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia is 45 years old, married with 3 children. She is part of the "Emprendiendo Sin Fronteras" group alongsiD. 7 more people living in the Comas district, who elected her as treasurer of the group's managing board. She has been managing her grocery store, called "Bodeguita Trinidad", for two years. She started off in rented premises opposite a market. After having been robbed she moved the business to her own home, where things are going well. With her work she supports her daughter's university expenses and slowly builds her own home. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of food supplies to start a food business.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a food business

loans.name: Fatima Del Consuelo

texts.es:
Fátima, como muchas mujeres trabajadoras está dedicada a su hogar y a su negocio, vive en la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos como se conoce también a Portoviejo, la capital de la provincia de Manabí.

 Ella se dedica al comercio de zapatos y de  carteras,  sale a visitar a las clientas, tiene  7 años dedicándose a este  negocio, está casada y tiene una hija de 21 años, viven en casa propia.

 A nuestra socia le va muy bien trabajando con la Fundación. La mercadería la compra en Guayaquil, también recibe de su prima mercadería pues ella tiene una boutique, la señora Fátima tiene muchas clientas, ella y su prima se ayudan mutuamente, y procura conseguir la mercadería que las clientas le pidan. El esposo trabaja en el Consejo Provincial y su hija estudia medicina en la universidad. Están conscientes que todo lo que hacen es por el bien de su hija, la aman y harían todo por ella  ya que la carrera que eligió genera muchos gastos.

Ver realizada a su hija, en todos los aspectos es el sueño de Fátima, por eso  a ella no le importan los sacrificios que tenga que hacer.
texts.en:
Fátima, like many hard-working women, is dedicated to her home and to her business. She lives in the city of Reales Tamarindos, also known as Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabí province. She sells shoes and purses, going out to visit customers in person, and has been in the business for 7 years. She is married, has a 21-year old daughter, and lives in her own house. Working in partnership with Fundación has gone very well for her. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil, which she also sells in her boutique. Fátima has a good customer base, gets help from a cousin, and procures the merchandise requested by her customers. Her husband works for the Province Council and her daughter is studying medicine at the university. They are conscious that everything they do is for the benefit of their daughter. They love her, and would do everything necessary for her, as the career she has chosen generates a great deal of expenses. Fátima’s dream is to see her daughter become fulfilled in every aspect. For that reason, she doesn’t mind any sacrifices she may have to make to realize this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase purses and shoes.

loans.name: Adwen Pa Trust  Bank Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth describes herself as a hard working woman. She is 56 years old and the leader of the “Adwen pa” (translated as Good thought) borrower group. Elizabeth is a petty trader who has been selling fresh yams for the past 4 years. She also engages in farming as her second business to make extra income for her family. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase 100 tubers of yam. She dreams of being able to expand her market and increase her stocks to 1000 tubers of yam. She is married to a farmer with four children. Elizabeth hopes to mobilize more savings to provide quality education for her children.

The other members of her group are mostly traders who sell rice, meat, food etc. As the leader, Elizabeth ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Mrs. Choeung Kaem Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of twenty one people whom all have been selected Mrs. Choeung K. is a village bank president who was born in 1972 located in Ta Ei village in Takeo province. All the members will use portion of their loan for varied ways in which it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Choeung K. and her husband, Mr. Phoeurn Kory, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family moreover her husband is also a construction worker. Their problem is that their field is infertile and it has a lot insect. So to improve production, Mrs. Choeung K. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline. She is a mother of five children, four of whom are studying in local public school and they all are helping their parents to do farming, while the other is five years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Sky Group

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo are the members of the “Sky” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. These small-business entrepreneurs have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, for the very first time to apply for an SLL 500,000 loan for each to enable them to strengthen their businesses in terms of size and quality.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is 27-year-old Mariatu C., who is pictured in the left. She lives in Makeni together with her husband and two children.

Mariatu sells clothes: T-shirts, underwear, etc. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy dozens of T-shirts and underwear to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy dozens of T-shirts and underwear to add to her stock

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity M. presently sells green vegetables and some fruits (tomatoes, oranges, gavva, and so forth).  She is requesting a loan to stock dried fish to sell. Charity is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a security guard. They have one child, who does not go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open another business where she can sell clothes and shoes.

loans.use: Stock dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 27 years old and a member of the Favour self-help group in Faulu Kenya.  She does embroidery and sells clothes to earn a living.  She also gets financial support from her husband.  Nancy has been in business for two years thanks to Faulu Kenya for assisting her when she needed to rent a business premise.  She has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES to  purchase more clothing for selling.  She hopes to provide a good education to her three children.  She also hopes to expand her business into wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock.

loans.name: Ruth Wanjiku

texts.en:
Ruth Wanjiku K. is 36 years old and married to Paul Wanjohi. She supports seven members of her family. She is a farmer. She does the farming  activity on her own piece of land, which she has been doing for the last seven years.

She learned about KADET LTD. through an awareness campaign done by KADET staff in her area of residence. This will be her second loan. She is planning to spend 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fertilizer and pesticide to spray on her growing wheat. 

With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat on a bigger piece of land.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she will be doing commercial farming. 

She is a hardworking woman and very determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to spray on her growing wheat

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.es:
Eulalio de 55 años es soltero, trabaja para como Vigilante en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 8 meses. 

Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de levantar los arranques de su casita pues actualmente no cuenta con su propia vivienda y desea brindarle a su familia la oportunidad de tenerla, pues es el patrimonio que dejara a sus hijos cuando falte. 

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos estudien y sean hombres de bien y que saquen adelante a nuestro pais.
texts.en:
Eulalio is 55 years old and single.  He has worked as a watchman for the city of Juigalpa for eight months.

He is requesting his second loan in order to start his house.  He does not currently have his own house, and he wants to give his family the opportunity to have one.  It is the inheritance that he will leave for his children.

His greatest dream is for his children to be educated and that they will become good men who will get our country ahead.

loans.use: To start his house

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es:
Janneth tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene carga familiar, reside junto a sus padres en el sector Nuevo San Lorenzo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región y en distrito con mayores índices de pobreza.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Ella ofrece sus productos por pedidos, a más pedidos realizados, obtiene mayores ganancias. Por ello siempre se esfuerza por conseguir más clientes. Actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y con varios pedidos por atender.

Janneth desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos por su cuenta, de modo que pueda contar con un stock permanente de productos y pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes sin tener que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llegan los pedidos. Para ello ha solicitado un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Los ingresos que percibe de su negocio los utiliza para ayudar a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Janneth is 27 years old, single, and does not have any family obligations. She lives with her parents in the Nuevo San Lorenzo sector of the José Leonardo Ortiz District, one of the most populated districts in the region with high rates of poverty.

Janneth sells beauty products through a catalog. She offers her products by taking orders. The more orders she completes, the greater the income she is able to earn. Therefore, she always strives to attract more customers. Janneth currently has an established customer base and receives different orders that she must fulfill.

In order to expand her business, Janneth wants to buy more products so that she can have a permanent inventory which will enable her to meet the demands of her customers without having to wait until the end of the month when the orders arrive. To accomplish this, she is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN.

Janneth is a young entrepreneur who has the drive to succeed. The income she generates from her business will be a great help to her family. Her greatest wish is to provide her family members with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase more cosmetics to increase her sales

loans.name: Guillermo Alberto

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene la edad de 42 años, casado, con tres hermosos hijos, siendo su esposa comerciante.
Mi trabajo que hago es el servicio de taxi, que día a día recorro la capital de Managua. Iniciando como cadete, luego con ahorros logre comprar un carro usado que he venido dando mantenimiento para lograr mejorar la condición del motor.
Decide un financiamiento ya que desea  pintar el vehículo, y cambiar unas piezas lo que no cuenta con todo el dinero y quiere mejorar la condición física ya que es su medio de trabajo.
Lo que esta animado por el apoyo de la institución en donde podrá proceder con el objetivo de mejorar su trabajo como mejores utilidades para el bienestar de su familia
texts.en:
Guillermo is 42 years old.  He is married and has three beautiful children.  His wife is a trader.  “My work is providing a taxi service.  Every day I work in the capital city Managua.  I began as a young man then with my savings I managed to buy a used car which I have been maintaining in order to improve the condition of  its engine”.

Guillermo is requesting a loan because he would like to give his vehicle a paint job and replace some parts.  He does not have enough money to do this but he would like to change his vehicle's physical appearance since it is his means of work.

He is motivated by the support of our organization as it will allow him to proceed with his goal of improving his work and obtain better profits for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To maintain his taxi with a paint job and some spare parts for his engine which will enable him to provide a better service

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julio; El socio tiene  45 años de edad, el es conviviente, y tiene 3 hijos, el socio trabaja como personal de seguridad desde el año 2003, el socio a su vez está invirtiendo en la artesanía junto a su conyugue, el está trabajando paralelamente de manera independiente con la artesanía, el socio compra y vende artesanía, el ahora desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la temporada de navidad. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la copra de mercadería de tipo artesanal.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Julio is a member of the “Los Diamantes” (Diamonds) community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Julio is 45 years old.  He lives with his partner and has 3 children.  He has worked as a security guard since 2003.  He is also investing in a handicrafts business together with his spouse.  In parallel with his main job, he is also working independently in the handicraft business.  He buys and sells handicrafts.  Julio would like this loan to invest in buying merchandise for the Christmas season.  He is requesting the loan to invest in buying handicrafts.

He is grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  He also pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To invest in buying handicrafts

loans.name: Quenida

texts.es: Quenida, D. 36 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. su esposo Denis D. 40 años, que es taxista  y sus 3 hijos, que están en edad escolar; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. DesD. hace 3 años, esta trabajadora mujer se dedica al alquiler D. 2 autos, que elL. misma administra, y esta muy satisfecha pues las ganancias que obtiene le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Manifiesta que no es fácil porque debió buscar  chóferes D. confianza y además siempre esta atenta a los desperfectos que puedan presentar los vehículos. Lo que no le gusta es que algunas veces los chóferes, que trabajan para elL., se retrasan en el pago diario que le deben dar, y esto perjudica el movimiento del capital. Pero a pesar D. los problemas sabe que saldrá adelante pues su esposo, que es chofer le brinda buenos consejos que le sirven para avanzar; también tiene muchos planes futuros como comprar más autos e instalar una flota D. taxis. Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Quenida tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en brindarle mantenimiento a sus autos, pues han presentado algunas imperfecciones y elL. quiere ofrecer el mejor servicio a los pasajeros que suben, D. esta manera sabe que mejorará sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Quenida, 36, lives in her own house with her husband, Denis, 40, who is a taxi driver, and their three school age children.  Together they struggle to get ahead daily.

For the last three years this hard working woman leases out two vehicles that she herself administers.  She is very satisfied with the profits she earns which allow her to help her husband meet household expenses.

She states that it isn’t easy because she had to find trustworthy drivers and she always has to be aware of any mechanical problems the vehicles may have.  

What she dislikes is that sometimes a driver working for her falls back on the daily payments he’s supposed to give her and this impedes capital circulation.  Despite the problems, though, she knows that she will get ahead because her husband, who is a driver, gives her good advice that is useful to her advancement.  She has a lot of plans for the future like buying more vehicles to have a taxi fleet.

This is her 7th loan with MFP and she promises to repay on time in order not to disappoint the people who maD. this contribution that will allow her to stay in business seeking progress.

Quenida plans to use the loan to service her vehicles because they are experiencing some mechanical problems and she wants to proviD. better service to passengers they pick up.  She knows that her profits will improve this way.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Arly Antonio

texts.es:
Arly es un  hombre trabajador, de oficio mecánico industrial, con doce años de experiencia, y también posee sus maquinas para hacer costura, el cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien es costurera. 
Juntos han venido logrando la construcción de su casa, con el crédito anterior lograron avanzar con el porche, ya que ha venido haciendo estas mejoras por medio del financiamiento de Afodenic quien ha dado una mejor vivienda atreves de sus préstamos con plazos que satisfacen sus expectativas.
Con este nuevo préstamo lograra la terminación de su porche ya que cerrara por completo. Para esto comprara materiales de construcción como: bloques, cemento, hierro
texts.en:
Arly is a hard worker in the industrial mechanical trade, with twelve years of experience.  He also owns sewing machines and has the support of his wife who is a seamstress.  

Together they have been building their house and with previous loans were able to start on the porch.  Through the Afodenic loans, which offered payment terms meeting their expectations, they were able to make the home improvements done so far.

With the new loan they plan to finish the porch so that it is completely closed off.  To do this they need to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement and steel.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as bricks, sand, cement and steel to finish the porch

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en: Merilyn M. is from the village of Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Merilyn is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Merilyn runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling school products such as pencils, pens and notebooks. Merilyn has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Merilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Merilyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Merilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marbin

texts.en:
Marbin is from the village of Fatima Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte. He is 45 years old. Marbin is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marbin owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing photography services to the local community. Marbin has been engaged in his business for over  years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Marbin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marbin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Marbin is requesting a new loan of 45000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marbin from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Marta De La Cruz

texts.es: Marta De La Cruz se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 5 que tiene este medio de vida. Ella siempre esta ofreciéndoles a sus clientes un buen servicio a sus clientes, la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, la mayoría de sus vecinos son sus clientes que siempre están solicitándole diferentes productos. el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes.
texts.en: Marta De La Cruz has a convenience store. She has had this business for more than 5 years. She always provides her clients with excellent client service. Her business is installed in her house and the majority of her neighbors are also clients and they continually request new products. The loan will be used to purchase basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, breads, cookies, and detergents.

loans.use: To purchase general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours. In addition she is also employed at the municipal council where she earns her other source of income. Mwanapili faces the challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. She hopes to expand her business and become more reliable in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bags of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase bags of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Leonel Jose

texts.es:
LEONEL M. R., ES DE MANAGUA, TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE GRANOS BASICOS, FRUTAS Y VERDURAS, PRODUCTOS LACTEOS Y BOTERIA, TIENE MAS DE 2 AÑOS DE TENER EL NEGOCIO.
ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE DOS HIJOS, Y ESTOS ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE EL Y UNA SE ENCUENTRA EN EL COLEGIO.
DON LEONEL ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA  INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA COMO: GRANOS BASICOS, FRUTAS Y PRODUCTOS LACTEOS. 
LEONEL DICE QUE GRACIAS AL FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL SU NEGOCIO HA CRECIDO Y AHORA CUENTA CON MAS PRODUCTOS PARA OFERTAR.
texts.en:
LEONEL M. R. is from Managua.  He has a business selling basic grains, fruit, vegetables, dairy products and shoes.  He’s had the business over two years.

He’s the father of two children who are dependent on him; one of them is in school.

Leonel comes by the Ceprodel offices to request a loan to buy merchandise like: basic grains, fruit and dairy products.

Leonel says that thanks to Ceprodel loans his business has grown and now he has more products to offer.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, fruit, vegetables and dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sacks of  charcoal.

loans.name: Popoul's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members who have selected Mrs. Popoul as the group leader. Each member will use their loan portion to support a variety of purposes.

Mrs. Popoul and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land upon which they grow rice for their family living. Additionally, her husband sells Khmer natural medicine. Mrs. Popoul is now requesting a loan to support her crop production.  This couple has a child who is a wedding chef.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Reseda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Reseda lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras  originarias de Morimbo, Masaya. Esta ciudad fue nombrada la cuna del folklore nicaragüense en especial por que se trabaja mucho lo artesanal.
 La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Silvia B. López ella se dedica al comercio de ropa típica desde hace 8 años. Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde su especialidad es la realización de cotonas.
El crédito lo invertirá en tela, hilos, bordado y su meta es tener una tienda.
Las otras dos integrantes son  María Isabel M. quien también realiza ropa típica en especial las maxi y María O. Sandigo se dedica a la elaboración de sombreros de palma la cual comercializa en el norte del país.
texts.en:
The Reseda group is made up of three hard-working, driven and enterprising people from Monimbo, Masaya.  This city was named the birthplace of Nicaraguan folklore in particular because its people make a lot of handicrafts.

The group's coordinator is Silvia B. López who has been selling traditional clothes for 8 years.  She has a small sewing workshop where her speciality is making thick cotton shirts.  She will invest her loan in buying fabric, threads and embroidery supplies.  Her goal is to own a store.

The other two members of the group are María Isabel M. who also sells traditional clothes, in particular long skirts, and María O. Sandigo who makes palm leaf hats which she sells in the north of the country.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Saturnina Gloria

texts.es:
Saturnina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, de estado civil soltera tiene cuatro hijos (3 independientes).  La señora estudió educación secundaria.
Saturnina cuenta que tiene un puesto en el mercado donde vende artículos artesanales como: chalinas, chamanes. Sombreros y bordados en bayetas.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año,  su préstamo anterior fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementará al capital de su negocio para comprar veinte panoramas grandes, lanas, bayetas para luego venderlos a sus clientes.
Su sueño es poder dar estudios a sus hijos y sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en: Saturnina is a member of the community bank Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) in the district of Juli, Chucuito province, department of Puno. She is 52 years old, single, and has four children, three of whom are self-sufficient. She has a high school education. Saturnina has a stall at a market, where she sells handmade scarves, hats and embroidered cloths. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for about a year. Her last loan was for 300 Soles, which she put into her business. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 Soles. This money will help her increase her working capital. She'll be able to buy 20 large new panoramas, as well as wool and cloths, which she will be able to sell to her customers. Saturnina's dream is to see all of her children get an education and become professionals. She likes her community bank's loan office very much.

loans.use: buy 20 large panoramas, wool and cloths (handmade).

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor is 59 years old.  She resides in the Kampong Chnang province of Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sor and her husband are farmers, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 10 on other necessary expenses. 

Sor is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more rice for the family's use. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Unión Estrella Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN ESTRELLA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lola. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio 

La señora Lola indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida y humintas, que inicio hace diez años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de refrescos, cerveza, insumos para la elaboración de las comidas), que consiguieran por mayor de la Ceja y el Puente Vela (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y los venderá en la parada del minibús 692, de lunes a sábado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación continua y salud básica.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Unión Estrella” (Union Star) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Lola. The members of this Communal Bank have succeeded in their various businesses in the retail, manufacturing, and service sectors.

Sra. Lola says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation at a promotional event. She currently has a business selling food and Bolivian tamales. Lola started her business ten years ago.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy soft drinks, beer, and supplies for preparing her dishes. She acquires her supplies in bulk in the neighborhood of La Ceja and at El Puente Vela (a commercial area in the city of El Alto). Lola sells her dishes Monday through Saturday at the No. 692 Minibus Stop. By working in this manner, she is able to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Lola is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lola said that she enjoys the continuing education seminars and the basic health services.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beer, and supplies for preparing dishes.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 36 years old. She has five children who are aged 3-17 years old. Her husband is a builder. 

Beatha sells foodstuffs which include beans and Irish potatoes and also charcoal. She has done this business for the past 15 years. This business enables her to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house. 

She needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs and make more profits. She plans to save the profit until she can afford to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group

texts.es:
En el estado D. VeraC. D. L. llave existe una pequeña comunidad llamada El Paraiso, L. cual se encuentra ubicada en L. carretera Cordoba-veraC., en esta pequeña comunidad existe una UD.(Grupo integrado por mas D. dies personas que tienen una cuanta en el banco y se reunen semanalmente) llamada Flor D. campo.

L. señora Julisa es uno D. los once miembros D. este grupo,elL. tiene L. edad D. 41 años, estudio solo L. primaria y se encuentra casada con el señor juan el cual trabaja en el campo, doña julissa tuvo tres hijos pero actualmente solo depenD. D. elL. el mas pequeño llamado plablo D. 12 años que asiste a L. primaria D. su comunidad.

doña Julissa nos platica que siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora desD. que dejo D. estudiar su madre le enseño a trabajar en las labores del hogar y a preparar antojitos mexicanos como chiles reyenos y tamales lo cual le ha ayudado mucho ya que desD. que se caso ha ralizado sus ventas D. comida los fines D. semana para poder ganar un poco D. dinero extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, EL. venD. sus antojitos con sus amigos y vecinos D. L. comunidad, primero realiza los tamales y chiles cuando ya estan listos los coloca en cubetas y sale a vender casa por casa y gracias a Dios siempre venD. todo, Doña julissa ademas D. vender antojitos tambien venD. carne D. res y cerdo los dias Miercoles, jueves y viernes. elL. necesita este credito para invertirlo en L. compra D. carne, chiles, Huevos, tomates, cebolL., maiz, leña, hojas D. platano , aceite y bolsas plasticas.

elL. nos platica que su venta le ha ayudado mucho ya que poco a poco con L. ayuda D. su esposo ha contruido su casa D. material y espera con sus ganancias seguir L. contruccion ya que quiere que sus hijos tengan un patrimonio y nada les falte.

los otros diez integrantes son:

maria venta D. abarrotes, alejandro zapatos, Galvina papeleria, Alberta venta D. ropa, rosa venta D. zapatos, juana venta D. ropa, juana B venta D. abarrotes, maria cristina venta D. pan, esteban venta D. pan y tomasa venta D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
In the state of VeraC. D. L. Llave there is a small community called El Paraíso that’s located along the Cordoba-VeraC. highway.  There is a small communal bank (a group of more than ten people that has an account in the bank and that meet weekly) called “Flor D. Campo.”  

Julissa is one of the eleven members of this group.  She is 41 years old and only went to elementary school.  She’s married to Juan, who is a field hand.  Julissa has three children but only the youngest, Pablo, 12, is still dependent on her.  He goes to the local elementary school.

Julissa tells us that she’s always been a very hard working woman.  When she left school her mother taught her to work doing domestic chores and to prepare Mexican fast food like “chiles rellenos” (stuffed chili peppers) and tamales which has been very useful for her because since she got married she has been selling food on weekends to earn a little extra money to help her husband with household expenses.  She sells her snacks among friends and neighbors in the community.  First, she makes the tamales and the chiles and when they are ready she places them in buckets and goes out door to door selling them.  Thanks to God, she always sells out everything.  Besides selling fast food snacks, Julissa also sells beef and pork on Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays.  She needs this loan to buy meat, chilies, eggs, tomatoes, onion, corn, firewood, banana leaves, oil and plastic bags.  She tells us that sales have helped her a lot because bit by bit she’s helped her husband build a house out of substantial materials and she hopes to use her profits to continue with the construction because she wants to have something to leave her children and that they not want for anything.

The other ten members are:

María – grocery sales

Alejandro- shoe sales

Galvina – stationery sales

Alberta-clothing sales

Rosa-shoe sales

Juana-clothing sales

Juana B.- grocery sales

María Cristina-bread sales

Esteban-bread sales

Tomasa-grocery sales

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Gueume  Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Gueume Yalla est créé le 29 décembre 2010, il est constitué de dix sept femmes qui sont amies, voisines et qui s'entendent bien, elles font du commerce et de l'élevage.


Madame Diary la responsable est mariée mère de quatre enfants, elle a en charge son neveu, est âgée de 49 ans et est restauratrice avec une bonne expérience; elle fait aussi de l'embouche ovine. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en blanc et a levé la main gauche.


Elle achète ses denrées riz, huile, tomate et autres condiments dans la communauté rurale, cuisine et vend dans son village.


Son prêt lui servira à renforcer son activité et à acheter des moutons à élever pour les vendre plus tard pour préparer son remboursement.



Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices aider son mari dans les charges familiales et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
Le groupe de solidarité Gueume Yalla est créé le 29 décembre 2010, il est constitué de dix sept femmes qui sont amies, voisines et qui s'entendent bien, elles font du commerce et de l'élevage.


Madame Diary la responsable est mariée mère de quatre enfants, elle a en charge son neveu, est âgée de 49 ans et est restauratrice avec une bonne expérience; elle fait aussi de l'embouche ovine. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en blanc et a levé la main gauche.


Elle achète ses denrées riz, huile, tomate et autres condiments dans la communauté rurale, cuisine et vend dans son village.


Son prêt lui servira à renforcer son activité et à acheter des moutons à élever pour les vendre plus tard pour préparer son remboursement.



Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices aider son mari dans les charges familiales et augmenter son épargne.

loans.use: Acheter des denrées alimentaires pour la restauration et des moutons à élever.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag is 44 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a Mongolian ger (or yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. Her daughter is 23 years old and studies at the university. Tungalag operates a used clothing trading business. She started her business in 2004 and gathered tremendous experience in her field. She manages her business on her own and purchases her goods from the wholesale store. She has a stabilized business and is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a diligent and open-minded woman who says, "I want to improve my life and expand my house." She is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase more used clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes.

loans.name: Express Group

texts.en:
Maulidi, who is in his mid 30s, is married with three children; two of them go to school. He has  a business making and selling improved traditional clay cook stoves.

This will be his 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy clay, iron sheets, a hammer and scissors and he has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to make more improved traditional clay stoves to sell. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.  

He will share this loan with his loan group "Express" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To make more improved traditional clay stoves to sell.

loans.name: Khosbayar

texts.en:
Mr.Khosbayar requested a loan to renovate his business equipment. He is 30 years-old and manages a small photo studio near the downtown.  He lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Since 2007, he has been running his business constantly. At first, he took a loan from Khas Bank and used it to start his business.  At present, his photographic equipment has become old and he needs to replace them immediately because they are the main tools of his job.  Therefore, he needs to purchase a new photo camera and other complete sets.  He believes that his earning will be notably increased if he can replace his equipment and kits.

loans.use: to purchase a new photo camera and other complete sets.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Justine is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Justine has been working hard to manage her food stall which sells fruits and vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables and will help Justine to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to open up her own retail shop. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Justine's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Tessia

texts.en: Tessia is a 29-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 8 to 12 years. She describes herself as social. She operates a retail store where she sells drinks and food. She has been involved in this business for 7 years and employs 3 staff members. Her business is located in a densely-populated area of town. She will use the KES 45,000 loan to purchase cereal to sell. Her business goal is to purchase some tailoring equipment within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to open a tailoring school.

loans.use: To purchase cereal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Muzafari

texts.en: Muzafari is married with 6 children living in his house in Hoima in Western Uganda. For seven years he has been fishing and this has enabled him to provide for the basic needs of his family. His challenge is poor transport means that cause fish to go bad and his dream is to buy a refrigerated car. Muzafari wants a loan to buy a car to help him in transporting his fish from the lake to the markets.

loans.use: to buy a car for transport of his fish from the lake to the markets

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
La señora Deysi es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Con Futuro del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo pequeño.
Es poco tiempo que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos.  Ella se dedica a la confección de bolsos de telas, que los hace a pedidos, cuenta con una pequeña máquina casera, con ella realiza su trabajo.
Con su nueva préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 kilos de tela, 1 kilo de tela para forro, 2 docenas de broches, 10 metros de sierre, 20 metros de soguillas, ojalillos.
Cuando tiene que coser su hermana le ayuda con el cuidado de su niño, su esposo se desempeña como trabajador de limpieza, cuando está en casa  le ayuda con el cuidado de su bebe.
Más adelante espera comprase una máquina adecuada y tener mejores productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, espera que Manuela Ramos le de esa facilidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Deysi is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres con Futuro" in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali.  She is 25 years old, married and has a small son.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for only a short time.  Her business is making cloth bags on an order basis.  She has a home sewing machine that she uses in her work.

With the new 1,500 PEN loan she plans to buy 3 kilos of fabric, 1 kilo of lining fabric, 2 dozen closures, 10 meters of zippers, 20 meters of rope, button holes.  When she is busy sewing her sister looks after her son.  Her husband is a cleaning sector employee and when he is home he helps take care of the baby.

In the future she hopes to have a more appropriate machine so she can offer better products to her customers.  She is counting on Manuela Ramos for support.

loans.use: To buy 3 kilos of fabric, 1 kilo of lining fabric, 2 dozen closures, 10 meters of zippers, 20 meters of rope, button holes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph has operated his butcher's shop in Nakuru town for the last six years.  He is 38 years old, married to Margaret and they have four school-going children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officer during marketing in Nakuru town and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goats to slaughter and sell to boost and sustain his butcher business. In future, Joseph hopes to expand his butchery business and open shops in other parts of Nakuru town.

loans.use: To buy  goats to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Khalundu Group

texts.en:
Concepter is the facilitator of the Khalundu group. Her group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Concepter takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Concepter had a good maize yield harvesting sixteen bags on three-quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Concepter was only able to harvest two bags of maize on three-quarters of an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Concepter and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Concepter will educate her children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Khalundu group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
Concepter is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”HUCHUY QOSQO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Lamay en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Basilio;  El socio tiene 56 años de edad, El socio es casado, El socio tiene 4 hijos de 20, 17, 11, 5 meses de edad; el socio trabaja de forma independiente y también en la agricultura, el socio tiene terrenos de cultivos  de maíz, hortalizas, el socio tiene su stand de compra y venta de calzados junto con su conyugue, ambos trabajan en la venta de calzado para damas, caballeros y niños, y en esta ocasión el socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de calzados de temporada y como se viene las fiestas navideñas ellos invertirán un fuerte capital para comprar mercadería y abastecer a sus clientes. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de calzados al por mayor.

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the ”HUCHUY QOSQO” communal bank.  The communal bank is located in the Lamay district in the province of Calca and department of Cusco.

The member is Señor Basilio; he is 56 years old and married.  He has four children, aged 20, 17, 11 and 5 months.  The member works for himself, and also works in farming.  He has farmland with corn and vegetable crops.  The member has a stand where he buys and sells shoes with his wife.  They both work selling shoes for women, men and children.  

On this occasion, the member wants to invest the loan in purchasing seasonal shoes, as the Christmas holidays are approaching.  They will invest a large amount of capital in purchasing merchandise and stocking up for his customers.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in purchasing shoes at wholesale.

The member is grateful for the loan and agrees to comply with making his repayments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Marieta provides motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

Marieta became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Marieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

loans.name: Deisy Leonor

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Deisy. Tiene 47 años de edad, está separada y tiene tres hijos de 23, 18 y 17 años de edad todos viven con ella y estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio. 

Ella además de ser una gran madre para ganarse la vida y la de sus hijos después de que se separo puso un negocio de cibercafé en su casa, allí  también vende helados, sodas y bocadillos de picar, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00,  tiene muchos clientes como por ejemplo estudiantes que llegan  a hacer consultas o trabajos en las maquinas, lleva casi dos años con este negocio y  poco a poco lo ha ido ampliando con el paso de los días.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar útiles escolares y CD que necesitan sus clientes. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Picoaza figures in the books as one of the aboriginal towns of the Manteño culture.  This urban parish located only 10 minutes from the city of Portoviejo, the capital of the province of Manabí, is full of history and stories.  The members of María Asunción Communal Bank meet here every two weeks.

We met Deisy here.  She is 47 years old and separated.  She has three children, ages 23, 18, and 17, all of whom live with her and study in the university, and the youngest in high school.

Besides being an excellent mother for making a living for herself and her children, after she separated, she set up a cybercafe in her house.  She also sells ice cream, soda, and snacks there.
