She works every day from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m.  She has a lot of customers, for example students who come to use the computers for research or papers.  She has had the business for almost two years, and little by little she has expanded over time.

She is going to use this loan to buy school supplies and CDs that her customers need.  She has been with the communal bank for two cycles and she likes it because of the help they give with the loans.

Her dream is for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and CDs.

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es: Martha Azucena tiene 52 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general, ella tiene años de experiencia en el negocio ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales que la vistan. Este negocio lo emprende por la necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar variedad de mercadería de todo estilo que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en: Martha Azucena, 52, sells merchandise in general.  She has many years' experience in the business and has fixed as well as eventual customers who visit her.  She started the business because of the need to generate income for the family.  The loan she is requesting is to buy a variety of merchandise in all styles as requested by her customers.

loans.use: To buy a variety of merchandise in all styles.

loans.name: Lusi

texts.en: Lusi is 28 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling fa'alifu (cooked taro, banana, and yam with coconut cream) in her community and has been doing this for four years. Lusi has requested a loan to buy bananas, taro, yams, etc. She joined SPBD in (year) to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lusi will expand the business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, taro, yams, salts

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego is a cook and he also learned about bakery. Diego is going to college but he works at a restaurant and he also sells bread every weekend.

He needs a loan to buy flour and items to make more bread because it is a good business when you produce a lot of bread. Diego is a single man, lives with his parents and he doesnt have children but he helps his parents. He hopes you can help him.

In the picture you can see Diego at his parents house and the place where he makes the bread

loans.use: to buy flour and items to make more bread.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is an energetic smallholder farmer, a person who always has a smile drawn on her face. Fifteen years ago, she started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Gitumba, a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Lydia believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

With your support, this mum will be able to fulfill her dreams. Go for it; make a loan.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar lives in Baku city Bulbullu settlement . He is 47, married, has 2 children. He has been engaged in this business for 10 years.
He has his own live farming (cattle)and own butcher shop.
He borrowed a loan amount of $1000 and bought 2 cattles. 
He needs $2000 loan to buy the deep-freezer in order to further develop his business.

loans.use: To buy the deep-freezer

loans.name: Etilma Candelaria

texts.en:
For the last three years I have dedicated myself to selling fried chicken on the outskirts of the city of Choluteca. This is a good spot since it's on the freeway, and a lot of drivers heading to El Salvador or other places stop here on their way. I need capital to invest in prime materials (beverages, chicken, water, tortillas, etc.), which will allow me to raise my income and help my family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace tres años me dedico a vender pollo frito en las afueras de la ciudad de Choluteca, este es un buen punto ya que esta en la carretera y se paran a comer viajeros hacia el Salvador o de otras comunidades. Necesito capital fresco para inventir en materia prima y de esta manera incrementar mis ingresos para ayudar a mi familia.

loans.use: Buy beverages, chicken, water, tortillas, etc.

loans.name: Odigie

texts.en: Mrs. Odigie C. J. is 47 years old and a trained patient medicine dealer in a suburb of Edo State, Nigeria. She request for the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Sing

texts.en: Mrs. Sing K. S. is 32 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 3 school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work in construction and can typically make up to $8 each day. In order to have additional income, Sing is requesting a loan that will be used to purchase rubber trees from someone’s plantation and resell them at a profit.

loans.use: to purchase rubber trees from a plantation and resell them at a profit

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda is 36 years old. In the 80´s she went to live with her husband in the beautiful city of Pucallpa with expectations of growth and progress for the family. They have 3 children attending school. Shortly after arriving they started to work at Market No. 02 as itinerant traders and they also collected junk. The development of these activities allowed them to save a sum of money so they could install a warehouse for groceries in their own house.

At present this business has experimented a huge growth and in order to meet the demands of their customers they are in need of $400 to buy a larger stock of groceries and enlargen the warehouse. They plan to repay the loan in 6 months. This loan allows the family to purchase more products and improve the development of the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Rayda es una señora de 36 años, por los años 80 vino junto a su esposo a radicar a la bella ciudad de Pucallpa en busca de nuevas expectativas de surgimiento y progreso familiar, actualmente tienen 3 niños en edad escolar.A poco tiempo de haberse instalado en Pucallpa empezaron a trabajar en el Mercado N° 02 como comerciantes ambulantes y recolectando artículos inservibles (Chatarra), el desarrollo de estas actividades les permitió reunir un capital con el que lograron instalar una bodega de abarrotes en las instalaciones de su propia casa. .Actualmente este negocio está experimentando un crecimiento vertiginoso y con el fin de aprovechar la demanda de sus clientes requiere contar con el apoyo económico de 400 dólares; para utilizarlos como capital de trabajo; la misma que se compromete a devolver en un período de 6 meses. Este Importe le ayudará a comprar más artículos de primera necesidad y surtirá el negocio que le permitirá consolidar el desarrollo integral de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de Víveres y almacenamiento para aumentar el crecimiento de la bodega.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Chanthou was married in 2001 and has two daughters. A relative taught her how to weave in 1997 and she has been weaving ever since. Her husband works as a carpenter. Neither husband nor wife finished primary education.

This is the first time S. Chanthou has requested a loan from MAXIMA. She has asked for $400 which she intends to use to purchase silk materials and sewing thread in order to expand her silk weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Rosario Angelina

texts.es:
Rosario Angelica S. is a single mother with one school-aged son. Over 20 years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of fruit and vegetables, conducting purchases directly from producers while her sales are performed at wholesale and retail.

Rosario began her business with savings in the amount of C$1,500.00 Cordobas (approximately US $80.00) at the local Station Market. Currently, her business can be found in the Terminal Market in the city of León.

CEPRODEL has granted her credits for two and a half years totaling 33 credits with which Rosario has obtained earnings so she can fill her home with all the necessities. She is asking for a new credit so that she can improve the infrastructure of her business since the current construction is four blocks of wood and a zinc roof. Investing in this manner will allow her to attract more customers and she will be in a better position to keep her products in good shape. In addition, she will be able to invest in purchases of oranges and “mamón chino” (a Nicaraguan tropical fruit). To Rosario, it will be compliment that you allow her to grow her business and her existing capital through your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario Angelica S. es una madre soltera con un hijo en edad escolar. Durante 20 años se ha dedicado al negocio de ventas de verduras y frutas, realizando compras directamente a productores y su ventas las realiza al por mayor y al detalle.

Ella dió inicio a su negocio con un monto de ahorros de C$ 1,500.00 cordobas(aproximadamente $80 dólares), intalando su negocio en el Mercado la Estación con su local fijo. Actualmente su negocio se encuentra en el mercado la Terminal de la ciudad de León.

CEPRODEL le ha otrogado creditos desde hace dos años y medio con un total de 33 creditos con los cuales a obtenido ganancias para poder suplir las necesidades en su hogar. Ella solicita un nuevo credito para poder tener mejor infraestructura en su negocio ya que la construcion actual es de 4 bloques de madera y un techo de zinc. Invirtiendo de esta manera, podra atraer más clientelas y asi estará en mejores condiciones para mantener sus proctuctos en buen estado; tambien logrará invertir en compras de naranjas y mamón chino (frutas tropicales nicaragüenses). Al contar con la ayuda de ustedes, será para ella un complemento que le permitirá hacer crecer su negocio y su capital de trabajo existente.

loans.use: Buy products for the market.

loans.name: Ikpomwonsa

texts.en: Mr. O. is married with children and is 38 years old. He is into photography and video coverage. He is from Edo State, and he is asking for the loan of $275 in order to purchase a camera, and also for other materials needed to add beauty to his studio. He learned his trade for 3 years and has been in it since 1995.

loans.use: To purchase a camera, and other materials needed to add more beauty to the studio

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en: Martina M. is a single woman with two children, ages 4 and 7. She has a timber business. She wants to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Neema S.. She is married with two children, ages one and thirteen.

In 2007, Neema established a grocery store business. She works seven days a week from nine to twelve hours a day and is assisted by her husband. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She requires a new loan to purchase additional stock of rice, oil, biscuits, butter, and nuts in bulk. In the future, Neema also plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, oil, biscuits, and other goods, in bulk.

loans.name: Merina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Merina belongs to the Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank, located in the San Juan Bautista settlement, lot 28, of the Calleria district of the Ucayali province. She is 63 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a merchant. With the first loan of ~$110 she received from Manuela Ramos, Merina decided to invest in the sale of clothing.

Currently, she continues selling clothing and also sells pre-paid cell phone cards. She gets up very early to prepare breakfast for her husband and children; she prepares lunch and takes it to her children at school, and in the afternoon, she sells her clothing and phone cards.

With this $375 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy more clothing such as t-shirts, dress shirts, pants, skirts, etc. and more cell phone cards.

Merina would like to rent a store where she can offer her products and she hopes to do so through the loans offered by Manuela Ramos. Her desires and enthusiasm help her to move forward everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Merina pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano San Juan Bautista Lt. 28, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 63 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Merina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de ropa. En la actualidad continua con su negocio de venta de ropa, y también vende tarjetas telefónicas para celulares, se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y esposo, prepara el almuerzo lleva a sus hijos a la escuela y por la tardes se dedica a vender sus prendas y las tarjetas telefónicas. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ropa como: polos, camisas, pantalones, faldas, etc., y tarjetas para celulares claro y movistar. Merina esta pensando en alquilar un local para poder ofrecer sus productos, y espera lograrlo con los prestamos que le brinda Manuela Ramos, con las ganas, el entusiasmo que tiene la hace salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita has allways been a busy, hardworking woman. Her natural talent in the kitchen allowed her to prepare meals in banquets and social events as well as opening a small grill. She is able to acquire the necessary means to take care of her family thorugh the sale of pork rinds, fritters, small pieces of grilled skewered meat, etc.

She does not conform with waiting for her husbands paycheck and her wish is to open another grill to continue growing her business.

Margarita is requesting a microloan to purchase a lit storefront sign which the local government requires for her business to continue operating.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase a lit storefront sign

loans.name: Talatalaga Fiu's Group

texts.en: The second round for Gautavai center for there first loan to 			start there business, after 3 weeks training provide by the 			SPBD. These four women receive the maximum loan of 			$750 tala each. These women are hard working and they 			thankful to have this opportunity in their lives. The second 			cycle of loans will not only for there business but they also 			will have the chance to improve their homes and pay their 			children’s school fees.

loans.use: Handicraft (fine mats, samoan bag, fan, ietoga), purchase chemicals, wheel barrow, week killer, weed spray, bush knives, freezer, sugar, chicken etc…

loans.name: Martin Ricardo

texts.es:
Martín is divorced and has 2 daughters. He started his business out of financial necessity because he did not have a job at that time. His not having money to pay for his daughters’ studies nor cover the household expenses were the main reasons for his starting his own business. He started 4 years ago after completing a course. He then decided to take out a loan in order to purchase used tools, which is how he started providing carpentry services.

He is requesting a loan of $1,175.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase new machinery for his workshop. With your support, Martín will make his business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Martín es divorciado y tiene 2 hijas, inició el negocio por necesidad económica ya que no tenia trabajo, el no tener dinero para pagar los estudio de sus hijas y solventar los gastos familiares, fueron sus principales necesidades para emprender su negocio, comenzó hace 4 años después de terminar un curso decidió conseguir un crédito para poder comprar herramienta usada y así empezó a prestar sus servicios de carpintería.

El solicita un préstamo por US $1,175 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar maquinaria nueva para su taller. Con tu apoyo Martín hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase new machinery

loans.name: Tatu's Jambo Nia Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 25 years old. She is married with two children ages 4 and 5. She became a charcoal and soap seller in 2008. She works daily from 6AM to 8PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 (US Dollars) in sales.

Tatu hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and soap for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing in juice sales, perfume sales, and tailoring.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and soap for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 26-year-old single lady who lives in Likoni, Mombasa. She began her salon business 3 years ago. She also sells clothes-making materials, shoes, purses, ties, and other clothing items. The central location of her shop and her many years of doing good business within the community have gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base. Her business has done quite well due to the added advantage of access to loans; she has combined the additional money with hard work and perseverance in order to increase her stock and materials and build a successful income-generating activity. Mary is proud of her accomplishments and the fact that she is now able to contribute toward household expenses. She requires US$500 to further expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Romana

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Romana M., me dedico a la venta de Desayunos, vivo en la colonia Los Pinos, tengo 49 años de edad, estoy casada, en mi negocio hago burritas de frijoles con chirizo y huevo, tambien hago baleadas y vendo tazas de cafe y refrescos naturales, mi producto lo vendo en una maquila que esta ubicada en la Colonia Honduras, tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad, en estos momentos necesito un credito para poder sacar adelante mi negocio.
con los ingresos que obtengo de mi negocio logro en un gran porcentaje ayudar a mi familia lo cual me ha ayudado a salir adelante, por tal razon necesito el credito para poder seguir manteniendo mi familia.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Romana M. and I sell breakfasts. I live in the Los Pinos neighborhood, am 49 years old, married, and in my business I make bean burritos with chorizo and egg. I also make “baleadas” (bean and tortilla) and sell cups of coffee and natural juices. I have sold my products at a factory located in the Honduras neighborhood for many years. Today I need a loan to be able to grow my business. With the income that I receive from my business I will use a large percentage to help my family which has helped me be successful, so I need the loan to be able to continue supporting my family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, eggs, cheese, butter, margerine, shortening, tortillas, sausage, fruit, sugar, oil, coffee

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib B. is 46 years old and is married with three daughters.  Habib has always opted to make his living on his land, work hard and grow with it.  That is how he decided to rear cows and now dedicates himself to livestock breeding.  He has six years of experience in this field.  

Today, he wishes to increase his number of cattle and would like to buy a cow and 2 calves in hopes of increasing his income and the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide him.  For this reason, he has applied for $1,200.  Extend your solidarity to Habib so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 2 calves

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del centro poblado de Chimbo, distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo –Puno. Tiene 48 años  y es madre de 5 hijos que aun apoya, es casada, su esposo también trabaja con ella en la crianza de ganado vacuno, porcino y ovino. Con el primer préstamo obtenido de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro ganado ovino para engorde. Actualmente sigue con este negocio que le da ganancias para pagar con puntualidad su crédito. Hace 8 años que trabaja con el Banco Comunal.

Con el crédito que recibirá de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas comprara ganado vacuno para engorde.

Ella desea incrementar sus ganancias con este negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa is a member of the Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” in the city of Chimbo--a district of the Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 48 years old, married and mother of 5 children. Her husband also works with her raising bovine, swine and ovine cattle. With the first loan she obtained in the amount of S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, she purchased bovine cattle. Being currently involved with the cattle business has motivated her to pay future lines of credit on time. She has been working with Comunal Bank for 8 years. This line of credit in the amount of S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles will be paid back in 5 installments and it will be applied to purchase additional cattle. She wishes to generate more income with this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle for profit

loans.name: Madina Nakandi’S Group

texts.en: Madina is a leader of a four-member group. She is 40 years old and married with six children, age five through 28 years old. Four of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She lives with eight people in a two-room house that she rents. They don’t have electricity and piped-in water at home. The family receives two meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area,  which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She rents her business premises at 60,000/= per month and uses public transport for travel to and from her job. Madina works seven days a week. She has been with MCDT for six years and is servicing her tenth loan. She wants to use the loan to rent another room at her business premises to increase dining space for her customers. Madina aspires to own a permanent place for her business and home.

loans.use: To rent another room to expand her restaurant to increase dining space.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng K., 22, pictured with her husband and her mom, lives with her husband and children in Prey Chor District, Kampong Cham, Cambodia, where she grows and sells rice, earning around $2 a day; her husband is a banana seller at the market, making about $6 a day.

Sreng is requesting a loan of $1000 to rent a banana farm in order to expand her business activites.

loans.use: To rent a banana farm.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: CARMEN TIENE DOS HIJOS AMBOS SON PEQUEÑOS SU ESPOSO HACE CASI 6 MESES QUE LA ABANDONO POR LO CUAL ELLA ESTA DEDICADA DE INTEGRO A SU TRABAJA Y A SUS PEQUEÑOS POR LO CUAL HA DECIDIDO TRABAJAR MAS. CARMEN TRABAJA COMO COCINERA EN PANCHO POLLO POR LAS MAÑANAS Y EN LA TARDE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ASADITOS , EMPANADAS , REFRESCOS Y OTROS ELLA NO TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA YA QUE VENDE EN LA ESQUINA DE LA AV. ALEMANA Y ER ANILLO, EL DINERO QUE LE PRESTAMOS FUE PARA QUE SE COMPRE UN CARRITO A MEDIO USO EN EL CUAL PUEDA LLEVAR Y TRAER SUS PRODUCTOS Y SOBRE TODO QUE SEA MAS COMODO Y ACOMODE OTRAS COSAS PARA VENDER, LA CLIENTE TIENE EXCELENTE COMPORTAMIENTO CREDITICIO, QUE AUN A PESAR DE SUS PROBLEMAS FAMILIARES ELLA RESPONDIO MUY BIEN AL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Carmen has two children, both of whom are small. Almost six months ago, her husband abandoned her. As a result, she is completely dedicating herself to her work and to her small children for whom she had decided to work more. Carmen works as a cook at "Pancho Pollo" in the mornings and, in the evenings, she is dedicated to selling barbecue, empanadas, sodas and other items. She does not have a lot of competition since she sells on the corner of Alemana Avenue and ER Anillo. The money that we are lending her is so that she may purchase a used cart in which she can carry and bring her products and, above all, everything can be more comfortable and can accomodate other things to sell. This client has excellent credit behavior who, despite her family problems, responds well to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Hamdi

texts.en:
Hamdi is a 25-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Hamdi has owned a coal shop since 1990. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars in order to purchase coal for his business. This is the first time that Abdo has requested a loan.

Hamdi is special in his work because he is the only one in his area who sells coal. His clients are his family members, friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase coal for his business.

loans.name: Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth C., age 39,  is married with three children ages 16, 12 and 9.  A grand child orphan of her late sister in law also stays with her.  She sells food at Ilala, a small place just few kilometers from city center.  She started her business in 2005 and works daily from 6.45am until 5pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $154.

This will be Elizabeth’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase capital, buy vouchers for sale and make a cupboard for chips. She repaid the loan successfully. She now hopes for a second loan to expand her business and also to start selling chips.
	
Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group, Ari Mpya, which totals 20 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Elizabeth is first from right, front row.

loans.use: To start selling chips and expand the food and voucher business

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma ont en moyenne 42ans, 5 enfants. Le groupe est composé de 3 veuves et 5 femmes mariées majoritairement polygames mais vivent toutes dans des grandes familles traditionnelles   dans le quartier bamanan kin de kirango Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Ce groupe fait  le commerce de céréales et des poissons. 
Après trois prêts solidaires correctement remboursés ce groupe est à son quatrième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 250 kg de poisson frais, 15 sacs de mil, 6 sacs de riz et 2 sacs d’haricot. Elles s’approvisionnent en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger à l’entrée du barrage de Markala et en céréales au marché hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou .Actuellement la moitié du poisson est séchée à domicile ; les poissons sont ensuite revendus en détail parfois au marché journalier de Kirango Markala, à Ségou et à Bamako à des grossistes au comptant ; les céréales sont revendus à domicile et au marché de Kirango à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen de 49.000FCFA par mois qui servira pour la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants et de la famille. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’acheter une maison à usage d’habitation.
NB : Fatoumata D. a accouché c’est pourquoi elle ne figure pas sur la photo
texts.en:
The members of this Sabougnouma group have an average age of 42 and 5 children. The group is composed of 3 widows and 5 married women, mostly polygamous, but all live in big traditional families in the Bamanan Kin district of Kirango Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali).

This group sells cereals and fish. After three solidarity loans, correctly reimbursed, this group is on its fourth loan which will be used to buy 250 kg of fresh fish, 15 sacks of millet, 6 sacks of rice, and 2 sacks of dried beans. They buy their fish along the banks of the Niger River at the entrance to the Markala dam, and their cereals at the weekly market of Diamarabougou.

Presently, half the fish is dried at home; the fish is then sold retail, sometimes in the daily market of Kiranga Markala, in Ségou, and in Bamako to wholesalers, for cash. The cereals are sold out of their houses and at the Kirango market to a clientele composed of men and women.

They expect to make an average profit of 49,000 F CFA per month which will be used to cover school fees for the children of the family. Their ambition is to buy a house to live in. NB : Fatoumata D. had just had a baby; that is why she is not in the photo.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cereals and fish for re-sale

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Mr Rodolfo V. is 66 years old and married with one child. He is presently living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. His wife is a housekeeper and also helps him to raise their pigs as they are a major source of household income. Their regular customers are the meat market retailers. Rodolfo and his wife want to construct additional cages for the pigs. Their hope is to have a decent living, and be able to save money for their old age and their only child.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth I. is 45 years old and married with seven children. She sells dried fish. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more dried fish to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish

loans.name: Munojot

texts.en:
T. Munojot is a widowed mother of two children. Her clothing sales business has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past eight years. In a typical month Munojot makes about $200-300 in profit. Munojot is hard-working, polite and communicative entrepreneur. She has an attitude of service and loves being able to help women with their clothing needs.

Munojot has requested a loan of $1100 to purchase new inventory of women's summer clothing. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase women's summer clothing for sale.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 32 years old and is married to Sonia who is 36 years old.  Together the couple has two sons, 5 and 2 years old. 

Cesar has worked delivering bread for more than ten years.  Every day he gets up at 4 am in order to go about his daily activities, as he has to go to neighboring cities to carry out his work.  During the day he travels a total of 300 km to deliver his products.  He goes from city to city, offering breads and pastries, and thanks to his well-established clientele he always sells all of his products, and sometimes he runs out of merchandise. 

Cesar is very happy with his job, and he has been able to purchase a vehicle and the basic necessities for his home.  He has some economic support, as his wife is a teacher. 

The loan will be used to purchase breads, in order to be able to meet the demand of his clients.

loans.use: The purchase of breads

loans.name: Nor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Нор Хафизов имеет среднее техническое образование. Он работает заведующим хозяйством школы № 5 Зафарабадского района. Но зарплата в школах невысока, поэтому дома у него есть овцы и 2 коровы, одна из которых дает до 8 литров молока в день. 
   Жена Нора домохозяйка, она готовит еду, стирает и убирает, ухаживает за огородом. В огороде у них выращены все необходимые овощи для приготовления пищи (лук, морковь, картошка, помидоры и огурцы).
Нор кормит и поит свой домашний скот, а его жена доит корову и перерабатывает молоко. Доить корову маме помогает единственная дочь. Она планирует вырасти и заниматся животноводством, так же как и ее отец. Мечтает о большой ферме.
Кроме откорма скота, Нор на арендованной земле выращивает кукурузу и реализует его на рынке. 
Нор запрашивает кредит для откорма скота и переработки молока.
texts.en:
Nor H. has a secondary technical education. He works as a facilities supervisor at the school #5 in the Zafarabad district. However, schools do not pay very much; this is why at home Nor has sheep and 2 cows, one of which gives up to 8 liters of milk per day. Nor’s wife is a homemaker. She cooks food, does laundry, cleans and takes care of the garden. Their garden has all the essential vegetables for cooking meals (onions, carrots, potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers).

Nor gives food and water to his livestock, and his wife milks the cow and processes milk. Nor’s only daughter helps the mother milk the cow. She plans to be involved in animal husbandry when she grows up, just like her father. She dreams of having a large farm. Besides feeding livestock, Nor grows corn on leased land and sells it at the market. Nor is requesting a loan for livestock feeding and milk processing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and milk processing

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, a 38-year-old mother to four boys and three girls, is married to Dominador, an electrician. She lives in Morong, Rizal Province in the Philippines, where she operates a sari-sari store.

With her aspiration to rise above poverty, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2004. Her previous loans have been wisely spent on her store, and the business is running smoothly, her loyal customers consisting mainly of her village neighbors. Nenita is now requesting a loan of 20,000 pesos as her sixth loan from ASHI to buy five sacks of rice, one sack sugar, 20 sacks of charcoal, and groceries for her store. Her investments in her store yield sound profits which help her meet the needs of her family.

She dreams of expanding her business into a much bigger grocery store and sending her children to school up to the college level.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her store.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба Каримова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 35 лет. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Махбуба имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует продуктами питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. Ей также помогают ее дети. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mahbuba K. lives in the Rumy district. She is 35 years old, a widow and has 2 children. Mahbuba has a retail store at a market, where she sells food products. She has been involved in this type of business for over 5 years. Her children help her as well. She is requesting a loan to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Savan

texts.en:
Mrs. Savan Y., age 48, and her husband, Mr. Sophanna Pol, age 53, were married in 1979 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of them married and live outside the family home and one son is a hairdresser. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Savan produces bath mat and sells at her house. Her husband is a soldier. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to connect water from a private water utility service and connect electricity from an electricity utility service to use in her family.

loans.use: To connect water from a private water utility service and connect electricity from an electricity utility service to use in her family.

loans.name: Ganiya

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée dans la vente de glacières de différentes dimensions. Elle habite le quartier d'Agoè-Dèmakpoe à Lomé. C’est une revendeuse ambulante ; elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2006 à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins de base. Actuellement elle veut louer une place dans le marché d’Agoè à Lomé pour élargir son commerce. Elle a beaucoup d’ambitions et voudrait plus tard se rendre en Côte d’Ivoire  pour pouvoir vendre en gros. Actuellement son stock est presque épuisé ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 60 glacières, petit et grand format. Elle compte sur sa meilleure connaissance de son marché pour vite rembourser son crédit. Elle est célibataire et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This is a lady who became specialized in selling insulated containers of various sizes. She lives in the Agoè-Dèmakpoe district in Lomé. She is a door-to-door retailer; she started this business in 2006 in Lomé. It enables her to cover her basic expenses. Currently, she wants to lease a spot at the Agoè marketplace in Lomé in order to expand her commerce. She has many ambitions and would like to go to Cote d’Ivoire later on, so as to sell in bulk. Right now, her stock is almost exhausted; for this reason, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 60 insulated containers, small and large. She is counting on her better knowledge of the market to repay her loan quickly. She is unmarried and has no children at all to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insulated containers

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie G. is from the village of Sibugon Lopez jaena. She is 35 years old. Jessie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector making "kaang" ling flower pots. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making pottery. Jessie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for pottery making. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to sustain the needs of her family.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for pottery maker

loans.name: Amistad Y Lucha Group

texts.es:
La Sra. ESTHER  CANDELARIA L. A.,  (la apreciamos en la fotografía sentada, acompañada de las socias del grupo y familiares) Ella  tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, 4 totalmente independientes y el menor que es la razón de su esfuerzo y trabajo ya que lo  apoya económicamente  en el logro de su profesión. Ella integra el Grupo   “AMISTAD Y LUCHA”    junto con nueve personas igualmente trabajadoras residentes del Distrito de Comas.
La Sra. Esther, se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios a domicilio, nos comenta que desde muy niña le llamaba la atención las ventas, y en cuanto pudo juntar un poco de dinero empezó vendiendo accesorios de vestir a sus amigas y poco a poco fue formando un capital el cual invirtió luego en la compra de ropa.
Ella se siente satisfecha, porque con su negocio desde muy joven pudo apoyar a sus padres, adquirió sus artefactos, apoyó a su esposo en el pago de los estudios de sus hijos, y así lograr que tengan una profesión.
Hoy en día su trabajo está destinado a apoyar al menor de sus hijos que estudia en la universidad, y cuando puede viaja a provincia donde también ofrece su mercadería  aprovecha la oportunidad para conocer  un poco más su país.
texts.en:
ESTHER CANDELARIA, (who we see in the photo seated surrounded by the members of the group and family members), has 5 adult children, 4 of whom are completely independent. The youngest is the reason for her efforts and work since she supports him economically in his efforts to become a professional. She, along with 9 other equally hard-working persons from the Comas district, make up the “AMISTAD Y LUCHA” (FRIENDSHIP & STRUGGLE) group. Esther sells clothing and accessories door-to-door and tells us that since childhood she has always been attracted to sales. When she was able to gather a little money she began selling clothing accessories to her girlfriends and little by little began to amass a bit of capital which she then invested in the purchase of clothing. She feels satisfied because, with her business, from a very early age, she was able to help support her parents, buy her items, and help her husband with the expense of educating their children thereby insuring that they would have a profession. Today, her work's purpose is to support her youngest child who is a university student and, when she travels to the countryside where she also sells her merchandise, she takes advantage of the opportunity to get to know a bit more of her country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Colombe

texts.en:
Colombe M. is 26 years old and single. She takes care of two dependent people, ages 25 and 23. She lives in Gicumbi District in the Northern Province of Rwanda,  where her office supply business is located.

Colombe has been in the office supply business for two years. A relatively recent entrepreneur, she works very hard, as is evidenced by the fact that her shop is open from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. every day.  Her efforts are rewarded however, because she earns a monthly profit of 200,000 Rwf  (approximately US $360).

She is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders so she can purchase more and better quality inventory to sell at higher prices. This will attract new customers and help her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy office supplies to sell

loans.name: Roselfina

texts.es:
Roselfina tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 5 años trabaja en las tareas del campo, ella es una emergente agricultora y ganadera, pues tiene vacas y una granja de cuyes en las cuales todas las mañanas, sin excepción, está al cuidado de su alimentación para que en el día que los comercialice obtenga una considerable ganancia.
Adicionalmente, Roselfina puede extraer entre 10 y 12 litros de leche diario, la cual también vende, y cuida de sus cultivos de alfalfa, ya que es lo indispensable para la alimentación de sus animales.

Es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y durante los años de permanencia en su banco comunal ha aprendido del trabajo en equipo y así ha ido progresando. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de semillas de alfalfa, alimento de sus cuyes y vacas.
texts.en:
Roselfina is 29 years old and lives with her husband and her 3 children in her own home. Rosalina has worked in the field for five years as an emerging livestock farmer. She has cows and a farm of guinea pigs which she feeds every morning without exception so that when it comes time to sell them they will be well nourished and she will gain a considerable profit. Additionally, Roselfina can extract between 10 and 12 litres of milk daily which she also sells, and she cares for her alfalfa crops, which are indispensable for the nutrition of her animals. This is the seventh time that Roselfina has applied for a loan through Kiva field partner MFP. During the years that she has been with this communal bank she has learnt to work in a team and through this has made progression. The loan that she is currently applying for will be used to buy alfalfa seeds to feed her cows and guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alfalfa seeds

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe tiene 35 años, es concubino, su esposa no participa del crédito, por que tiene negocio independiente,  tiene 3 hijos, vivienda propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la actividad de comerciante, en las noches y los días sábados y domingos realiza servicio de mototaxi en el área urbana de de la localidad donde vive. En este barrio hay 4 tiendas sin embargo del señor Felipe es el mas surtido, cuenta con cabina telefónica de Viva. El destino del crédito es para Capital de operación para la ampliación de su negocio de abarrotes en su tienda de barrio. Es su cuarto crédito secuencial, su comportamiento fue muy bueno, en su crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Felipe, 35, is in a common-law relationship. His wife does not participate in the loan because she has her own business. He has three children and his own home. For the last 4 years he has been a merchant. At night and on week-ends he is a mototaxi driver in the urban area where he lives. There are four stores in his neighborhood but Felipe's is the best stocked and has a Viva telephone booth. The funding will be used as working capital to expand his neighborhood grocery store. This is his fourth consecutive loan; his behavior with his prior loans was very good.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La Señora Yolanda se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace cinco años, ella vive en casa de familiares, todos los dias desde las 6:00 am hasta las 22:00 tiene su tienda abierta, tiene variedad de mercaderia desde gaseosas, galletas, dulces, fideos, azucar, leche, etc. productos que son primordiales para el hogar, ella piensa invertir el prestamo  en la compra de más productos puesto que por estas fiestas de fin de año es cuando más vende y necesita llenar su tienda con bebidas gaseosas, juguetes y otros que son solicitados en estas fechas.
texts.en:
Ms. Yolanda has been selling groceries for the past 5 years. She lives with her family members and every day from 6AM to 10PM she's at her store selling soft drinks, crackers, candy, noodles, sugar, mild, and other first necessity products. She is using the loan to buy more products since the holidays are coming up and her sales will increase. She needs to purchase fizzy drinks, toys and other things people look for at this time of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for reselling

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.es: El señor Bismarck B. A., tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la comarca de San Ignacio un lugar humilde que no le brinda el ambiente adecuado a sus habitantes, el es soltero y se dedica al cultivo de la Pithaya (fruta que se cultiva en las temporadas de verano), desde hace 18 años se dedica a esta actividad, uno de los probelmas que le ha afectado a su cosecha han sido las emisiones de gases del volcan, por tal razon la produccion se encuentra en un estado critico y solicita este prestamo para la compra de materiales agricolas que salvaguarden la calidad de la fruta, con este prestamo Bismark solventara las exigencias del mercado con respecto a las normas nutricionales dandole la oportunidad de vender la produccion a un mejor precio y recuperar de esta forma la invercion.
texts.en:
Bismarck B. A. is 30 years old and lives in the San Ignacio region, a humble place whose environment is not kind to its inhabitants. He is single and has made a living cultivating Pithaya (a regional fruit that is cultivated in the summertime) for the past 18 years. A problem that has affected his harvest has been the emission of volcanic gases, which has put his production at a critical state. He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural materials that can safeguard the quality of the fruit. With this loan Bismark address market requirements on nutritional standards, giving him the opportunity to sell his product at a higher price and thus recover this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural materials

loans.name: Luisa Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora Luisa tiene una librería, la cual se encuentra  en la casa de su suegra, ubicada del colegio dulce niñez una cuadra y media al sur, realiza las compras de mercadería en el mercado oriental ya que en este sitio compra al por mayor y eso le resulta más favorable. Es madre de una niña de tres años y junto a su esposo han logrado salir adelante. Ella está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento ya que está por comenzar la temporada escolar y desea aprovecharla, para proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que ellos necesitan para la compra de útiles ecolares. Su deseo es obtener los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luisa has a bookstore in her mother-in-law’s house which is located a block and a half south of Sweet Child high school. She buys her merchandise in the oriental market since you can buy wholesale there, which is better for her. Mrs. Luisa is the mother of a three year old child and, together with her husband, has been able to get ahead. She is asking for a new loan because school is about to begin and she wants to take advantage of this to provide her customers with the school supplies they need. She would like to earn what she can.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mallana Group

texts.en:
Anthony F., the leader of this group of five borrowers called Mallana, is 33 years old, married, a university graduate, and has two children who are one and three years old. For three years, Anthony has been selling metal products in Monrovia.  He says that he sells high quality products, which attract customers. Anthony plans to use his 10,400 Liberian dollar portion of this 52,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase more metal products.  His goal is to grow his business and to send his children to school.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Anthony is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously-operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional metal products, such as locks and cages.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita, de 49 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajo muy duro por sobresalir en la vida. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hugo de 49 años y sus 4 hijos: Lady de 28, Juliana de 26, Miguel de 19 y Jesús de 17 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

El trabajo que realiza es el cultivo de zanahorias, papa, alverja, y otros productos; esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Ella ha visto por conveniente comercializar sus productos en el país de Bolivia, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden amenazar su productividad, limpiando y fumigando sus plantas. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera que sus cultivos mejoren y con el incremento de sus ventas pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Sarita con MFP, por lo que se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono para sus cultivos, además contratará un operario para que trabaje en sus tierras.
texts.en:
Sarita is 49 years old and she is a woman that has always worked very hard to stand out in life. She lives in her own house together with her husband, Hugo, who is 49 years old and their 4 children: Lady who is 28, Juliana who is 26, Miguel who is 19, and Jesús who is 17. They are the motivation for all of her efforts.

Sarita works growing carrots, potatoes, peas, and other crops. She does this work together with her husband, who also works hard to provide their children with a good education. She has seen it to be convenient to sell her crops in Bolivia, since it is obvious that she has better earnings there.

What she likes most about her work is preventing her crops from pests that can threaten her productivity, cleaning and spraying her plants. She has been in this business for 15 years and she considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops, since the road is very long and tiring. With time, she hopes that her crops improve and with the increase in sales, she can improve her economic earnings.

This is Sarita’s ninth loan with MFP and she feels an obligation to make her loan repayments on time, since she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her communal bank, where she is very well-liked. With the 2,500 PEN requested, she will purchase more fertilizer for her crops, and will also hire a worker for her lands.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire a farm worker

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a hard working and friendly woman. She is 45 years old. She is married with 5 children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. She sells foodstuffs, groceries and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. Edith is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma runs a small shop in Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Raghad, Lamees and Yaser are her three children. Her husband Arafat, who appears in her shop in the picture above, is an employee of the Palestinian Authority with a decent salary.  Asma decided to start her shop to help the family cover their expenses.

In order to fill the shop with goods Asma took a loan from FATEN.  Since then the number of customers has increased and returns are improving.

Asma comes from a conservative background and doesn't accept having her picture published.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill the supermarket

loans.name: Estelita

texts.es:
Estelita tiene 40 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, aun en edad escolar. Su domicilio queda ubicado en el distrito D. La Victoria, un distrito aledaño a la ciudad D. Chiclayo que cuenta con una considerable población.

Se dedica desD. hace diez años a la venta D. desayunos, jugos y extractos D. fruta en un mercado D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, la idea del negocio surgió ante la necesidad D. obtener un ingreso adicional con el cual ayudar al sostenimiento familiar. Estelita atienD. su negocio durante todo el día y siempre trata D. ofrecer un buen servicio para mantener su negocio.

La calidad D. los alimentos que prepara ha hecho que su pequeño puesto D. venta D. comida tenga una acogida cada vez mas granD., por ese motivo ella desea implementar su negocio con la compra D. una licuadora y una waflera que le permitan ofrecer un buen servicio y captar mas clientes. Siguiendo su objetivo ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles.

Estelita es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es crecer como empresaria para poder brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad D. estudiar alguna carrera superior. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Estelita, 40, is married and lives with her husband and two, school age children. Her address is in the La Victoria district, a populous district adjacent to the city of Chiclayo. She has sold breakfasts and fruit juices in one of Chiclayo’s markets for over 10 years. The idea for this business grew from the need to have an additional source of income with which to help support the family. Estelita tends to her business all day and always strives to offer good service in order to sustain her business. The quality of the meals she prepares has caused her small food stand to become gradually better-received. She needs to buy a blender and a waffle iron, therefore, to offer better service and attract more customers. With this objective in mind, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa to request a 500 new sol loan. Estelita is a kind and very hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to grow as a businesswoman to proviD. her children with the opportunity to study an advanced career. She has collaborated with our institution previously and has shown herself to be a punctual and responsible client with regard to her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a blender and a waffle iron.

loans.name: Rhokhaya

texts.fr: Madame Rhokhaya N. est une femme mariée sans enfant qui est âgée de 33 ans et qui habite dans le quartier de Ndeugagne dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC   depuis avril 2008.Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt. Madame N. exerce la profession de bibliothécaire depuis 2004. Auparavant elle était monitrice à la garderie d’enfant Tafsir de Diamalaye. Elle a choisi la profession de bibliothécaire par passion pour les livres. En plus elle a fait la formation et était pensionnaire à l’Ecole Des Archivistes et bibliothécaire de L’Université Cheikh Anta Diop De Dakar. Elle prête régulièrement des livres aux étudiants et élèves des différents établissements de Yoff. Elle est soutien de famille et vit sous le toit paternel. Elle sollicite  un crédit de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat de portes prévues pour la finition d’un  salon et de quelques chambres. Ce crédit lui permettra de  créer des revenus additionnels  qui pourront  supporter une partie des charges de la famille par le biais de la mise en location de quelques chambres.
texts.en:
Mrs Rhokhaya N., aged 33, is married without children. She lives in the neighborhood of Ndeugagne in the town of Yoff. She has been a member of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC since April 2008. She has never got a loan. Mrs N. has been a librarian by profession since 2004. Before that she was an instructor in the Tafsir day-care center in Diamalaye. She decided to become a librarian because of her passion for books. In addition, she is a trained librarian and was a resident student at the School for Archivists and Librarians of the University Cheikh Anta Diop in Dakar. She regularly lends books to students and pupils of the various schools in Yoff. Mrs N. is the main wage-earner in her family and lives in her father's house. She applies for a loan of 500,000 CFA francs to buy doors for her living room and a few other rooms. These rooms will be rented out and the additional income will help her to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing off a few rooms to rent out

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Entente Est Bonne) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes de Koury (préfecture de Yorosso région de Sikasso) qui se connaissent bien car elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les cosmétiques  la restauration  et les légumes.  
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Safoura Cissé, qui  est la présidente du groupe Benkadi,  fait de la préparation et vente des plats alimentaires.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, un stock important de haricot, de riz d’huile et d’autres ingrédients pour la restauration. Elle se procure de ses marchandises au marché de Boura et Koury. Elle vend ces nourritures au carrefour au comptant à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Safoura Cissé compte réaliser 130 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a grouping of women from Koury (in the prefecture of Yorosso in the region of Sikasso) who know each other well because they live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 30 years of age, are all married and mother to at least two children. This group of women trade in a variety of products such as cosmetics, products for restauration and vegetables. In order to expand their businesses, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program a year ago. They are on their third group loan and all previous loans have been repaid on time. Safoura Cissé, who is the president of the Benkadi group, prepares and sells food dishes. She plans to use her loan to buy a significant stock of beans, rice, oil and other ingredients for preparing food. She gets her goods at the markets in Boura and Koury. She sells her food at the crossroads for cash to a diverse and varied customer base. While the members of the Benkadi group plan on making a monthly profit of 110,000FCFA each during the cycle, Safoura Cissé expects to make 130,000FCFA. Apart from repaying the loans, they use part of their income to cover their families' running costs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for restauration

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Fifty-year-old Alberto O. is from the town of Banga. He is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Alberto raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Alberto has been engaged in his business for over 18 years already. Alberto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alberto is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This will be the first loan taken out by Alberto from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business. About CEVI Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Las Morenas 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Morenas 2 está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Janeth del Socorro Dávila A., coordinadora del grupo. Ella inicio vendiendo juguetes y ropa actualmente comercializa productos de belleza pero con este préstamo piensa invertir en ropa.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Alma Iris S.  quien inicio hace 1996 con la venta de hielo a las refresquerías y actualmente ha incursionado en el comercio de cosméticos y Elisabeth Jessenia L.  quien comercializa ropa interior.
texts.en:
The group “Las Morenas 2” consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Janeth del Socorro Dávila A., the group coordinator. She started selling toys and clothes, but she currently sells beauty products. However, she plans to use this loan to buy clothing.

Her fellow group members include Alma Iris S., who started in 1996 selling ice to snack bars but now has ventured into the cosmetics business. Elisabeth Jessenia L. sells undergarments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna D. is from the village of Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 53 years old. Myrna is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Myrna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the rice-farming business

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Mikael Parkuyiare

texts.en:
Mikael Parkuyiare N. is 23 years old, single and, for the last three years, has made a living as a farmer.  He lives in a fertile region which is well-known for producing large wheat crops. 

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign conducted by our organization in his area. He is applying for his first loan, which he will use to buy pesticides to protect his crop from pests. He hopes to use the additional profit made possible by this loan to acquire more land for his farm. This will allow him to meet a rapidly-growing demand for wheat. 

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and own farm machinery.

Mikael is a young and energetic man who can do more if he receives financial help.

loans.use: To buy pestsides for his wheat farm.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is an active member and treasurer of Thoth Ber Group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He has been practising mixed farming for 25 years and has employed one farmhand. His main products are maize, beans, nappier and bananas, which he sells at the local market. He also earns income from his rental houses in the same area.

David has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says with this loan he will be able to provide his family with enough milk for consumption, get enough manure for the crops - especially nappier - and sell milk, which will increase his income. His main challenge is the lack of organised markets and the unpredictable weather patterns. He hopes that his business will have improved in five years time and he will have acquired other dairy cows.

David is 52 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 10 children who are between the ages of 6 and 27. Six of the children are currently in school.

He is asking Juhudi to organize and empower farmers by teaching them better and improved farming methods. He is also grateful and hopes for more loans in future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marcial  Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Marcial se dedica a la elaboración de salteñas y otros en su domicilio con la ayuda de su esposa quien las vende en la avenida principal de la zona, la actividad que realiza la pareja les ayuda a sustentar a su familia ya que es el único ingreso que tienen para los gastos de la alimentación y pagar los estudios de los hijos que están en colegio, podemos indicar también que los clientes son bastantes trabajadores y responsables ya que se esfuerzan para cancelar sus obligaciones, por lo que se vio por conveniente darles la tasa kiva, con el dinero del crédito compraran harina, ají picante, papa por cantidad para la elaboración de las riquísimas salteñas que elabora el Sr. Marcial.
texts.en:
Marcial makes salteñas (savory baked turnovers) from his home, helping his wife who also makes and sells them along the main road of the region. The business that this couple carries out helps them support the family, this being their only source of income. This income covers their food and the tuition for the kids who attend school. They are hard working and responsible people that invest their energy in covering their expenses and obligations. With the loan they will purchase flour, garlic, chili powder and potatoes to make their exquisite salteñas.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Ekyerisho Traders, Mubende Group

texts.en: N. Asia, age 36, has been operating an agricultural farm from Ekyerisho Traders of Mubende for 1 year. There he grazes cattle and sells milk to earn his living. The married father of six children is hard working and looks forward to owning a bigger farm in the near future that will also allow him to sell some of his cattle for meat. N. is seeking a loan to help him purchase more cattle to restock his farm, in order to be able to earn more revenue out of his milk sales. With this, he will be able to cater to his family needs and educate his children.

loans.use: purchase of more cattle for milk production

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: El Sr. Moisés Vive en la localidad de el Torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, en la casa de su hermana, tiene su lote de terreno donde piensa a construir su vivienda, su actividad es la de servicio de moto taxi urbano, el destino del crédito es para comprar ganado y venderlo en la feria. Su esposa se dedica a labores de la casa y en las noches estudia, hace diez año que se dedica a este negocio, es nacido en el departamento, y desde pequeño tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres de escaso recursos, es muy trabajador y un joven responsable, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Moisés lives in El Torno, 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz, in his sister’s house.  He owns a lot where he plans to build his house.  

He is an urban mototaxi driver but the loan will be used to buy cattle for subsequent resale at the livestock fair.

His wife is a housewife and goes to school at night.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He was born in this department and has worked since he was a child to help his parents who were of few resources.

He is a very hard working, responsible young man.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Leonideza

texts.en:
Leonideza R. is from the village of Imbatuhon, Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonideza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, biscuits, breads and snack food to the local community. Leonideza has had her business for more than one year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonideza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonideza successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Leonideza is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory for her store, and as working capital.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for a small general store, and as working capital

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar encerrada por muchos cerros que rodean la urbe.

Para la señora María este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque se siente cómoda en el Banco. Tiene 37 años de edad, está divorciada y de esa relación tuvieron dos hijos de 17 y de 13 años, los mismos que están en el colegio y la mayor en la Universidad.

Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ropa y zapatos, todos estos productos son de catalogo, además fabrica y vende especias, las mismas que entrega a una distribuidora local, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 18h00, lo que es ropa y zapatos los deja a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos en especial ropa de damas. Sus sueños son tener un gran almacén o una fábrica de especias bien estructurada.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Communal Bank “Constructoras del Éxito” (Builders of Success) meets every fifteen days. This city has long been known as the “City of the Valley” because of the many surrounding hills.

Sra. María is in her third loan cycle with the Communal Bank and likes the fact that she feels comfortable in her group. She is divorced and has two chidren, ages 17 and 13. One child is in high school while her oldest is attending university.

María sells cosmetics, clothing, and shoes from a catalog. In addition, she prepares spices and delivers them to a local distributor. She works every day from 8am to 6pm. María sells clothing and shoes on credit and collects payment weekly or every fifteen days.

This loan will be used to buy more products, especially women’s clothing. Her dreams include having a large warehouse or a spice factory that is well-structured.

loans.use: Purchase women's clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and spices

loans.name: Diego Milan

texts.es:
Diego tiene 21 años de edad, estudia II año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en Chinandega; su Mamá es Ama de Casa  su Papá se dedica a la agricultura y la Ganadería, y esto lo motivo a estudiar esta Carrera, viaja desde Chinandega a Estelí cada 15 días.
