A los 7 años comenzó a trabajar con su Papa. Su Papa y un hermano que vive en Estados Unidos le ayudan a pagar la universidad. Se dedica a la compra-venta de Ganado. 
El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Cultivar Repollo.
Su Objetivo es Coronar su carrera y trabajar por su propia cuenta en Agricultura y Ganadería, y le gustaría adquirir un nuevo crédito para comenzar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Diego, 21, is a second year Agronomy and Cattle Raising student.  He lives in Chinandega.  His mother is a housewife and his father is a farmer and cattleman; this is what motivated to study this particular career.  He travels from Chinandega to Estelí every two weeks.  He started working with his father when he was 7 years old.  His father who is a cattle merchant and a brother who lives in the United States help him pay his university costs.  

He negotiated this loan to buy supplies for a university project: to grow cabbage.

His goal is to complete his studies and to work for himself in this field.  He’d like to get another loan to start his own business.

loans.use: Agronomy Student Project:  Vegetable (Cabbage) Farming.

loans.name: Karen Margarita

texts.es:
Karen de 20 años, tiene una pequeña papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, es madre soltera. Vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Escogió tener una papelería porque su hijo pequeño necesitaba tener una mejor viva económica ya que es madre soltera. Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar diversa papelería, cuadernos, plumas. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am vendiendo cuadernos a $ 1.00, plumas, lápices, papelería etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas, papelería y otros artículos para su papelería. En el futuro quiere seguir con su negocio y si es posible agrandarlo más con mas mercadería.
texts.en:
Karen, who is a 20 year old single mother, has a small stationery shop in the front part of her house. She lives in a built-up area on the edge of the city, where most of the inhabitants are informal traders.

She chose to have a stationery shop because her little son needed to have a better life economically, because she is a single mother. Little by little, with a lot of effort, she was able to buy a range of stationery items, notebooks and pens. At the moment she works from 8am, selling one-dollar notebooks, pens, pencils, paper, etc.

With the loan she wants to buy similar items for her stationery shop. In future she wants to continue with her business and if possible expand with more merchandise.

loans.use: Notebooks, pens, stationery

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Mrs. Genevieve L. is from the barangay (village) of Baybay Triunfo in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married to Edwin L., and blessed with 5 children. All of her children are in high school or elementary school. To make a living, she buys and sells used clothing, known as ukay-ukay. She also receives regular support from her husband, who is a driver. She’s been engaged in her used clothing business for more than 8 years. She earns at least Php 3,000.00 per month from her business. 

Just this year, Genevieve joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, Genevieve is now requesting a first loan of Php 10,000.00 to use as additional capital for her used clothing business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible future land acquisitions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her used clothing business

loans.name: Mrs. Sorth Chansok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorth C. is a village bank president who has been selected by 20 people who make up a village bank loan. Each loan member seeks to improve their family's standard of living with their portion of the loan located in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province. 

She is a farmer who grows rice to support her family while her husband, Mr. Leas SoE., is a fisherman who is able to earn some money to support his family.

In the rice field, she has a problem because her field is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve her production, Mrs. Sorth C. is applying for a loan to buy a water machine. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a laborer in Thailand while the other one is a farmer and the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan C. is from the barangay of P-2 Carangan, Ozamiz City. He is 40 years old. Alan is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Alan owns and operates a motor cab.  He is also engaged in hog raising activities. He has been running these businesses for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Alan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used as working capital for his hog raising business. This will be the 2nd loan taken by Alan from PMPC.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital for hog raising business

loans.name: Trinidad (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Trinidad esta formado por 12 mujeres que viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia es considerada como el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que desde allí se puede observar la mayor parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, también a la cría de animales y a la agricultura. Nuestras socias  trabajan día a día en el campo o en diferentes actividades para sacar  adelante a sus familias.

La Señora. María G. es socia del banco comunal Trinidad, vive por el sector de San Pedro que  pertenece a la parroquia de Turi, se encuentra en el onceavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta por que tiene muy buenas amigas con quienes se distrae  en cada reunión. 
La Señora María tiene 51 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, cuatro de ellos son casados y viven  independientes, sus hijos de 18, 16, 14 años de edad estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo han construido su casa propia. 
Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría animales como gallinas y cuyes que los  venden en su comunidad y también son para su consumo. 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su sueño es  arreglar su casa.

La Señora Zoila Cecilia M. es socia del banco comunal Trinidad, vive por el sector de la Asunción en la parroquia de Turi. Tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuela de la ciudad y su segundo hijo está en el pre kínder. Su esposo labora como albañil. 
Doña Cecilia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cría pollos.
Fue socia antes pero por motivos de fuerza mayor tuvo que salir del banco y hoy se encuentra reingresando. El dinero de su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Trinidad  Communal Bank is comprised of 12 women who live on the outskirts of the Turi parish.  This parish is considered to be the viewpoint of the city of Cuenca because you can see most of the city from this parish.  Its people work in commerce, are farmers, and raise animals.  Our members work day to day in the field or in different business activities in order to get their families ahead.

María G. is a member of the Trinidad Communal Bank.  She lives in the San Pedro sector in the Turi parish.  She has her 11th loan with the communal bank.  She likes the communal bank because she has many good friends in the bank, and they entertain each other at each meeting.

María is 51 years old, married, and has seven children.  Four of them are married and live independently.  Her children that are 18, 16, and 14 attend a city school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  Through his work efforts they have built their own house.

María devotes herself to the household chores.  Because she is at home, she raises animals like chickens and guinea pigs.  She sells them in her community, and they are also for her consumption.

She will use the money from the loan to buy chickens.  Her dream is to remodel her house.

Cecilia M. is a member of the Trinidad Communal Bank.  She lives in the Asunción sector of the Turi parish.  She is 27 years old and married.  She has two children, ages 9 and 4.  His first child goes to a city school, and her second child is in pre-school.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  Through their work as a couple they have managed to build their own house.

Cecilia does the household chores, and she raises chickens.  She was a member before, but due to circumstances beyond her control, she had to leave the bank.  She has now rejoined.  She will use the money from the loan to buy chickens.  Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: 42-year-old T. Lilian sells bananas in Kanyanka Food market-Rukungiri. Weekly this business generates shillings 120,000 as sales profits. Before she embarked on this business, Lilian, who is a happily married mother of four, says she was selling used clothing. She still sells old clothes though it is now more of a secondary business. She says with this loan she is going to buy manure for her banana gardens.

loans.use: The purchase of manure for her banana gardens

loans.name: Hans Enrique

texts.es: Hans Enrique H. de 26 años de edad, es un padre de familia muy responsable con su esposa y un hijo de 3 años de edad, junto a quienes reside en el departamento de Coatepeque, en el departamento de Santa Ana. Para ganarse el sustento diario, Hans posee una venta y reparación de llantas, tanto nuevas como usadas, así mismo comercializa diferentes tipos de repuestos para automóviles. Él es un hombre muy trabajador, el cual desea mucho salir adelante y de esta forma mejorar la vida de su familia, principal razón por la que solicita un préstamo por medio pueda comprar mayor cantidad de llantas nuevas y usadas, y también para comprar repuestos  y herramientas para elaborar un mejor trabajo. De esta forma Hans espera mejorar y así contar con todo lo necesario y básico en su hogar.
texts.en:
Hans Enrique H., age 26, is a responsible husband and father of a three year old son. He and his family reside in Coatepeque in the Department of Santa Ana. In order to earn a living, Hans manages a shop where he sells and repairs tires, both new and used. He also sells different types of automobile parts.

Hans is a hardworking gentleman who has tremendous desire to succeed and provide his family a better life. The main reason for requesting this loan is to buy a large quantity of new and used tires. He will also buy parts and equipment that will help him do his job better. Hans expects to improve so that he can have everything he needs for his home.

loans.use: Purchase new & used tires

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle I. is from the village of Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 34 years old. Anabelle is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Anabelle owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, in the local community. Anabelle has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Anabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anabelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie L., a high school graduate, is married to Recto L., a school service driver. They have been blessed with six children who are still studying. Together, they live in Ilayang Pulo, Silang, Cavite, Philippines.
Rosalie has raised ornamental plants in her home yard for years now. She manages a plant nursery where she takes care of and sells ornamental and flowering plants. This business has been providing for her family for many years. She also manages the operation of their motorized tricycle transport business. She earns an estimated net income of around 14,000 PHP per month.
To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP. She plans to use this amount to purchase additional young ornamental plants to raise and sell. She will also use part of the loan for the maintenance of their motorized tricycle unit.
Rosalie dreams of having a car or van to be used as a delivery vehicle for customers' orders outside their town. She prays for good health and for her children to be able to finish their college education. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional young ornamental plants and other planting materials

loans.name: Migdonia

texts.es:
Migdonia Nicolasa L., mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora originaria de Pacayita, Masaya. Ella tiene una comideria  desde hace 10 años la cual inicio con unos ahorros y con los prestamos ha ido aumentando. 
Ella vende la comida especialmente a domicilio e invertirá en la compra de  granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, aceite, sal), carne, tomate, repollo, zanahoria, cebolla… etc.
texts.en: Migdonia Nicolasa L. is a hard-working and enterprising woman originally from Pacayit, Masaya, Nicaragua. She has had an eatery for the past 10 years, which she started with savings and loans, and it has been growing. She sells food especially at home and will invest the loan in the purchase of basic grains (rice, beans, oil, salt), meat, tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, onions and other items.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains (rice, beans, oil, salt), meat, tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, onions and other items

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Durante mucho tiempo Sofía se dedico a la venta D. hamburguesas debido a su embarazo  debido al esfuerzo que requería su trabajo  dejo D. hacerlo,  por algún tiempo  no trabajo para dedicarse a su hijo  pero después D. un año busco la manera D. volver a empezar  y fue su nuera quien  la motivo a dedicarse a la venta D. ropa  un negocio muy rentable le enseño los lugares donD. comprar ropa a menor costo y D. buena calidad ,es así que poco a poco empezó ganando clientela primero entre sus amistades y conocidos , ahora le va muy bien  en su negocio  y esto  le permite tener solvencia económica para ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, el préstamo que le otorga EDAPROSPO le servirá para comprar ropa D. invierno como chompas, buzos y casacas.  Su meta mas próxima es tener su propia boutique D. ropa ya tiene el lugar adecuado en su misma casa  y una buena ubicación  por ser una avenida muy transitada, ella es miembro del grupo “ AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE”  todas son vecinas D. Ventanilla – Callao.

  * Sofia esta con polo amarillo.
texts.en:
For a long time Sofía sold hamburgers.  When she became pregnant she left this work because of the effort it required.  For a time she did not work in order to devote herself to her son but after a year she looked for a way to start again and her daughter-in-law encouraged her to go into clothing sales, a very profitable business.  She showed her the places to buy good quality clothes at lower prices.  Gradually she started to acquire clientele first among her friends and acquaintances.  Today she does quite well in the business and this allows her to have financial solvency to help her children with their education.

The loan EDAPROSPO is granting her will be used to buy winter clothes like sweaters, sweatshirts and jackets.  Her next goal is to have her own clothes boutique; she already has space set up for this in her home and it’s a good location because it’s located on a very busy avenue.  

She is a member of the AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE (Friends Forever) group and all of them are neighbors from Ventanilla, Callao.

*Sofía is wearing the yellow shirt.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth nació en la ciudad de Cusco y es madre de dos niños, ella tiene 43 años de edad y vive junto a su pareja en una casa ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco, Perú.  Este lugar se caracteriza por ser un sector turístico, ganadero, agrícola y por estar habitado de gente emprendedora que se identifica con el refrán de la localidad que dice: “Provincia Arqueológica del Perú"”.

Con más de 10 años de experiencia como artesana y actualmente trabaja en el pequeño taller en su domicilio, ella implemento y acomodo un lugar de su casa para trabajar con tranquilidad y seguridad, ella también vende en el Mercado Modelo de Artesanos de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Elizabeth solicita un préstamo a la Asociación Arariwa de 400 nuevos soles que utilizará para comprar materiales como por ejemplo cola, pintura, esmaltes y otras cosas más para poder tener un mayor capital. Esto le permitirá expandir su negocio obteniendo mayores ganancias para el bienestar de sus hijos.

Elizabeth cuenta con buena reputación en Asociación Arariwa, pues con anterioridad éste ha tenido varios créditos cancelados con puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Elizabeth was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 43 years old, has two children, and lives with her partner in a house which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department, Peru.  This area is known for its tourism, livestock raising, farming and the fact that it is inhabited by entrepreneurial people who feel part of the "Arqueological Province of Peru".

Elizabeth has more than ten years' experience as a craftswoman and currently works in a small workshop which is located in her home.  She set up and adapted a place in her home so that she could work safely and peacefully.  She also sells her products in the Mercado Modelo craft market in the city of Urubamba.  She has been in this business for three years and it is doing very well thanks to the commitment that she puts into her work.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan for 400 Peruvian soles from Asociación Arariwa to buy materials such as glue, paint, varnishes and other products so that she has more capital.  This will allow her to expand her business and make more profits to contribute towards her children's well-being.

Elizabeth has a good reputation with Asociación Arariwa because she has already had several loans which she repaid on time and responsibly.

loans.use: to buy materials such as glue, paint and varnishes

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao, 36, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean sites. Mao and her husband raise ducks to sell, earning an income of 5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 20 USD on food and 40 USD on the other necessary expenses. Mao is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more ducks to raise for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy ducks to raise for sale

loans.name: Dios Ante Todo 1 - 2 Group

texts.en:
Margo is the coordinator of her group, Dios Ante Todo 1, 2 (God first), located in a village where most of the citizen are Haitians. She lives in a modest home with one of her three children. With this effort, she can make extra income and help her long-term partner. In the meantime, she enjoys doing business.

Margo is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for almost one year, after starting by selling a dozen pairs of jean pants she bought with her first loan. Now she has a clothing sales business and will start to sell coffee and breakfast in the mornings, so she is planning to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing, in different sizes for men and women, as well as coffee, sugar, sausages and other items to be able to offer some meals in the mornings. She will reinvest the profits in her business by purchasing more products and expanding her business with more options and new clients. She is dreaming to become someone with a very important business.

Margo represents her group and many Haitians who emigrated to the Dominican Republic to improve their lives. In this group are a sample of ten Haitian families fighting to overcome the Haiti crisis. Thanks to all of you for supporting this group.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear; also coffee, sugar and sausages, etc., to expand her business.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon has practiced farming in Njabini for the last five years. He is 37 years old, married to Ruth and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fifth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Gideon hopes to become a leading farmer in Njabini town.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a young man from Deir Al Balah in Gaza Strip. Hasan has a small store selling computer accessories such as mice, keyboards, covers, cleaning liquids, etc.

Hasan has been working in his store for two years now. He came to FATEN asking for a loan to purchase a large amount of items to sell, which will increase the income he makes and attract more customers. 

Hasan is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to purchase computer accessories such as mice, keyboards, covers, etc

loans.name: Noche Buena Group

texts.es:
La señora María Efrocinia es integrante del grupo "Noche Buena", ella  es casada con el señor Alberto con quien procreo un hijo de nombre Luis Enrique de catorce años de edad.
Ella solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes, en donde  lleva diez meses  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso para su familia ya que su hijo está estudiando y quiere darle lo mas necesario.
Ella se inspiro en esta actividad ya que  también quiere apoyar a su esposo con el ingreso de su hogar, así juntos salir adelante como familia  unida,y para pagar el crédito solicitado.
Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo pueda continuar trabajando para mejorar sus ingresos y así poder apoyar a su hijo  a  que termine su carrera.
Las personas que integran en el grupo son las siguientes: Fabiola Patricia quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración dulces, la señora Betzaida invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de ganados y por último la señora Adelina quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para a la elaboración de tamales
texts.en:
Maria Efrocinia is a member of the group "Noche Buena". She is married to Alberto and they have a son named Luis Enrique who is 14 years old.

She asked for a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to make breads. She has been doing this for 10 months and tells us that it is going well and has been a good source of income for her family, since her son is studying and she wants to be able to give him what he needs.

She was inspired to start baking because she also wanted to support her husband in bringing income into the home, so they can move ahead together as a united family and pay off their loan.

What she wants more than anything is that with her small business and this loan she will be able to continue working to increase her income and be able to support her son until he finishes school.

The members of the group are: Fabiola Patricia, who will invest in ingredients for making candies; Betzaida, who will invest in the purchase and sale of cattle; and finally Adelina, who will invest the loan in ingredients to make tamales.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en: Luke is a thirty-six-year-old married man with five children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has a retail shop, hardware shop and bar business which he has operated for six years. His hardships are debtors, price fluctuations and high transport costs, and his vision is a large scale retail shop plus an educated family. Luke intends to use the credit facility to buy iron sheets, sugar and clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets, sugar and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 54 years old and is married with seven children between the ages of 11 and 27 years old. She takes care of one other relative. Her business is well organized. She has six years of experience and she sells charcoal.

Beatrice has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business, save for the future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mady

texts.es: Mady de 30 años vive con sus dos hijos en las edades de 5 y 6 años respectivamente, los cuales son su motor para esforzarse trabajando todos los días de su vida, en su peluquería donde ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional a damas caballeros y niños, allí maneja las líneas de corte de cabello, tratamientos capilares, pedicure, manicures y hasta asesorías de aplicacion de productos. Mady vivió muchos años en Venezuela, país fronterizo, y desde hace 5 años regresó a Colombia y emprendió su aventura de negocio que hoy está empreñada en hacerlo crecer y es también su proyecto de vida. Su acogida en el mercado ha sido muy buena y a este negocio ha agregado dos vitrinas exhibidoras donde también vende los productos que usualmente usa y recomienda. Su creciente clientela hace que su capital de trabajo sea insuficiente para atender la demanda, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva para comprar insumos de peluquería shampoo, masajes, tintes, y demás productos capilares en volumen los cuales aplicará y también venderá a clientes que se los han encargado, siendo este el éxito de su inversión. Su meta más adelante es contratar una nueva empleada y hacer algunas reformas locativas, con el fin de lograr un lugar confortable para sus clientes y aumentar el número de ellos. Mientras esto ocurre, maneja un margen de utilidad no inferior al 70% y una rotación de inventarios de materias primas de 15 días, indicadores  desde los cuales potencializa su crecimiento
texts.en:
Mady is 30 years old and lives with her two children, ages 5 and 6 respectively.  They are the motivation behind all of her daily efforts in life.  Mady has a beauty salon where she offers personal and professional image makeover services for women, men, and children.  She provides haircuts, hair treatments, pedicures, manicures, and even product application advice.  For many years, Mady lived in the neighboring country of Venezuela but returned five years ago to Colombia to start her business venture.  Today her business has grown and has now become her life’s project.  Her reception in the marketplace has been very good.  Mady acquired two display cases for her business where she stores the products that she uses and recommends.  Even though her customer base is growing, she has insufficient operating capital to keep up with demand.  

For this reason she has requested a Kiva loan to buy beauty supplies such as shampoos, massagers, dyes, and other hair care products in bulk to use in her salon and to sell to customers who have ordered them.  Mady hopes that this will be a successful investment.  Her goal moving forward is to hire a new employee and make a few structural changes so that her salon will be a comfortable place for her customers and attract more business.  In the meantime, she manages a profit margin of no less than 70% and an inventory turnover period of 15 days.  These indicators signal her potential for growth.

loans.use: to purchase shampoos, massagers, dyes, and other hair care products in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, ready-to-eat products, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married with five school-aged children. She is 36 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City.
Letecia sells fertilized duck eggs (balut) to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase tricycle use for transportation for the selling of her balut business. 
Letecia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Letecia hopes to send her children to college so they can have their own business.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle use for transportation for the selling of her balut business

loans.name: Argentina De Los Reyes

texts.es:
La señora, Argentina de 60 años posee su negocio desde hace 22 años el cual consiste en compra y venta de productos de artesanía, ella viaja fuera del país ya que ahí tiene su propia clientela por vender productos artesanales de alta calidad. 

Ella se acerca a las oficinas de Ceprodel para solicitar un préstamos y de esa manera poder cubrir con la demanda que está teniendo actualmente. Con el crédito comprará sandalias de damas y niñas, maxi bordados, etc. Considera que esto le ayudará a ofrecer más productos y tener un mayor ingreso en sus ventas y con esto darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Señora Argentina, age 60 years old, has had her business for 22 years. It consists of buying and selling craft products: she travels outside the country because she has a loyal clientele to who mshe sells her high quality crafts. She has approached [the field partner] Ceprodel for a loan, and with it she will be able to meet the consumer demand she has at the moment. With the loan she will buy women's and children's sandals, embroidered tops, etc. She says this will help her to offer more products and increase her inome from sales, and with this she will be able to give her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy women's and children's sandals, embroidered tops, etc

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira tiene ya más de cinco años con su negocio de venta de perfumes.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar productos de perfumes y pintura de belleza para dama y productos de caballera, ya que le esta haciendo falta mercancía y sus clientes le están solicitando para regalar ahora en las fiestas de navidad. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que su esposo el señor Eriban se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en un taller mecánico (automotriz)
Desea mejorar los ingresos de su familia y que tengan lo necesario y con esta inversión en su negocio lo lograr.
texts.en: Elvira has been selling perfume for over five years.  She’s asking for a loan to buy perfume, women’s makeup and hair products because she’s low on this merchandise and her customers are asking for it to give as Christmas gifts.  She plans to repay the loan with profits she gets from her business since her husband, Eriban, will take care of family and school expenses of their two children with the salary he earns working as an auto mechanic.  She wishes to improve family income so that they will have what they need and she will attain this with this investment in her business.

loans.use: to buy perfume.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: La señora Daniela es cliente de la institución trabajo con el banco de emprendimiento Barrio municipal la señora Daniela vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Bella Vista, Daniela vive en la casa de sus padres por que le ayudan con su pequeña hijita de un año y medio, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en la parada del micro de la zona vende por las noches ya que ella esta estudiando todavía y como la venta la realiza durante dos horas le da tiempo de estudiar , también la Sra. Daniela elabora artesanías como ser collares aretes los cuales los realiza a pedido esto le ayuda a ella con la crianza y los gastos de su pequeña hijita, ella esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de material para las manualidades y compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, es una persona joven pero emprendedora, su deseo es el de poder terminar sus estudios y así de esta manera poder generar mas ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijita y de ella.
texts.en:
Daniela is a client of the institution.  She worked with the Barrio Municipal communal bank.  Daniela lives in her parents' house in the Bella Vista area.  She lives with her parents because they help her with her young daughter, age one and one-half.

Daniela works selling food at the area bus stop.  She sells at night because she is still a student.  And since selling for two hours gives her time to study, she also makes handicrafts like necklaces and earrings, which she makes on order.  This helps her with raising her little girl and covering expenses.

She is requesting the loan to buy material for the handicrafts and to buy supplies to make her food.

She is a young but enterprising person.  Her desire is to be able to finish her studies and so be able to generate more income and improve her quality of life and her daughter's.

loans.use: to buy materials to make handcrafted necklaces and supplies to make food.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Dede est une femme âgée de  43 ans. Elle est mariée å un maçon carreleur. Elle a un enfant.
Dede  travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle  vend du jus, du yaourt et divers produits à domicile aux étudiants de son quartier qui en prennent a la sortie des cours et aux voisins. Elle  achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille avec un  membre de la famille. 
Dede a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du lait, du sucre et de l’eau en sachets (pure water).  
Dans les prochaines années, Dede voudrait acheter un nouveau réfrigérateur pour augmenter sa production de jus et de yaourts.
texts.en:
Dede is a 43-year old woman, who is married to a mason and tiler, and has one child. She has worked as a retailer since 2002 and sells juice, yoghurt and various other products at home to students in her neighborhood, who come and take them after their lessons, and to neighbors. She buys the products at Lomé's Grand Market. She works with another member of the family.

Dede has requested her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy milk, sugar and water in sachets (pure water). In the coming years, she would like to buy a new fridge in order to increase her quantities of juice and yoghurts.

loans.use: to buy sacks of milk and sugar and mineral water

loans.name: Talangi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Talangi Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Mercy is the facilitator of Talangi Group. She takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mercy had an excellent maize yield harvesting ten bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mercy was only able to harvest four bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mercy and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Mercy will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Talangi Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph, the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”HUCHUY QOSQO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Lamay en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lourdes;  La socia tiene 40 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 17, 10, 7 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores, la socia cría pollos, chanchos, cuyes, ella en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de pollos 10 pares y en dos semanas más comprar otros 10 pares de pollos, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un total de 20 pares de pollos para criarlos.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our associate belongs to the community bank "HUCHUY QOSQO", the bank is located in the district of Lamay in the province of Calca, department of Cusco.

Our associate is Lourdes, she is 40, has a common-law partner, has three children ages 17, 10 and seven, she buys and sells small animals, raises chicken,  pigs and cuye.  This time she wants to invest the loan in buying 10 pairs of chickens and in two weeks buy 10 more pairs.  She requests a loan to invest it in the purchase of a total of 20 pairs of chicken to raise them.

Our associate is thankful for the loan and commits to make the payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of chickens to raise them.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Josephine has a food shop, known in the Philippines as a "sari-sari" store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Vannet

texts.en:
Vannet is 30 years old and is married with two children. She resides with her husband and children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. Vannet is a farmer and she grows bananas at her own plantation. Her husband is a driver. 

Vannet is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to purchase rice to resell. In the future, she would like to build a warehouse to store rice in order to sell it when the price is higher. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house and support her children's education through college.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mariela, de 36 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Granada, ella logro estudiar solo la secundaria, se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y caballeros desde hace dos años . Su vida se divide en su faceta como madre y comerciante donde cada mañana se alista para preparar a sus hijos y llevarlos a la escuela y luego dirigirse a atender su negocio venta de ropa , abriendo su tramo desde tempranas hora vistiendo a los maniquíes de trajes para llamar la atención de sus clientes, ella es muy activa y le gusta estar en movimiento y contacto con la gente aunque es a veces es muy duro y cansado ella sigue ya que este negocio le ha permitido lograr independencia como mujer y salir adelante con sus hijos en busca de un mejor futuro para ellos.
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar ropa de vestir para damas y caballeros. Pues al variar los estilos y buscar prendas accesibles le permiten que se mueva su mercadería y logre vender. Una de sus metas es ampliar su venta de ropa incorporando nuevos productos para vender y hacer más atractivo su tramo pues le gusta ser dinámica a  la hora de vender y hacer la diferencia entre los demás comerciantes.
texts.en:
Mariela, age 36, has two children and lives in the city of Granada. She was only able to stay in school until the secondary level. She has sold men's and women's clothing for two years. Her life has two facets; that of mother and that of merchant. She gets up every morning to get her children ready and take them to school, and then she takes care of her clothing business. She opens her store early in the morning, dressing the mannequins in order to draw the attention of her customers. She is very active and enjoys being in motion and in contact with people, and she carries on even though it is very hard at times and she gets tired. This business has allowed her to achieve her independence as a woman and to get her children ahead. She is working for a better future for them.
She has taken out this loan for the purchase of men's and women's clothing. Through varying her styles and looking for accessible items, she is able to move her merchandise and sell it. One of her goals is to expand her sales and start selling new products in order to make her store more attractive. She enjoys being dynamic and distinguishing herself from among the other merchants.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Dios Verdadero 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the Group Dios Verdadero 2 & 4 (True God). This group located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Juana sells silver and gold jewelry. This is the ninth loan she has requested from Esperanza, and she is planning to purchase more jewelry to expand her business inventory. She is very excited about these loans, which made it possible to start her business almost five years ago, and she is still running it and expanding her sales into more products and clients.

Juana tells us that her challenge is to have a sustainable business, and to be able to provide for her four children and to help her long-term partner with extra income. Her business profits will be used to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy silver and gold jewelry.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders; meet Moses. He is a hardworking smallholder farmer from Kitale, Kenya. Moses has a wife, three daughters and a son. He has been doing mixed farming for five years now. He makes money selling eggs, tea, greens and also offering transportation solutions using his motorcycle. It doesn't stop there. He also engages in any other personal businesses he can get his hands on to make extra money.

Peter stated that he enjoys milking his cows. However, his biggest challenge is animal diseases. When diseases strike, cows become costly to look after. When unhealthy, Moses doesn't milk. Even as the animals recover, there is a significant drop in the amount of milk produced.  

Peter is seeking a loan to purchase another dairy cow. The new cow will slowly replace an aging cow that is slowly becoming less productive.  
Income generated from this investment will go towards his highest monthly expense - farming costs. Your loan will help in supplying all the nutritional needs of Peter’s family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari’s family moved from Huamanchuco to Chao, a valley on Peru's north coast 13 years ago.

At the beginning she and her husband Eduardo grew corn with chemical fertilizers but they realized that it was dangerous for their health. Talking to their neighbors, they learned about organic avocado production. They decided to plant organic avocados instead because they are healthy and more profitable. The couple wants to expand their organic avocado farm to give a better future for their small children (pictured with Mari here). 

Mari now manages the avocado field alone because Eduardo is very ill. Your loan of $700 will help them buy organic fertilizer to improve the yields of their avocado field.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers so she can grow more avocados

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a married woman. She has one child. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be richer. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиеру 36 лет. Он из города Турсунзаде. Он отец троих детей. Его жена работает учительницей в школе. Сам Бахтиер занимается животноводством и земледелием у себя во дворе. У него имеется коровник для выращивания скота. Бахтиер параллельно работает на земле. Он выращивает растение. Бахтиер любить трудится, и зарабатывать честно нажитым трудом. Он выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Сельскохозяйственной деятельности Бахтиер занимается уже 20 лет. Он освоил все навыки, совей работы. Бахтиер готовиться к зимнему посеву. Он решил обработать почву минеральными удобрениями, чтобы уничтожат насекомых и собрать качественный урожай. С такими планами Бахтиер запрашивает кредит.

loans.use: Для купли минеральных удобрений.

loans.name: Peskezia

texts.en: Paskezia is 27 years old, married with two children; She operates a retail shop for three years now. She a hard working woman with a zeal of seeing her family's standard of living improve using the proceeds from her business though faced with a challenge of competition, and price fluctuation. But she is trying to move on . Paskezia now wants to construct a house for her family thus requesting for money to buy materials like timber, and bricks for construction.

loans.use: to buy materials like timber, and bricks for construction.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 28 years old, married with no kids.She lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.She has four dependants including her parents.Agnes runs a tailoring business in a busy area of Ilala district.She attended a tailoring business offered by Vocational Education Training Authority(VETA) in Dar es Salaam.She has employed two assistants to help in her business.She makes and sell both men and women clothes.She is a good designer for female clothes,with this endowment she has regular customers as well as new ones.She came to notice that used clothes can also fetch a good market if they get repaired before being sold.She is in a plan to buy used clothes from wholesellers for resale after being repaired.She also want to add stock of sewing and tailoring materials.To make her plan work she is in need of USD 550

loans.use: Adding stock of sewing and tailoring materials

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustie is a 21 year old single woman.  She completed her secondary education, but was unable to continue further due to lack of money.  She started a business baking bread, and has been able to acquire a gas oven for her operations from the proceeds of her business.  She intends to use the proceeds of the KIVA loan so that she can pay cash for her flour purchases rather than buying flour on credit. This will enable Faustie to increase her profit margin and allow her to sell more baked goods.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for baking business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia has a small market where she sells school and office supplies, as well as other items. She started off just selling basic supplies but now also sells off-the-shelf food items and beverages. She is seeking a loan in order to invest in inventory for her business and increase her product diversity. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to save enough to make improvements to her home over the next year. She has two daughters, who are in school at the moment. Her husband is a handyman who supports his family and works very hard.

loans.use: to improve her inventory

loans.name: Laura Elena

texts.es:
Laura is 25 years old, married with two children. Her husband works in the countryside, harvesting sugar cane. She raises pigs, and with the loan she would like to buy more animals, as well as more food for them as they grow, as well as medicine to avoid illnesses and diseases among the animals. She is part of the group called Tierra Nueva 2 (new land 2), together with Maria Rita Mendez Montoya, who has a grocery shop, and Dalia Montoya Solano, who sells clothing. They would like to invest their parts of the loan, one to buy more stock for the grocery store and the other, more clothing to grow her sales.

Laura tiene 25 años, casada, dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo (siembra de la caña). Ella se dedica a la crianza de puercos, con el préstamo quiere aumentar la compra de animales, también alimento para su crecimiento, medicamentos para evitar plagas y enfermedades entre los animales. Forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Tierra Nueva 2 junto con: doña Maria Rita Méndez Montoya (tienda de abarrotes), Dalia Montoya Solano (venta de ropa). Ellas invertirán la parte su préstamo comprando una de ellas mercadería para abastecer mejor su negocio y la otra ropa en mayor cantidad para aumentar sus ventas.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Henry Hipólito

texts.es:
Henry is a young man that works hard each day in the stable that his father gave him. He works to continue what his father had been doing for many years in hopes of securing a promising future. He was born in Hualahoyo and his entire life has had a keen sense and great love for the land. 10 years ago he decided to begin working in the cattle and agriculture industry with hopes of becoming the best at his job, in order to carry on his parents' legacy. Recently he began to invest, and with great persistence, his beef is now of top quality and his hard work is paying off. Now he has decided to formally start his own cattle business that, even though small, has excellent production of dairy products, and he hopes to successfully continue with such excellent performance.

Since his parents' health has declined in the last two years, Henri has become responsible for supporting his family. He uses all of his earnings for their health expenses, hoping that they will get better. To meet his goals, he is asking for a loan of $550 USD to buy the products necessary to allow him better productivity. We support Henri in reaching success on his own land.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Henri es un joven que cada día trabaja arduamente en el establo que su padre le heredó para continuar con la labor que ha ido realizando durante largos años, piensa en forjarse un futuro bueno y prometedor. Nació en Hualahoyo y desde que tiene uso de razón siente un inmenso amor por su tierra es así que hace 10 años decidió dedicarse a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas con el deseo de convertirse en el mejor colaborador y brazo derecho de sus padres. En la actualidad instaló un pequeño criadero de cuyes al que dedica bastante empeño con el deseo de que cada día su carne sea de mayor calidad, los frutos de su esfuerzo han sido notorios y ahora ha decidido formalizar su propia empresa ganadera que aunque aún es pequeña tiene una excelente producción de artículos lácteos, anhela seguir preparándose y capacitándose para el desempeño exitoso de su labor.

Ahora se ha convertido en el sostén de su hogar ya que sus padres son de avanzada edad y la salud de uno de ellos está sumamente afectada hace dos años. a pesar de estas dificultades pone todas las ganas ya que quiere ver a su familia cada vez mejor.Para consolidar sus metas solicita un préstamo de 550 dólares para comprar el forraje necesario que le permitirá mayor productividad.Apoyemos a Henri a lograr el éxito en su propia tierra.

loans.use: To buy more and better feed for his cattle

loans.name: Vesile

texts.ru:
Vesile H. was born in 1978 in Agdam. She is a refugee and is not married. Currently she lives in Agsu. She sews leather jackets for women and men. This small business provides her with a small profit. Vesile will use her loan to replace her old sewing machine with a new one.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гусейнова Васила родилась 1978 году в городе Агдам. Беженка,не замужем. Данный момент проживает в городе Ахсу. Она щьет кожанные куртки для женщин и мужчин. Этот маленький бизнес дает ей небольшой доход. Швейная машина старая и она хочеть купит новую. Васила собирается взять кредит и написала заявление в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Sautaua

texts.en:
Sautaua is a lady of 42 years and is married with two children. She has been running her business for four years and is doing well.

She applied for this loan to buy materials and a new hand sewing machine to replace her old one.

Most of her clients come over to her place and give her their clothes to sew, but if it's slow, then she sews and sells at the flea markets.

She is aiming to buy an industrial sewing machine to make her work easier and quicker. That purchase will come from her next loan when she is finished paying her current loan. She also is planning to add an elei (a traditional Samoa fabric) business, because she’s good at it, and it goes together with her sewing business.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools for her sewing business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
20 years ago doña Ofelia started selling her and her 5 children’s used garments as she did not have enough money to feed her 5 children. She started placing the clothes on a sheet outside her home and little by little the business started growing thanks to her enthusiasm. Ofelia managed to make her children keep going and now they have their own families. Presently there are more clients for her second-hand garments and therefore Ofelia buys clothes at the border.

Nevertheless after the holiday season Ofelia does not have garments to offer and therefore she is requesting a loan of $925.00 to be repaid in 6 months and with this money she will purchase clothing in bulk to offer more variety. With your support doña Ofelia may earn enough to meet the expenses of herself and her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Hace ya 20 años que Ofelia comenzó a vender ropa de ella y de sus 5 hijos. Puesto que no contaba con el dinero suficiente como para poder mantener a sus 5 hijos. En un inicio tendía una sábana fuera de su casa y encima ponía toda la ropa. Poco a poco se comenzó a administrar y a crecer su negocio y gracias a su entusiasmo Ofelia logró sacar adelante a todos sus hijos quienes ya son padres de familia. Actualmente ya tiene más clientes que la buscan para comprarle ropa de segunda. Es por eso que Ofelia se va a surtir de ropa a la frontera.

Sin embargo después de la temporada de fiestas Ofelia no cuenta con ropa nueva para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes y es por eso que Ofelia está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ofelia podrá surtirse de pacas de ropa para poder brindar novedades a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ofelia podrá sacar dinero para poder pagar los gastos de ella y su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sale of used garments.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: Y. Salomat is 48 years old. She lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan and she is married and has 4 children. Mrs. Y. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006. Her business and the stability of her income helped her to repay her  previous loans on time and to improve the loan terms. She sells bakery products;  (rolls, spice cakes, cakes and etc). She has a good assortment and works only with the vendors that permit her to sell  the freshest baked goods. Now Mrs. Y. requests the loan of 1600 STJ so she can increase the assortment of baked goods she sells.

loans.use: To increase baked good inventory

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is 48 years old. From a very early age she has worked farming on her family ranch. However, when her children were young, she decided to take on another job because her income was not sufficient. At first she found the opportunity to sell fruits in the market and this is how her business started. Then she began selling flowers. And gradually, over 24 years, her business has grown to obtain two posts where she sells flowers and fruits throughout the year.

In all this time she has managed, along with her husband, to raise their eight children, give them a better education and a chance for a good future - this has been her purpose for working so hard. In the future, Isabel hopes to open a bazaar at home and be able to run her business from there.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel es una mujer de cuarenta y ocho años. Desde muy joven ha trabajado como agricultora en una chacra familiar. Sin embargo, decidió ocuparse en otro trabajo ya que tenia hijos pequeños y sus ingresos no eran suficientes. Encontró la oportunidad de vender frutas en el mercado y así empezó. Solo por temporadas vendía flores. Poco a poco, durante 24 años que lleva en su negocio, ha ido creciendo hasta obtener dos puestos donde vende en todo el año frutas y flores. En todo este tiempo ella ha sabido, junto a su esposo, criar a sus ocho hijos. Darles una mejor educación y la oportunidad de un buen futuro, a hecho que Isabel con muchas fuerzas trabaje a diario. En un futuro ella planea abrir un bazar en su casa y poder establecerse ahí.

loans.use: To establish two posts where she can sell flowers and fruit. (Implementar sus dos puestos, de flores y de frutas)

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia is a member of the Vecinas Unidas (United Neighbors) Community Bank, which is located at No. 480 Eduardo del Aguila Jr in the Calleria district, in the state of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and has five children. Her husband is a civil servant. Sofia invested her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos in a business selling snacks.

Sofia now owns her food and refreshments business. She gets up at 6:00 in the morning to make breakfast for her children and husband. After that she sells snacks near a school entrance until 1:00 in the afternoon.

With this loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $375), which will be paid back in four months, Sofia will purchase a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, oil, fried plantain chips, and five boxes of soft drinks.

Sofia is very proud of herself: her business is growing every day thanks to her determination to get ahead and support her children’s studies. Her children are her reason for being and for pressing forward. Sofia is also very thankful to Manuela Ramos for the support it has provided to her business.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Sofía pertenece al Banco Comunal Vecinas Unidas, ubicado en el Jr Morona 144, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es empleado publico. Sofía con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de refrigerios.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida y de refrigerios, se levanta a las 6 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, después se dedica a la venta de sus comidas y refrigerios en la puerta de un colegio hasta la 1 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, aceite, chifles, 5 cajas de gaseosa. etc.

Sofía esta muy orgullosa de si misma, su negocio esta creciendo cada día debido al empeño que ella le pone para salir adelante y así poder apoyar en los estudios a sus hijos pues son su razón de ser y de seguir adelante, ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of additional supplies for preparing food for sale

loans.name: Otilia

texts.en:
Otilia U., 32, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells her crops to local villagers and the public at the Fugalei market three days per week.

She has had three previous loans. Mrs. U. expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). This is her first business venture as she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. This loan will be used to purchase weed killer, chemicals, pesticides and tools for her plantation. Part of the loan will also be used to pay her children's education fees.

loans.use: To purchase weed killler, chemicals, pesticides and tools for the plantation
